title: Big Tech Expects Some Assets to Last Longer. But the Boost to Profit Is Temporary.
summary: A growing number of tech companies, including Alphabet, IBM, and Akamai Technologies, are extending the estimated working lives of their servers and network equipment. This accounting change reflects a slower pace of chip development and temporarily boosts profits by cutting costs at a challenging time for the industry. Other major tech firms like Meta Platforms, Microsoft, Oracle, and Amazon.com have also revised these estimates since 2022.

title: The Hackett Value Matrix Quantifies the Value Realized From Purchase-to-Pay (P2P) Software Solutions Providers
summary: The Hackett Group has released its Purchase-to-Pay (P2P) software solutions market intelligence research, featuring the Hackett Value Matrix. This research analyzes 10 leading P2P providers, identifying top performers like Coupa, JAGGAER, and SAP as achieving "Digital World Class" status due to their ability to deliver significantly higher value creation and advanced capabilities for digital transformation in procurement. The study highlights the substantial financial benefits and operational improvements companies can realize through these top-tier P2P solutions.

title: Best Buy’s Holiday Sneak Peek is Here
summary: Best Buy is kicking off its holiday shopping season in October with a "Holiday Sneak Peek," offering special purchase rewards, exclusive sale events, and benefits for My Best Buy Plus™ and My Best Buy Total™ members. The company will feature an expanded assortment of new and growing tech categories, including e-transportation and health/wellness products, along with various shopping experiences like Experience stores, Outlet stores, and the Virtual Store. Shoppers can also benefit from fast shipping options and convenient pickup services.

title: Cotações de Ações Americanas (STOCKS)
summary: The article provides a comprehensive list of American stock quotes (STOCKS), including company names and their respective stock symbols. It also features related news and analyses concerning major tech companies like Nvidia, Microsoft, Apple, Meta, and financial institutions like Coinbase and Visa, along with investment recommendations for international stocks.

title: DevSecOps: Strategies, Organizational Benefits and Challenges
summary: This Gartner report surveyed 300 IT leaders about DevSecOps adoption, benefits, and challenges. Key findings indicate rising adoption, with GitHub as a common tool, and a reduction in security incidents. However, organizations face technical and organizational challenges, particularly with tool implementation and developer responsibilities.

title: Arista Networks Unveils Zero Trust Networking Vision
summary: Arista Networks (NYSE: ANET) announced an expanded zero trust networking architecture designed to integrate security across devices, workloads, identity, and data. This initiative leverages Arista's technologies and strategic partnerships, including a key alliance with Zscaler, to enhance security and streamline workflows. The architecture aligns with the CISA Zero Trust Maturity Model and aims to overcome implementation challenges by utilizing existing network infrastructure.

title: Sophia Velastegui
summary: Sophia Velastegui is Senior Vice President and Chief Product Officer of Aptiv, an automotive and autonomous tech company, where she drives innovation and growth. She previously held significant roles at Microsoft, Google/Alphabet, Apple, and Applied Materials, and is recognized for her board directorships and contributions to AI and emerging technologies. Velastegui is an award-winning engineer with degrees from Georgia Tech and UC Berkeley, and has furthered her corporate governance expertise at Stanford Law and Harvard Business School.

title: The 10 Hottest Semiconductor Startups Of 2023
summary: CRN highlights the 10 hottest semiconductor startups of 2023, showcasing companies that are challenging established players in AI computing, addressing memory and data transfer bottlenecks, and innovating in cloud-native processors and telecom. These startups have achieved significant milestones this year, including major funding rounds, product launches, and growing customer and partner momentum, positioning them for success in a rapidly evolving industry. The article details each company's offerings and recent achievements.

title: 2023 Global Software Buying Trends
summary: This report explores the shifting landscape of B2B software buying trends in 2023, particularly focusing on SMBs. It highlights how macroeconomic factors are influencing demand and how businesses are researching, evaluating, and purchasing software. The insights aim to help software providers adapt their strategies for higher conversion rates.

title: Inflection AI Announces $1.3 Billion of Funding Led by Current Investors, Microsoft, and NVIDIA
summary: Inflection AI announced a $1.3 billion funding round led by Microsoft, Reid Hoffman, Bill Gates, Eric Schmidt, and NVIDIA, bringing its total raised to $1.525 billion. The funding will support the company's work on Pi, a personal AI designed for natural text and voice conversations. Inflection AI is also building the world's largest AI cluster with 22,000 NVIDIA H100 Tensor Core GPUs in partnership with CoreWeave and NVIDIA.

title: 2024 Generative AI Planning: How are IT Organizations Preparing?
summary: A Gartner Peer Community report from August 2023 surveyed 125 IT leaders on their organizations' Generative AI (GenAI) planning for 2024. Key findings indicate that most IT organizations are still in the research phase, with nearly half of those planning adoption starting with internal use cases. A significant majority expect their GenAI strategy to change and anticipate increased spending in 2024, often relying on vendors for implementation, particularly in customer service, resource automation, and software development.

title: IYW: Bill Gates Bought This Tech ETF. Should You?
summary: This article examines Bill Gates' recent acquisition of the iShares U.S. Technology ETF (IYW) in the third quarter, as revealed by 13F filings. It highlights IYW's strong long-term performance, comprehensive portfolio of top U.S. tech companies, and analyst ratings, while also noting its expense ratio compared to peers. The piece suggests that Gates' investment indicates continued opportunity in the tech sector.

title: Investing in AI
summary: Blackstone is making significant investments across the AI ecosystem, from infrastructure like data centers and renewable energy to AI-powered enterprise software and hardware. The firm leverages its scale and expertise to identify and capitalize on opportunities driven by explosive data growth and the increasing demand for AI-enabling technologies, while also deploying AI tools to enhance the performance of its portfolio companies. Key investments include AirTrunk, QTS, Invenergy, Coreweave, Vectra, and Ontra, demonstrating a comprehensive strategy to build stronger businesses and support the AI revolution.

title: Capital One Job Cuts Signal Trouble for IT Labor Market
summary: Capital One Financial Corp. has cut 1,100 positions within its technology department, specifically impacting its "agile" group. This move signals a potential spread of tech sector layoffs into corporate IT departments, which had previously been largely insulated. The job cuts reflect companies' belt-tightening measures amidst fears of a recession.

title: Cyber Hornet S&P 500 and Bitcoin 75/25 Strategy ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NASDAQ:ZZZ)
summary: The Cyber Hornet S&P 500 and Bitcoin 75/25 Strategy ETF (ZZZ) is an exchange-traded fund launched on December 28, 2023, by Onefund, which invests in a 75/25 blend of US large-cap stocks and front-month CME Bitcoin futures. It does not directly invest in Bitcoin's spot price. The ETF has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy," assets under management of $6.02 million, and a net expense ratio of 1.01%.

title: T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF): A Promising Active Fund
summary: The T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) has shown significant growth since its launch in June 2023, accumulating over $600 million in assets. The fund focuses on high-quality U.S. large-cap companies, employing a bottom-up stock selection approach with top holdings like Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. TCAF's investment philosophy emphasizes strong performance in areas like technology, healthcare, and consumer discretionary.

title: Use XMHQ, XSHQ to Fill Gaps in Quality SMID-Cap Exposure
summary: The article discusses how investors can use Invesco's S&P MidCap Quality ETF (XMHQ) and S&P SmallCap Quality ETF (XSHQ) to gain exposure to quality mid- and small-cap companies, complementing the Invesco S&P 500 Quality ETF (SPHQ). Both XMHQ and XSHQ have seen significant inflows due to market uncertainty, offering access to high-quality firms based on return on equity, accruals ratio, and financial leverage ratio. These funds introduce sector tilts, with SPHQ, for instance, overweighting IT, energy, and consumer staples.

title: The Rise of Smart Machines
summary: Advancements in AI and robotics are poised to revolutionize the industrial sector, driving a significant increase in automation and reshaping production lines. This shift will elevate human workers to supervisory roles over robots, boosting productivity and redefining labor's role in the global economy, fueled by capital investments and re-shoring initiatives. The article highlights the secular growth of the industrial robotics market and the expanding ecosystem it supports, including data centers and software providers.

title: Vice president of Advanced Micro Devices Jason Banta: ‘Computers with artificial intelligence will be able to anticipate our needs’
summary: Jason Banta, AMD's Vice President and General Manager, discusses the future of AI in computing, emphasizing its transformative potential to make computers more personal and anticipatory of user needs. AMD recently launched its MI300 accelerator, aiming to popularize smart laptops from 2024, with a significant inflection point expected in 2025. Banta also addresses the challenges of integrating AI into mobile devices, the importance of a diverse semiconductor supply chain, and the environmental considerations in AI development.

title: Ally Financial empowers customer service associates to focus on human engagement by using Azure OpenAI Service
summary: Ally Financial is leveraging Microsoft Azure and Azure OpenAI Service to enhance its customer service operations. By automating manual tasks like note-taking and call summarization with generative AI, Ally empowers its customer service associates to dedicate more time to direct human engagement with customers. This initiative has already reduced post-call effort by 30 percent and aims for a 50 percent reduction, leading to improved customer experience and associate satisfaction.

title: Midmark improves performance by up to 75 percent by migrating and running Oracle on Azure
summary: Midmark Corporation, a healthcare solutions provider, significantly improved its system performance by up to 75 percent through the migration of its business-critical Oracle environments to Microsoft Azure. Facing an explosion of on-premises data and aging infrastructure, Midmark utilized Azure DevOps pipelines and Terraform code to achieve greater flexibility, scalability, and better hardware. This successful transition has prompted Midmark to explore further Azure capabilities and adopt a cloud-first roadmap, benefiting employee perception and overall operational efficiency.

title: The Best Artificial Intelligence ETFs of 2023
summary: The article highlights the top-performing Artificial Intelligence (AI) ETFs of 2023, with returns as high as 71%. It details five specific AI ETFs, including thematic funds that invest in companies benefiting from AI growth and AI-powered funds that use AI to select stocks, identifying key holdings and year-to-date performance for each.

title: Google, AES, others to create marketplace for 24/7 hourly renewable energy certificates
summary: Google, AES, Microsoft, and Constellation have partnered with LevelTen Energy to create a marketplace for "granular certificates," a new type of energy attribute certificate that tracks renewable energy generation on an hourly, location-specific basis. This initiative aims to provide more accurate signals for renewable energy development and help corporate and utility buyers meet 24/7 clean energy goals. The platform is expected to launch next year, offering both forward and spot markets for these certificates.

title: Molecular Modeling Market Size, Growth, Trends & Demand Report by 2033
summary: The global molecular modeling market is projected to grow from USD 1.45 billion in 2025 to USD 5.11 billion in 2033, at a CAGR of 17.1%. This growth is driven by the increasing frequency of chronic diseases, leading to medication development, and significant R&D investments by pharmaceutical and biotechnology companies. Advancements in computational technologies, such as high-performance and quantum computing, are creating new market opportunities, while a shortage of skilled experts remains a key restraining factor.

title: BCE Inc. stock falls Monday, underperforms market
summary: BCE Inc. (BCE) stock experienced a drop of 0.65% on Monday, closing at C$54.84, thereby underperforming the broader Canadian market. The S&P/TSX Composite Index fell by only 0.06%. The company's stock is C$10.82 short of its 52-week high, and trading volume for the day significantly exceeded its 50-day average.

title: Epic, Elevance Health CEOs make a pitch for harnessing data, AI to support providers
summary: Epic and Elevance Health are collaborating to leverage massive clinical data and AI to support healthcare providers, aiming to improve patient outcomes and reduce administrative burdens. Epic is developing a "Best Care Choices for My Patient" tool and integrating generative AI with Microsoft, while Elevance Health uses its Health OS and AI to close care gaps and enhance provider directory accuracy. Both companies emphasize data integration and AI's role in creating "hyperconnectivity" and a more personalized healthcare experience.

title: AMD launches MI300, claims AI performance lead over Nvidia ...
summary: AMD has launched its Instinct MI300 series data center AI accelerators and ROCm 6 software stack, claiming a significant performance advantage over Nvidia's H100. The MI300 series comes in two variants, MI300x and MI300A, offering substantial memory and processing power for AI and high-performance computing. AMD highlights strong demand and adoption by major tech companies, positioning the MI300 as a leading solution for generative AI.

title: Just 3 of the "Magnificent Seven" Have Outperformed the S&P 500 Since 2022. Here's the One I'd Buy for 2024 and 2025.
summary: This article analyzes the performance of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks against the S&P 500 since 2022. It identifies Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple as the only three that have outperformed the S&P 500. The author argues that Alphabet, despite underperforming recently, is the best buy for 2024 and 2025 due to its valuation, potential in digital advertising, and cloud segment growth.

title: Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting 2023
summary: The 2023 Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting featured discussions on record financial results for FY23, strategic investments in AI, and responsible technology development. Key executives, including Satya Nadella, Amy Hood, and Brad Smith, addressed topics ranging from AI integration across product lines and revenue generation plans to safeguards against AI misuse, partnerships, and commitments to privacy and social responsibility. The meeting also covered the election of directors and various shareholder proposals.

title: AMD releases new chips to power faster AI training
summary: AMD announced the availability of its new MI300 chips, including the Instinct MI300X accelerator and Instinct M1300A APU, designed to power demanding AI training and large language models. The company also unveiled the Ryzen 8040 mobile processors, which will bring enhanced AI capabilities to laptops in 2024. These releases position AMD to compete more directly with Nvidia in the booming AI chip market.

title: AMD's highly anticipated MI300X AI chips hit general availability along with new Ryzen 8040 CPUs
summary: AMD announced the general availability of its new Instinct MI300X series data center AI accelerators and the Ryzen 8040 Series chips for smaller devices, marking a significant push into the AI market to challenge Nvidia. The MI300X series focuses on generative AI workloads and HPC performance, supported by launch partners like Microsoft, Oracle, and Meta, while the Ryzen 8040 CPUs bring AI capabilities directly to personal computers. AMD also introduced the ROCm 6 open software stack and previewed next-generation "Strix Point" CPUs, emphasizing AI as a top priority.

title: Oracle Recognized as a Leader in the 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Strategic Cloud Platform Services
summary: Oracle has been recognized as a Leader in the 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Strategic Cloud Platform Services, highlighting its growth and position among global hyperscale cloud providers. The recognition underscores Oracle's distributed cloud strategy, which offers flexibility, performance, and built-in security for diverse customer needs, including specialized offerings like Oracle Database@Azure and Oracle EU Sovereign Cloud. OCI's robust infrastructure also supports AI integration, offering advanced generative AI capabilities across its applications and database portfolio.

title: Why Investors Should Keep An Eye on Small-Cap Stocks
summary: This article discusses how the increasing concentration of market-cap-weighted indexes, particularly driven by large-cap tech stocks, is creating historical levels of concentration. It explores the implications for the size premium, suggesting that higher market concentration leads to increased expected returns for small-cap stocks due to capital misallocation and reduced investor demand for smaller firms, making them an attractive area for investors.

title: One ETF that focuses on employee happiness is outperforming the market this year
summary: An ETF focused on companies with high employee happiness, the Harbor Human Capital Factor U.S. Large Cap ETF (HAPI), has outperformed the S&P 500 this year, climbing nearly 25% compared to the benchmark's less than 20% gain. The fund's strategy is based on Irrational Capital's extensive employee surveys and publicly available data, creating a "human capital score" that is considered a novel and uncorrelated investment factor. While the large-cap HAPI fund includes major tech stocks contributing to its performance, a similar small-cap ETF (HAPS) is also available, offering potential for future growth.

title: Can digital watermarking protect us from generative AI?
summary: This article explores the use of digital watermarking and other authenticity technologies like Content Credentials to combat misinformation and copyright infringement from generative AI. It delves into the history of watermarking, current industry efforts, and alternative punitive tools like Nightshade being developed by researchers to protect content creators. The piece also discusses the challenges of regulation and widespread adoption of these protection measures.

title: Salesforce soars 8% as cost cutting shows its ‘brand new religion’ to increase profits
summary: Salesforce stock soared over 8% after announcing a profit forecast that exceeded analyst estimates, driven by its aggressive cost-cutting measures, including workforce reductions and a focus on increasing profit margins. CEO Marc Benioff's strategy, dubbed a "brand new religion," has pleased Wall Street despite some concerns about revenue growth, as the company integrates acquisitions and introduces AI features.

title: Gartner Hype Cycle Shows AI Practices and Platform Engineering Will Reach Mainstream Adoption in Software Engineering in Two to Five Years
summary: Gartner's Hype Cycle for Software Engineering 2023 indicates that AI-augmented software engineering, AI coding assistants, and platform engineering will achieve mainstream adoption within two to five years. By 2027, 50% of enterprise software engineers are expected to utilize machine learning-powered coding tools, significantly boosting productivity and allowing focus on higher-value tasks. Platform engineering is also highlighted as crucial for managing technological complexity, with 80% of software engineering organizations projected to establish platform teams by 2026.

title: SOPHiA GENETICS Expands Relationship with Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino (2023-11-28)
summary: SOPHiA GENETICS has expanded its partnership with Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino, one of Europe's largest university hospitals, to enhance data-driven medicine capabilities. The hospital will further utilize the SOPHiA DDM™ Platform, powered by Microsoft Azure, for research on homologous recombination repair (HRR) biomarkers in various cancers. This collaboration aims to streamline the analysis of complex genomic data and advance precision medicine.

title: Marsh McLennan launches AI tool
summary: Marsh McLennan and Oliver Wyman have launched LenAI, a new generative artificial intelligence tool for their 85,000+ colleagues worldwide. Developed by Marsh McLennan’s Dublin Innovation Center, LenAI is built on Microsoft and OpenAI technologies, ensuring data privacy and regulatory compliance. The tool aims to enhance productivity and assist clients in leveraging AI across various industries and applications.

title: Which Cloud Stocks are Benefitting from the AI Boom?
summary: Despite cloud computing being fundamental to AI programs, some cloud funds, like WisdomTree’s Cloud Computing Fund, have not fully capitalized on the AI rally. This article explores why emerging cloud stocks have lagged, highlighting that the primary beneficiaries are the major cloud infrastructure providers such as Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, which are part of the "Magnificent Seven" and have seen significant gains. It also discusses how these cloud leaders are preparing for future demands from generative AI and quantum computing through increased capital expenditure and strategic partnerships.

title: Which Cloud Stocks are Benefitting from the AI Boom?
summary: While cloud computing is fundamental to AI, some cloud-focused funds have underperformed despite the AI rally, suggesting a potential future bounce. The global cloud infrastructure market is dominated by Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, who are heavily investing in capacity and partnerships for generative AI. These "Magnificent Seven" companies have shown significant gains driven by the AI boom, indicating that the benefits of the AI-cloud synergy are largely accruing to the major infrastructure providers.

title: Diamond Sleet supply chain compromise distributes a modified CyberLink installer
summary: Microsoft Threat Intelligence has uncovered a supply chain attack by the North Korea-based threat actor Diamond Sleet (formerly ZINC). This attack involves a modified CyberLink application installer that includes malicious code and has impacted over 100 devices globally. Microsoft has taken steps to protect customers, including notifying CyberLink and adding the malicious certificate to its disallowed list, while also providing detection and mitigation guidance.

title: Consider IGPT as OpenAI Shake-Up Sparks Investor Interest in AI
summary: The article discusses the recent leadership turmoil at OpenAI and its impact on the artificial intelligence (AI) sector, highlighting increased investor interest. It suggests the Invesco AI and Next Gen Software ETF (IGPT) as a potential investment for those looking to target AI opportunities, noting that Microsoft, despite its role in the OpenAI drama, is not currently among IGPT's holdings. The IGPT fund focuses on platforms powering AI development, AI itself, and robotics/automation.

title: KPMG in Canada and Microsoft Canada launch Operational Risk Skills Development Centre to support Quebec’s Innovation Economy – Microsoft News Center Canada
summary: KPMG in Canada and Microsoft Canada have launched the Operational Risk Skills Development Centre in Quebec, a $1.7M three-year initiative to provide free digital skills training and certifications. The center will focus on cybersecurity protection and the responsible implementation of generative AI for businesses and governments. The project aims to address the significant concerns Canadian CEOs have about cybersecurity breaches related to generative AI and the increasing demand for cybersecurity skills.

title: Gaming Industry Charts a Rebound in 2023
summary: The gaming industry is experiencing a significant rebound in 2023 driven by strong console sales, new game releases, and innovations in mobile and cloud gaming. This recovery, following a dip in 2022, is further supported by anticipation of increased M&A activity and strategic moves by major players like Microsoft, Apple, and Netflix, positioning the sector for continued growth into 2024. The article highlights strong U.S. sales, hardware as a primary catalyst, and key factors like M&A and technological advancements shaping the industry's future trajectory.

title: SEC fines Charter Communications $25M over stock buybacks
summary: The SEC has fined Charter Communications $25 million for violating audit controls related to internal stock buybacks. The company is accused of using "accordion" provisions in its trading plans between 2017 and 2021, which allowed it to change the total dollar amounts and timing of buybacks after the plans were initiated, contrary to SEC rules and board approvals. This violation was attributed to insufficient internal accounting controls.

title: Beyond QQQ: Cloud, Cyber ETFs May Outperform
summary: This article suggests that while the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) has seen significant gains, its concentration in a few top stocks and high valuation present risks. It proposes alternative technology-driven ETFs focusing on cybersecurity, cloud computing, and data centers—like CIBR, SKYY, and VPN—as potentially more diversified and sustainable investment opportunities for investors looking beyond the "Magnificent Seven." The author cautions against the historical volatility of top-heavy indices as seen in the 1999-2000 Nasdaq boom and bust.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq At An All-Time High? History Offers a Clear Answer.
summary: This article discusses the Invesco QQQ ETF and whether it's a good investment despite the Nasdaq Composite being at an all-time high. It analyzes historical data of the Nasdaq's performance after reaching new highs, suggesting that further gains are common. The article concludes that dollar-cost averaging into QQQ is a sensible strategy regardless of market highs, as it tracks the Nasdaq 100 which tends to rise over time.

title: Carbon management technologies set to soar in Europe, with proactive policies key in unlocking its potential
summary: Europe is seeing increased investment and attention in carbon management technologies like carbon capture and storage (CCS) and carbon dioxide removal, crucial for meeting EU climate targets. Microsoft is a key investor in carbon removal, aiming to be carbon negative by 2030, and is also researching AI's role in these technologies. The article emphasizes that proactive policies, clear market conditions, and a distinction between carbon reduction and removal are essential for the widespread adoption and success of carbon management in Europe.

title: 3 undervalued artificial intelligence stocks
summary: This article identifies three undervalued artificial intelligence stocks—Snowflake, Cognizant Technology Solutions, and Salesforce—according to Morningstar analysts, while also highlighting dominant but fairly valued AI players like Nvidia and Microsoft. It emphasizes the significant impact of generative AI and offers insights into how investors can approach the AI boom by breaking down the space into various themes and subthemes with representative companies. The piece also notes the strong rally in AI stocks following ChatGPT's release and details the economic moats and fair value estimates for the featured companies.

title: AI Boosting Payments Efficiency & Cutting Fraud
summary: J.P. Morgan highlights how artificial intelligence is enhancing payment efficiency and reducing fraud, especially within non-bank financial institutions. The article discusses AI's role in boosting productivity, cutting costs, and improving fraud detection, citing examples from J.P. Morgan and Microsoft. It also emphasizes the importance of data governance and ethical considerations for a successful AI rollout.

title: Amdocs to create telco-specific GenAI models using Nvidia service
summary: Amdocs will utilize Nvidia's AI foundry service to develop custom large language models (LLMs) specifically for the global telecommunications industry. This collaboration aims to provide telcos with enhanced performance and optimized resource utilization through specialized GenAI capabilities, building on a prior partnership between Amdocs and Microsoft. The development emphasizes the growing industry need for tailored AI solutions to address sector-specific challenges, as highlighted by other major telecom players developing their own GenAI models.

title: Automation Fair 2023: Rockwell Automation is Betting on AMRs, Cobots, and Generative AI
summary: Rockwell Automation is strategically investing in Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs), cobotics, and generative AI to spearhead the future of industrial automation. The company leverages these technologies to address challenges like labor shortages, supply chain disruptions, and the need for optimized production processes. Notably, Rockwell is developing a Chat-GPT-inspired co-pilot for automation design and has recently acquired OTTO Motors, a leading AMR manufacturer.

title: Fair Isaac Corp. Stock Outperforms Competitors Despite Losses On The Day
summary: Fair Isaac Corp.'s stock outperformed its competitors despite losses on the day. The article also briefly covers Unity Software's Q4 financial results, noting higher-than-expected revenue but a quarterly loss per share.

title: 10월 하락장 맞춘 AI ETF…엔비디아보다 '이것' 담았다 [글로벌마켓나우 플러스]
summary: LG AI연구원과 인공지능 전문 자산운용사 크래프트 테크놀로지스가 협력하여 'LG 크래프트 AI 파워드 US 라지캡 코어 상장지수펀드'(LQAI ETF)를 뉴욕증권거래소에 상장했습니다. 이 ETF는 엔비디아보다 구글과 마이크로소프트 비중을 높이고, 크래프트 테크놀로지스의 AI 위험 예측 지표를 통해 10월 하락장과 11월 초 반등을 예측하는 정확도를 보였습니다. 내년 시장 전망에서는 넷플릭스를 최선호 종목으로 꼽고, 기술주와 헬스케어 비중을 높이며 부동산 섹터는 편입하지 않고 있습니다.

title: Microsoft Earnings Beat: What’s Next?
summary: Microsoft recently reported earnings that surpassed analyst expectations, driven by a 13% revenue surge year-over-year and significant growth in its Azure cloud segment, fueled by AI consumption. The article discusses opportunities for traders through Direxion's leveraged and inverse ETFs for Microsoft and other tech sectors, while also addressing skeptical views on Microsoft's valuation and recent acquisition. It highlights the potential for continued growth due to AI investments but also notes risks like high valuation compared to the S&P 500 and the impact of its Activision Blizzard acquisition.

title: Commvault Cloud Unifies Data Protection, Security, AI And Recovery
summary: Commvault has launched Commvault Cloud, an AI-powered platform that unifies data protection, security, intelligence, and recovery with a focus on cyber resilience. The platform integrates new Metallic AI capabilities, including the AI copilot Arlie, and offers solutions like Cleanroom Recovery and the upcoming Platinum Resilience fully managed service. This move addresses the increasing complexity of data security in hybrid, multi-cloud environments and the market shift towards integrated suite solutions.

title: Commvault re-integrates Metallic service into expanded security cloud
summary: Commvault Systems Inc. has launched Commvault Cloud, an integrated cloud offering that combines its SaaS and packaged software products with a focus on cyber resilience, AI for threat diagnosis, and recovery. This new platform re-integrates the Metallic Cloud Storage Service and introduces Arlie, an AI "co-pilot," to simplify cybersecurity tasks and enhance recovery capabilities. The service also includes features like Cloudburst Recovery, Cleanroom Recovery, and Platinum Resilience, aiming to address the increasing complexity of cyber incidents and ensure rapid data recovery.

title: Amdocs and NVIDIA to Accelerate Adoption of Generative AI for $1.7 Trillion Telecom Industry
summary: Amdocs and NVIDIA announced a collaboration to optimize large language models (LLMs) to accelerate the adoption of generative AI applications and services across the $1.7 trillion telecommunications and media industries. This partnership will see Amdocs customize enterprise-grade LLMs on NVIDIA accelerated computing, leveraging NVIDIA DGX Cloud AI supercomputing and NVIDIA AI Enterprise software within the Amdocs amAIz framework. The initiative aims to enable communications service providers to efficiently deploy generative AI for customer experiences, network provisioning, and other operational enhancements, building on Amdocs' existing partnership with Microsoft.

title: Cisco taps ex-Microsoft executive Rodney Clark to lead partner network
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. has appointed Rodney Clark, a former Microsoft executive, as its new senior vice president for Partnerships and Small & Medium Business. Clark will be responsible for leading Cisco's global partner network. His appointment was announced on November 6, 2023.

title: On-device AI chips: New battleground for chipmakers
summary: Global chipmakers like Samsung Electronics, Qualcomm, Intel, and AMD are intensifying their focus on on-device AI chips for smartphones, laptops, and PCs, recognizing its potential for customized services, lower costs, and enhanced privacy compared to generative AI. This shift is expected to drive significant growth in AI-enabled consumer electronics and contribute to rising memory chip prices. Both on-device AI and generative AI are seen as complementary, with companies like Samsung planning to integrate both into future smart devices.
source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition

title: SolarWinds hack explained: Everything you need to know
summary: The SolarWinds hack, identified as one of the largest cybersecurity breaches, involved malicious code injected into its Orion IT monitoring software, affecting thousands of organizations including the U.S. government. Suspected Russian nation-state hackers, referred to as Nobelium, gained widespread access, leading to significant investigations and legal actions against SolarWinds. The incident highlighted critical vulnerabilities in supply chain security and spurred new cybersecurity initiatives and regulations, such as the mandating of Software Bill of Materials (SBOMs).

title: Bilibili Announces Most Popular Scientific Topics of 2023 among China's Young Generations
summary: Bilibili announced the "2023 Top 5 Most Popular Scientific Topics on Bilibili" among young Chinese generations, including AIGC, room-temperature superconductors, brain-computer interfaces, black holes, and controllable nuclear fusion. The platform hosted a "Super Science Night" event featuring renowned scientists and Bilibili creators to engage young audiences with science. Science and knowledge-related content is the second most searched category on Bilibili, accounting for 41% of total viewing time, with over 243 million users viewing such content in the past year.

title: How To Give Your Passive Investing Approach Some Much-Needed Oomph
summary: This article explores factor investing, also known as "smart beta," as a way to enhance passive investing strategies. It discusses the performance of five popular factors—value, quality, momentum, minimum volatility, and size—highlighting quality as the best performer over the past five years. The piece also suggests considering multifactor ETFs like the iShares US Equity Factor ETF (LRGF) for diversified exposure to these factors.

title: MOAT: History May Not Repeat Itself (BATS:MOAT)
summary: The VanEck Morningstar Wide Moat ETF (MOAT) has a strong historical track record and reasonable fees but is significantly underweight in big tech. Given a bullish view on big tech, the author suggests MOAT may underperform the S&P 500 going forward. The article provides an overview of the ETF's strategy and the author's financial disclosures.

title: Will AI Spark a Boom in Data Centre Real Estate?
summary: The article discusses how the rise of AI and other disruptive technologies is driving an increase in demand for data centers, potentially tripling global capacity in six years. It highlights data center real estate stocks, such as Digital Realty Trust and Global X's Data Centre REITs & Digital Infrastructure ETF, as a focused investment opportunity, noting their inflation-resistant nature and tax benefits. The article also touches on the geographical shift in data center placement, with growth in less expensive locations like the US Midwest.

title: 7 Quantum Computing Stocks That AI Will Send Soaring
summary: This article highlights seven quantum computing stocks poised for growth due to increasing AI integration. It identifies key players from ETFs and pure-play companies to established tech giants and semiconductor firms, explaining how their involvement in quantum computing, often alongside AI and cloud technologies, positions them for future success. The piece also notes the resurgence of interest in quantum computing as interest rates stabilize.

title: Microsoft Edged Out Its Cloud Computing Competitors in Q3
summary: Microsoft's cloud computing service, Azure, reported 29% growth in Q3, outperforming competitors Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, largely due to strong demand for its AI capabilities. The article suggests inverse ETFs like MSFU, CLDL, and UBOT for traders looking to capitalize on Microsoft's continued competitiveness in cloud computing and the growth potential of AI. Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI contributed to a 13% revenue jump, highlighting its strategic focus on integrating AI across its technology stack.

title: Microsoft will hold a 27% stake in OpenAI and gain access to its AI models.
summary: Microsoft and OpenAI have finalized a new agreement where Microsoft will acquire a 27% stake in OpenAI, valued at $135 billion. This agreement grants Microsoft access to OpenAI's AI technology, including AGI models, until 2032. OpenAI has also committed to investing an additional $250 billion in purchasing Azure services.

title: Top 10 Cloud Security Companies
summary: The cloud-managed services market is projected to reach US$164 billion by 2027, driven by increasing enterprise demand and a lack of IT expertise, while cloud security is poised for substantial growth to US$170.51 billion by 2032 due to rising cyber threats. This article lists the top 10 cloud security companies in 2023, based on market capitalization, including industry giants like Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon, highlighting their key offerings and recent developments in cloud security. The companies presented offer diverse solutions, from comprehensive cloud platforms and cybersecurity infrastructure to data analytics and application security.

title: World's largest ammonia production complex: world record in Donaldsonville, Louisiana
summary: CF Industries' Donaldsonville Complex in Louisiana has been recognized as the world's largest ammonia production complex by the WORLD RECORD ACADEMY. The complex is also embarking on significant initiatives to produce green and low-carbon ammonia, including a partnership with POSCO Holdings for a new $2 billion facility and a commitment to net-zero emissions by 2050. These efforts aim to boost sustainable ammonia production for various applications, contributing to global food security and decarbonization goals.

title: The Top 50 SaaS CEOs of 2023
summary: The Software Report has announced its Top 50 SaaS CEOs of 2023, recognizing leaders for their strategic vision, tactical execution, and inspiring leadership. The awardees include individuals who have significantly grown their companies, driven digital transformation, and developed advanced software solutions across various industries. The selection process involved nominations from industry experts and in-house research, highlighting CEOs like Craig Courtemanche of Procore, Therese Tucker of BlackLine, and Darren Roos of IFS for their remarkable achievements.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Franklin Templeton Optimistic About Emerging Markets
summary: Chetan Sehgal, lead portfolio manager of Templeton Emerging Markets Investment Trust (TEMIT) and senior managing director at Franklin Templeton, expresses optimism about emerging markets, citing digitalization, high-tech firms, and renewable energy. He highlights strong performance in South Korea, Taiwan, and India, with specific stock picks like PAYTM, Policy Bazaar, and Zomato. Sehgal also sees recovery in Brazil and stabilization in China's economy, emphasizing the increasing awareness and improvement in ESG issues across emerging markets.

title: Ask AI Guru: Genpact turns to generative AI to help employees learn
summary: Genpact, a NYSE-listed professional services company, has rolled out an internal generative AI chatbot called "AI Guru" to enhance employee learning and development. This tool, powered by Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, helps employees with tasks such as IT migration, test case generation, and management advice, and provides 24/7 access to collective expertise from internal "master gurus." The initiative aims to improve employee retention and efficiency by offering personalized and constantly updated learning content, addressing a bottleneck in their traditional learning methods.

title: 70% of Companies Use AI, Other Tech to Optimize Business Travel: Weekly Stat
summary: A significant majority, 70% of companies, are now utilizing AI and other technologies to streamline and manage aspects of business travel, according to new data from American Express’ Trendex Business Travel Edition. These technologies aim to improve visibility and governance over employee spending, particularly through generative AI's ability to monitor and predict expenses. The article also highlights a shift towards virtual cards for business travel, with 73% of current users planning to increase their use, due to enhanced security, customization, and cash flow management.

title: BlackLine (BL) Strengthens Portfolio With Microsoft Teams Integration
summary: BlackLine (BL) has integrated Microsoft Teams and introduced enhanced capabilities for its Microsoft Dynamics 365 Connector to streamline finance and accounting processes. This partnership offers seamless compatibility with Microsoft ERPs, providing real-time notifications and improved data access. BlackLine also highlighted its robust portfolio, including recent acquisitions, AI-enabled solutions, and strong customer growth, expecting significant revenue for fiscal 2023.

title: Gartner Identifies the Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2024
summary: Gartner has announced its top 10 strategic technology trends for 2024, emphasizing the need for organizations to act boldly amidst technological disruptions and socioeconomic uncertainties. The trends, presented at Gartner IT Symposium/Xpo 2023, highlight the increasing role of AI, sustainability, and intelligent automation in driving business value and resilience. Key themes include the democratization of Generative AI, AI Trust, Risk and Security Management, AI-Augmented Development, and the emergence of Machine Customers and Industry Cloud Platforms.

title: Generative AI Delivers a Boost to Cloud Computing
summary: Cloud computing companies are experiencing a rebound after a difficult period, driven by improving fundamentals and the increasing importance of generative AI. Spending on cloud computing is projected to rise by nearly 22% in 2023, and cloud providers are capitalizing on this trend by integrating AI-incorporated solutions and monetizing AI-as-a-service. This surge in AI adoption is expected to lead to better-than-expected revenue and profit growth for companies in the cloud computing sector.

title: IWF ETF: Be Cautious Of High Valuations (NYSEARCA:IWF)
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) tracks large-cap U.S. growth stocks and has its largest holdings in Apple and Microsoft. While it generally underperformed some growth ETFs like QQQ, it surpassed others like SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 Growth ETF due to differences in its holdings and sector exposure. The article advises caution due to potentially high valuations.

title: Moat Investing Rises Above Magnificent Seven Dominance
summary: The article discusses how Morningstar's Moat Index outperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date despite being underweight the "Magnificent Seven" mega-cap stocks. It highlights the growing concentration risk posed by these seven technology giants and explains how equal-weighted Moat strategies offer a solution through diversification and attractive valuations. The article also details the September index reconstitutions for both the Moat and SMID Moat Indexes, noting shifts away from growth stocks and into more value-oriented sectors.

title: HR costs rise as data suggests tech can cut HR staff
summary: New research indicates that high-performing HR departments using technology operate with 40% fewer staff, despite rising HR operating costs due to wage hikes. While vendors promote generative AI for augmenting HR tasks, some experts advise caution and skepticism regarding its immediate impact on staff reduction. Top-performing companies invest more in HR tech, modernizing IT architecture, advanced analytics, and collaboration tools, contributing to their efficiency.

title: Boeing PAC joins fleet of corporate givers to Kentucky Republican Party building fund
summary: Aerospace giant Boeing's PAC donated $100,000 to the Kentucky Republican Party's building fund, bringing the total corporate donations for the renovation and expansion of the Mitch McConnell Building to $2.75 million. This fund, allowed by a 2017 Kentucky law, accepts unlimited corporate contributions, unlike other political committees. The Republican building fund reported having over $2.7 million cash on hand, significantly more than the Kentucky Democratic Party's building fund.

title: ConocoPhillips goes global with digital twins
summary: ConocoPhillips is expanding its use of digital twin technology across its entire portfolio after initial successes in its major fields, aiming to optimize safety and efficiency. This global program, awarded a 2023 CIO 100 Award, helps the company maximize extraction from existing assets, manage volatile industry prices, and reduce GHG emissions. The company is developing a common platform and community to accelerate deployment and connect digital twins with other systems for greater insights and value.

title: Elon Musk's X hit with trademark lawsuit from marketing agency
summary: X Corp, formerly Twitter, is facing a trademark infringement lawsuit from a legal-marketing company called X Social Media. The Florida-based company claims that X Corp's rebranding is causing consumer confusion and has led to lost revenue, given their prior use and federal trademark for "X Social Media" since 2016. This lawsuit is potentially the first of many such disputes due to the common use of the letter "X" in tech branding.

title: Supermicro At 30: From Designing AI Chips To Selling AI Systems
summary: Supermicro, founded 30 years ago, began with Charles Liang's vision to improve server motherboards and power supplies after working on an AI processor design. The company has grown into a $10 billion systems business with global manufacturing facilities and aims for $20 billion in the next three years, continuously expanding its operations and exploring new factory locations.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to testify on Monday in Google antitrust trial
summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is slated to testify on Monday as a witness for the U.S. Justice Department in its antitrust trial against Google. Nadella is expected to discuss Microsoft's efforts to expand its Edge browser and Bing search engine, and the challenges posed by Google's market dominance. The government alleges Google improperly paid $10 billion annually to maintain its default search engine status on various devices.

title: Cisco's $28 billion Splunk deal may ignite software deal frenzy
summary: Cisco's $28 billion acquisition of Splunk is expected to spark a new wave of software vendor acquisitions by other technology giants, driven by the appeal of predictable subscription revenue. Investment bankers and analysts suggest that Splunk's shift to a subscription model and the improving M&A outlook for software companies make similar firms attractive targets for major tech conglomerates like Microsoft, Adobe, and Oracle. This comes as valuations for software stocks are considered cheap by historical standards, encouraging dealmaking in a sector that has seen a recent slowdown.

title: EPAM Expands Partnership with Microsoft - Becomes Globally Managed Enterprise Systems Integrator
summary: EPAM Systems, Inc. announced its new status as a Microsoft globally Managed Enterprise Systems Integrator, significantly expanding its strategic partnership with Microsoft. This enhanced status allows EPAM to accelerate technology innovation and digital transformation for enterprises by leveraging cloud-native, AI, and data expertise, particularly through end-to-end solution design and implementation in the cloud. The company will focus on building intelligent applications powered by Azure OpenAI Service and growing Microsoft certifications, building on its recent recognition as the 2023 Microsoft U.S. Azure Migration Partner of the Year.

title: Should Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: This article evaluates the Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) as a potential investment, highlighting its focus on large-cap growth stocks, low expense ratio, and strong performance. It details VONG's sector exposure, top holdings, and risk profile, while also suggesting alternative ETFs for consideration.

title: What Market Pros Saw Last Earnings Season That Spurred Investments in Tech and AI Stocks
summary: Market experts, managing over $67 billion, analyzed second-quarter earnings reports and concluded that the bull market has room to run, a U.S. recession is unlikely, consumer spending remains strong, and AI is not in a bubble but rather a significant driver of corporate profits. They identified key sectors and companies benefiting from current growth trends, including broad-market strength beyond AI and Big Tech, and a re-emerging strong momentum in European economies.

title: Amadeus to Work with Microsoft and Accenture to Develop New Generative AI-Powered Integrations to Support Corporate Travel Management
summary: Amadeus announced a collaboration with Microsoft and Accenture to integrate generative AI into its Cytric Easy travel and expense platform. This partnership aims to develop new AI-powered tools, including a digital assistant for corporate travelers within Microsoft Teams and a plugin for Microsoft 365 Copilot, to streamline travel management and enhance the booking experience using natural language.

title: MSFU ETF Analysis: Dividends, Returns NASDAQ:MSFU
summary: This analysis details the Direxion Daily MSFT Bull 2X Shares (MSFU) ETF, designed to deliver 2x the daily price return of Microsoft stock. It highlights key statistics such as its $262.97M AUM, 2.56% dividend yield, and 0.99% expense ratio. The article also provides information on its structure, investment strategy, and recent performance, noting that the fund invests solely in cash.

title: Indian auto insurance technology start-up Roadzen listed on Nasdaq
summary: Indian auto insurance technology start-up Roadzen has listed on Nasdaq, with its ordinary shares trading under the symbol "RDZN" and warrants under "RDZNW." The company, powered by artificial intelligence, achieved a pre-money equity value of $683 million and aims to lead the transformation of the auto insurance market through AI, mobility, and insurance. Roadzen's CEO, Rohan Malhotra, emphasizes the company's global vision and its commitment to building innovative AI technology for markets worldwide.

title: Cisco to Buy Splunk, a Software Company, for $28 Billion (Published 2023)
summary: Cisco announced its largest acquisition to date, agreeing to buy data-analysis software company Splunk for $28 billion in cash. This move signifies Cisco's strategic shift further into higher-margin software subscriptions and away from its traditional networking hardware roots. The deal faces potential scrutiny from antitrust regulators, although both companies believe there is little product overlap.

title: DTW23-Ignite: How Amdocs, Orange and Marand gain through Open API collaboration
summary: A collaboration between Amdocs, Orange, and Marand Software on developing an Open API for product configurators highlights the benefits of open standards in the telecom industry. This project allowed a small regional supplier, a tier-one communications service provider, and a global software giant to efficiently align on critical functionalities like configuration and pricing, leading to a standardized solution that can benefit the wider community. The initiative facilitated mutual learning, problem-solving, and the development of a robust, open-source API for product configuration.

title: Klaviyo rises 9% in muted NYSE debut after software vendor priced IPO at $30 a share
summary: Klaviyo, a marketing automation company, debuted on the NYSE after pricing its IPO at $30 a share, valuing the company at over $9 billion. Shares rose 9.2% on the first day, closing at $32.76, after opening higher. This IPO, along with Instacart's, attempts to revitalize a dormant tech IPO market, with Klaviyo benefiting from a strong relationship with e-commerce giant Shopify.

title: Oracle says it's ready to cater to Canadian banks' open banking needs
summary: Oracle has declared its readiness to support Canadian banks with their open banking requirements, offering technology solutions as Canada implements its framework. Oracle's executive vice president for financial services, Sonny Singh, noted that the company's existing financial products, used globally, are well-positioned for this shift. This comes as Canadian banks are increasingly partnering with fintech firms and Oracle, despite recent market value losses due to strong cloud-computing competition.

title: iShares MSCI ACWI ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI) offers investors global equity exposure to large and mid-capitalization developed and emerging markets. It tracks the MSCI All Country World Index, providing diversification across numerous countries and sectors efficiently. The ETF is marketed as a low-cost investment vehicle with potential for long-term growth, though it acknowledges inherent investment risks.

title: Morgan Stanley to Launch AI-Powered Assistant for Financial Advisers
summary: Morgan Stanley is launching an AI-powered assistant for its financial advisers and support staff, named the AI @ Morgan Stanley Assistant. This tool, based on OpenAI's GPT-4, provides quick access to 100,000 research reports and documents, aiming to enhance client interactions and efficiency. The bank also plans to introduce other generative AI tools, including "Debrief" for summarizing meetings and generating follow-up emails.

title: Morgan Stanley kicks off generative AI era on Wall Street with assistant for financial advisors
summary: Morgan Stanley is launching its AI @ Morgan Stanley Assistant, created with OpenAI's GPT-4, for all financial advisors and their support staff. This tool provides speedy access to a 100,000-document database, aiming to improve client interactions and efficiency by freeing up advisors' time. It marks the first major Wall Street firm to deploy such a bespoke generative AI solution for employees.

title: 29 African Startups in Healthcare Supply Chain Selected to Receive Funding and Impact Support from the Gates Foundation, MSD, and More
summary: The Investing in Innovation (i3) program, funded by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and sponsored by Cencora, MSD, Microsoft, and Chemonics, has selected 29 African startups for its second cohort. These startups, operating in 21 African countries, will receive a $50,000 grant, market access, and tailored investment readiness support to enhance healthcare supply chains. The program aims to foster growth-focused partnerships and drive the commercialization of innovative solutions, building on the success of its first cohort which secured 24 contracts and strategic partnerships.

title: Goldman Sachs Physical Gold ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (CBOE:AAAU)
summary: The Goldman Sachs Physical Gold ETF (AAAU) tracks the LBMA Gold Price index, investing in physical gold bars held in Perth, Australia. It offers investors exposure to gold spot prices, with shares redeemable for gold coins and small bars. AAAU was launched on July 26, 2018, and has seen its shares increase by 65.1% this year, trading at $42.82.

title: Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS), including its current stock price, key statistics like PE Ratio and Dividend Yield, and its top holdings as of August 31, 2025. The ETF has a portfolio value of $8.44 billion with top holdings including NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms. It also presents historical performance data and breakdowns of asset allocation and sector exposure.

title: Constellation, ComEd in landmark energy-matching deal
summary: Constellation and ComEd have announced a landmark hourly carbon-free energy matching agreement, making ComEd the first investor-owned US utility to power all its facilities with locally produced nuclear energy from the time and place it is consumed. This initiative aims to genuinely achieve zero carbon emissions by matching clean energy production with consumption, a method Constellation touts as crucial for meeting 2050 climate goals. ComEd will match its anticipated 65,000 MWh electricity use across its 54 facilities with this method, which differs from traditional annual renewable energy certificates.

title: Microsoft and Oracle expand partnership to deliver Oracle Database Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in Microsoft Azure
summary: Microsoft and Oracle announced Oracle Database@Azure, providing direct access to Oracle database services running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) deployed in Microsoft Azure datacenters. This expanded partnership aims to simplify cloud migration and multicloud deployment for customers, offering enhanced performance, security, and integration with Azure's AI services. Customers will benefit from a streamlined operating environment, simplified purchasing through Azure Marketplace, and joint support for critical workloads.

title: Microsoft and Oracle Expand Partnership to Deliver Oracle Database Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure in Microsoft Azure
summary: Microsoft and Oracle have expanded their partnership to launch Oracle Database@Azure, allowing customers direct access to Oracle database services running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) in Microsoft Azure datacenters. This collaboration simplifies cloud migration, offers high-performance Oracle databases with Azure's services and AI capabilities, and provides a streamlined purchasing process through Azure Marketplace. The service aims to address challenges in multicloud architectures and is supported by a joint support model.

title: Microsoft expands partnership with Oracle to bring customers’ mission-critical database workloads to Azure
summary: Microsoft and Oracle are expanding their partnership to enable Oracle's customers to run mission-critical database workloads on Microsoft Azure. This new offering, Oracle Database@Azure, allows customers to migrate existing Oracle databases "as is" to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) and deploy them within Azure datacenters, providing seamless integration with Azure services like Azure OpenAI. The collaboration aims to reduce hurdles for cloud migration and allow businesses to leverage cutting-edge cloud services with their Oracle databases, improving efficiency and enabling new applications.

title: Cloud Security Posture Management Market Size Set for Rapid Growth with a Projected CAGR of 10.8% to Achieve Market Valuation of USD 12.6 Billion by 2032
summary: The Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) Market is predicted to reach USD 12.6 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 10.8% from USD 4.6 billion in 2022. This growth is driven by the increasing adoption of cloud services, evolving cyber threats, and stringent data regulations. North America currently leads the market, benefiting from early cloud adoption and robust data regulations.

title: Constellation Inks Deal with Major U.S. Utility for 100 Percent Hourly Carbon-Free Energy Matching
summary: Constellation announced an agreement with Commonwealth Edison (ComEd) to power all 54 of ComEd's facilities with 100 percent hourly carbon-free nuclear energy. This makes ComEd the first investor-owned utility to achieve this advanced level of clean energy matching. The deal, similar to one with Microsoft, sets a new standard for emissions reduction by ensuring that clean energy is produced where and when it is consumed, addressing the limitations of traditional annual renewable energy certificates.

title: Microsoft recognized as a Leader in 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Desktop as a Service
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the inaugural 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Desktop as a Service (DaaS), highlighting its commitment to providing secure and versatile cloud solutions for flexible work. The article discusses Microsoft's key DaaS offerings, Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop, and recent innovations such as Windows 365 Frontline and enhanced security features like watermarking and confidential virtual machines in Azure Virtual Desktop. This recognition reinforces Microsoft's focus on empowering productivity for all employees through modern endpoint solutions.

title: New Coder 2.0 aims to elevate onboarding and productivity in the cloud era
summary: Coder Technologies Inc. announced the general availability of Coder 2.0, an open-source, cloud-native platform designed to enhance developer onboarding and productivity by shifting development to cloud-based workspaces. The new version introduces Dev Container support, a template registry, and integration with JFrog Artifactory and Xray, aiming to provide a local development experience with the security, power, and scalability of the cloud. Coder 2.0 seeks to streamline CDE workflows and remove productivity bottlenecks for developers and platform engineering teams.

title: Developing and deploying AI responsibly: elements of an effective legislative framework to regulate AI
summary: Brad Smith, Vice Chair and President of Microsoft, testified before a Senate Judiciary subcommittee, endorsing the Blumenthal-Hawley framework for AI regulation. He shared Microsoft's principles for developing effective legislation, including prioritizing safety and security, ensuring compliance with existing legal protections, and using AI to improve government services. The testimony emphasizes accountability, building on existing efforts like the NIST AI Risk Management Framework, requiring "safety brakes" for AI in critical infrastructure, and implementing a "KY3C" (Know Your Customer, Cloud, and Content) framework.

title: All else being equal: Making the case for equal-weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the advantages and disadvantages of equal-weight ETFs compared to market-cap-weighted ETFs, particularly in the context of the S&P 500's concentration in a few large tech companies. It highlights how equal weighting can manage concentration and valuation risk, offer a value investment style tilt, and increase exposure to smaller, well-established companies. While equal-weight strategies may underperform when market gains are driven by a select few, they can offer diversification benefits and a "buy-low, sell-high" approach through rebalancing.

title: YieldMax Writes Call Options on JPMorgan Chase With JPMO ETF
summary: YieldMax has launched the YieldMax JPM Option Income Strategy ETF (JPMO), an actively managed fund that aims to generate monthly income by writing call options on JPMorgan Chase & Co. Corp. (JPM). The fund seeks to harvest compelling yields with capped participation in JPM's price gains and is managed by ZEGA Financial with an expense ratio of 0.99%. This new ETF expands YieldMax's growing suite of option income strategy ETFs.

title: Contact - The Lethbridge Herald - News and Sports from around Lethbridge
summary: First Trust Advisors L.P. announced the monthly distribution for the First Trust Income Opportunities ETF (FCEF). The distribution amount is $0.1175 per share, with an expected ex-dividend date of September 12, 2023. The article also details the investment objectives, risks, charges, and expenses associated with investing in the Fund, advising potential investors to read the prospectus carefully.

title: Pen Factory Sold for $166M
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has purchased the Pen Factory, a Santa Monica office property housing Activision Blizzard Inc. and GoodRx Holdings Inc., for approximately $166 million. The 219,571-square-foot Class A office space, previously owned by the California State Retirement Systems, sold for $754 per square foot. This sale occurs shortly before Microsoft's acquisition of Activision.

title: The pros and cons of the Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US ETF (VEU)
summary: The Vanguard FTSE All-World ex-US ETF (VEU) offers extensive geographic and business diversification with over 3,700 holdings and a low annual management fee of 0.08%. While it provides exposure to many strong global companies outside the US, its exclusion of US businesses means it misses out on some top performers like Apple and Microsoft, which have driven higher returns in US-inclusive international ETFs. Despite this, VEU remains a strong choice for investors seeking broad non-US market exposure.

title: History of Apple in Photos, From Steve Jobs Era to $3 Trillion
summary: This article chronicles the history of Apple, from its founding by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak to its recent achievement of a $3 trillion market cap under Tim Cook. It details key product launches like the Apple II, Macintosh, iPod, and iPhone, as well as leadership changes and challenges such as the recent DOJ lawsuit and declining iPhone sales in China. The article also touches upon Apple's expansion into services and new product categories like the Apple Watch and Vision Pro, alongside its pivot towards generative AI.

title: Seagate Game Drive for Xbox: Starfield Special Edition Released, RGB LED Lighting Included
summary: Seagate has released a Starfield Special Edition Game Drive for Xbox, featuring RGB LED lighting and available in 2TB and 5TB capacities. This officially licensed external hard drive, compatible with Xbox Series X|S and Xbox One, simplifies game storage with easy installation and no separate power cord. The drives are priced at $109.99 for 2TB and $169.99 for 5TB, including data recovery services and a one-year warranty.

title: If You Like SPHQ, Check Out Quality ETFs XMHQ and XSHQ
summary: The article highlights the growing popularity of quality ETFs, specifically discussing the Invesco S&P 500 Quality ETF (SPHQ) and suggesting that investors also consider mid-cap and small-cap quality ETFs like XMHQ and XSHQ for broader exposure. It emphasizes that quality factors are significant across all market capitalizations and details how these Invesco funds select their holdings based on quality scores. The piece also provides insights into the AUM and recent inflows for each ETF, noting the key differences and similarities in how they track quality within their respective market segments.

title: Microsoft crash dump exposed key that led to US cabinet email hacks, investigation finds
summary: A Microsoft internal investigation revealed that a consumer signing key, used by a China-based threat group to compromise U.S. cabinet email accounts, was exposed in an April 2021 crash dump. The threat group, Storm-0558, accessed a Microsoft engineer’s corporate account after the key was inadvertently moved from a secure production environment to a debugging environment. The incident has raised significant concerns about Microsoft's production environment security and detection capabilities.

title: McKinsey teams up with Salesforce to deliver on the promise of AI-powered growth
summary: McKinsey and Salesforce have announced a new collaboration to accelerate the introduction of trusted generative AI for sales, marketing, commerce, and service. This partnership will combine Salesforce's CRM technologies with McKinsey’s AI and data models to improve customer experiences, increase sales productivity, and personalize marketing. The collaboration aims to help companies realize the potential of generative AI, which McKinsey research estimates could unlock $4.4 trillion in global productivity.

title: SAP Versus Salesforce: Who’s World’s Third-Largest Software Vendor?
summary: This article analyzes the competition between SAP and Salesforce for the title of the world's third-largest software vendor, behind Microsoft and Oracle. While Salesforce recently surpassed SAP in quarterly revenue, SAP maintains a lead in trailing-12-month revenue. The author projects that SAP is poised to solidify its lead due to its faster-growing cloud business.

title: Qualcomm launches Snapdragon digital chassis for ICE and electric two-wheelers
summary: Qualcomm Technologies has expanded its Snapdragon Digital Chassis portfolio with new QWM2290 and QWS2290 platforms designed for ICE and electric two-wheelers, micro-mobility, and other motorized vehicles. These platforms aim to enhance safety, infotainment, cloud-connected digital services, personalization, and convenience. The company is collaborating with OEMs and ecosystem partners, including Gogoro, to accelerate the digital transformation of these vehicle segments.

title: Bristol Myers Squibb Tech and Digital Chief Develops A Game Plan For Generative AI
summary: Greg Meyers, Chief Digital & Technology Officer of Bristol Myers Squibb (BMS), outlines his strategy for integrating generative AI into the company's operations after personally exploring ChatGPT 3.5. He identified immediate applications in document review, transforming tabular data into narratives, and accelerating drug discovery through computational pharmacology. Meyers emphasizes a responsible AI policy, the creation of an internal ChatGPT instance for secure experimentation, and fostering a "community of practice" to guide AI adoption and ensure both safety and effectiveness.

title: Bandwidth Partners with Google and Cognigy to Launch AIBridge, Integrating Artificial Intelligence with Contact Centers Using Maestro
summary: Bandwidth has announced a partnership with Google and Cognigy to launch AIBridge, a new capability within its Maestro platform. AIBridge enables enterprises to deploy voice-based AI tools to their contact centers, allowing for faster and more efficient call resolution in the communications cloud without direct agent intervention. This integration is designed to improve customer experience, increase agent satisfaction, and significantly reduce contact center operating costs by leveraging conversational AI from partners like Cognigy.AI and Google Cloud's Dialogflow.

title: Bill Gates buys stake in Anheuser-Busch InBev
summary: Bill Gates, through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust, has invested nearly $96.6 million in Anheuser-Busch InBev, acquiring 1.7 million shares. This investment comes as AB InBev's share price has dropped due to a boycott of its Bud Light brand following a controversial marketing campaign. Gates had previously invested in Heineken earlier the same year.

title: Salesforce lifts annual forecast as business software demand stays strong
summary: Salesforce raised its annual revenue forecast and projected quarterly sales above estimates, benefiting from recent price hikes and strong demand for its cloud and business software. The company's shares rose, signaling optimism about a recovery in technology spending and its new AI integrations. Salesforce also increased its full-year adjusted operating margin forecast, bolstered by its first price hike in seven years.

title: Google Cloud, HCA team up to deploy AI in the emergency department
summary: HCA Healthcare is expanding its partnership with Google Cloud and Augmedix to deploy generative AI tools in emergency departments, aiming to improve documentation efficiency and allow clinicians more time for patient care. Following a successful pilot program in four hospitals, HCA is considering wider implementation of Google's generative AI, and also exploring the use of Google's medical large language model, Med-PaLM 2, for complex medical queries. The initiative focuses on enhancing workflows and caregiver support while acknowledging the need for careful ethical deployment and rigorous quality assessment of AI in healthcare.

title: Is Domo Stock a Buy Now?
summary: Domo's stock recently plunged 36% after its Q2 fiscal 2024 earnings report, despite narrower-than-expected losses and revenue slightly beating estimates. The cloud-based software company's growth has stalled due to macro headwinds, stiff competition from tech giants like Salesforce and Microsoft, and a shift to consumption-based pricing. The article advises investors to avoid Domo, citing its unprofitability, slowing growth, and crowded market, despite appearing cheap in valuation.

title: How Yahoo sparked a renaissance under new owners
summary: Yahoo, under its new owner Apollo Global Management, is undergoing a significant revitalization, marked by strategic acquisitions to bolster its core products. The company, once considered a declining asset, is leveraging its still profitable legacy entities and strong traffic numbers to reinvent itself in various market segments. CEO Jim Lanzone is driving this transformation, focusing on strengthening individual brands and exploring new growth categories, including a potential future IPO.

title: Hedge fund exposure to 7 biggest tech stocks at record high, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Hedge funds have reached record exposure to the seven largest tech stocks by market capitalization, according to Goldman Sachs data, driven by strong performance and the artificial intelligence theme. These seven stocks, including Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, now constitute about 20% of the total net market value held by hedge funds tracked by Goldman Sachs. Despite the concentration risk, investment managers rationalize these allocations due to the significant returns generated by these companies this year.

title: 'Not just money and math': Young people are willing to sacrifice returns for ESG
summary: New data reveals that young investors are increasingly willing to sacrifice investment returns to align their portfolios with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) causes they care about. This trend is particularly strong among Gen Z and millennials, with many prepared to underperform market averages for values-aligned investments. Behavioral scientists suggest this reflects a need for young people to signal their values and identity through their investment choices.

title: P&G enlists IoT, predictive analytics to perfect Pampers diapers
summary: Procter & Gamble is leveraging IoT and predictive analytics, specifically Microsoft's IoT and edge analytics platform, to enhance the production of Pampers diapers. This initiative, dubbed Hot Melt Optimization, uses proprietary sensors and machine learning to predict and prevent manufacturing failures, significantly reducing waste and improving efficiency. The system has eliminated 70% of flawed diapers in 11 plants, showcasing the impact of data-driven innovation in manufacturing.

title: YieldMax Launches Option Income Strategy ETFs on Microsoft and Disney
summary: YieldMax has introduced two new active ETFs, the YieldMax MSFT Option Income Strategy ETF (MSFO) and the YieldMax DIS Option Income Strategy ETF (DISO), designed to generate monthly income through a synthetic covered call strategy on Microsoft and Disney stocks, respectively. These new ETFs, actively managed by ZEGA Financial, join a growing suite of YieldMax products that employ similar strategies on other major companies like Coinbase, Netflix, Meta Platforms, Alphabet, and Amazon.

title: Boeing Recognizes 2023 Supplier of the Year Award Winners
summary: Boeing recognized 12 of its top-performing global suppliers at its 2023 Supplier of the Year event in Orlando. These suppliers were celebrated for their contributions to Boeing's safety, quality, sustainability, and delivery commitments amidst a challenging environment. The awards encompassed various categories including Outstanding Performance, Collaboration, Sustainability, and more, highlighting the crucial role suppliers play in Boeing's operations.

title: The best ETFs for retirement income
summary: This article explores the best ETFs for retirement income, focusing on conservative asset allocation ETFs and tactical overlays for retirees. It discusses how these ETFs can help reduce volatility, hedge inflation, and generate income, with insights from financial experts on their suitability for different risk tolerances and financial situations. The author also delves into defensive sector ETFs and low-volatility ETFs as additional strategies for Canadian retirees.

title: Markets News, Aug. 22, 2023: Tech Buoys Nasdaq; Nvidia, Banks Weigh on S&P 500
summary: U.S. markets closed mixed on August 22, 2023, with the Nasdaq Composite Index slightly up due to tech stocks, while the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average declined. Financial stocks were hit by another downgrade from S&P, affecting several regional banks. Companies like Boeing, Apple, and Baidu saw gains, while Merck, Nike, and several retailers experienced drops.

title: Roblox faces a new class action lawsuit alleging it facilitates child gambling
summary: Roblox is facing a new class action lawsuit accusing it of facilitating child gambling through third-party sites using its in-game currency, Robux. Parents claim their children have lost thousands of Robux on these sites, which offer games like blackjack and roulette. Roblox denies affiliation with these sites but states it has teams investigating and may pursue action against them, while also acknowledging that its community standards prohibit simulated gambling.
