summary: This article analyzes Gartner's 2022 Magic Quadrant for Security Information and Event Management (SIEM), highlighting significant changes since the 2021 report. It details vendor movements within the Leaders, Challengers, and Visionaries quadrants, noting company-specific developments and new entrants. The report focuses on shifts including Microsoft's rise, IBM's stability, and the repositioning of several other key SIEM providers.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman: “I'm perfectly happy to see our tech spend go up”
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman expressed satisfaction with increased tech spending, viewing it as crucial for efficiency and innovation, despite a 22% drop in bank revenues. He highlighted the importance of cloud technology, robo-advisors, and cybersecurity, while also reflecting on market recalibrations due to past "ridiculous" valuations and the return to fundamental economic principles. The bank's wealth management and fixed income sectors performed well, offsetting a decline in investment banking.

title: Gartner Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2023
summary: Gartner has identified the Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2023, which are categorized into four key priorities: Optimize, Scale, Pioneer, and Sustainable Technology. These trends aim to help organizations enhance resilience, improve productivity, engage customers, and pursue sustainable solutions. The article details each of the ten trends and their potential impact on business strategies over the next three years.

title: LaLiga and Globant agree to create global technology company
summary: LaLiga has announced a joint venture with Globant, a software development company, to establish a global technology company focused on sports and entertainment. This partnership aims to advance LaLiga Tech's products and services, incorporating new technologies like Web 3.0, metaverse, and gaming, while expanding its global reach. Both parties anticipate this collaboration will enhance fan engagement and drive digital transformation in the sports industry.

title: Microsoft uses strategically located subsidiaries to lower taxes more than previously known, new analysis finds
summary: A new report by the Centre for International Corporate Tax Accountability and Research (CICTAR) alleges that Microsoft uses a network of subsidiaries, particularly in Ireland and Bermuda, to significantly minimize its tax liabilities globally. While not suggesting illegal activity, the analysis raises concerns about profit shifting and its impact on tax revenues in countries where Microsoft conducts substantial business. The report points out that despite high profit margins, some Microsoft subsidiaries report much lower margins, reducing taxable income.

title: Cisco partners with Microsoft to add Teams to its meeting devices
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. will integrate Microsoft Corp.'s Teams messaging app into its meeting devices, offering users an alternative to its Webex video conferencing software. Cisco aims to be a hardware platform for various conferencing software, including Microsoft Teams, Zoom, and Google, believing this strategy will enhance customer experience and benefit the company. This move comes as Webex faces stiff competition from newer platforms like Zoom.

title: Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF: Stash This ETF Away In Your Roth IRA (NASDAQ:QQQM)
summary: This article recommends investing in the Invesco Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQM) for a Roth IRA, especially given market turmoil. The author highlights why QQQM was chosen over the more common QQQ and discusses its appeal after significant price declines in quality tech stocks like Apple, Amazon, and Microsoft. The author also mentions a collaboration with Hoya Capital for an income-focused investing service.

title: Logitech Sight AI Camera Makes Hybrid Work Meetings More Equitable for Remote Participants
summary: Logitech announced Logitech Sight, an AI-powered tabletop camera designed to make hybrid work meetings more equitable for remote participants. This multi-camera system works with Logitech's Rally Bar or Rally Bar Mini to provide remote workers with an "at the table" experience, effectively addressing the disparity between in-office and remote colleagues. Logitech Sight features dual 4K cameras and seven beamforming microphones, integrates with major video conferencing platforms, and is designed with sustainability in mind.

title: Walmart blazes trails with its enterprise ‘supercloud’
summary: Walmart has developed an enterprise "supercloud" called the Walmart Cloud Native Platform, which abstracts away differences between public cloud providers, its hybrid cloud, and edge computing nodes. This multicloud environment aims to optimize resource consumption, drive developer productivity, and enhance network resilience and data analysis. The company is also overhauling its legacy software infrastructure to containers, aiming for portability and resiliency over pure cost savings, and has been able to make 170,000 website adjustments monthly.

title: Security to take an outsized role in IT spending in 2023
summary: Security is projected to take an outsized role in IT spending in 2023, encompassing larger shares of software, hardware, and cloud budgets, according to a Spiceworks Ziff Davis survey. Despite potential recessionary concerns leading to cuts in other areas, companies are increasing tech budgets, with cybersecurity identified as a major line item. This prioritization reflects a learned behavior from modernization efforts, viewing cyber spend as a smart investment to mitigate risks from older systems and evolving threat landscapes.

title: What’s up with… InterDigital, Orange, Calix
summary: InterDigital announced improved Q3 financial guidance and a new 7-year licensing deal with Apple worth $938 million, sending its stock up. Orange initiated an energy-saving plan in France for the winter, while Calix appointed Michael Weening as its new CEO. The article also touches on other telecom news, including a Telstra data breach, Vodafone M&A activity, BSNL's 5G plans with TCS, and Lumen Technologies' $7.5 billion ILEC sale.

title: Identity Theft Monitoring Offered to Microsoft 365 Consumer Users
summary: Microsoft has launched a new Identity Theft Monitoring service for its U.S. Microsoft 365 Personal and Family subscribers, offered at no extra charge. The service is largely outsourced to Experian, which provides up to $1 million in insurance for stolen funds and $100,000 for identity theft. Users will need to provide personal information to Experian, not Microsoft, to utilize the monitoring service.

title: Waymo, C.H. Robinson Driverless Trucks Haul Beer to Houston From Dallas
summary: Waymo, Alphabet's driverless-vehicle unit, and C.H. Robinson have completed a pilot program hauling over 1 million pounds of Modelo and Corona beer from Dallas to Houston using Class 8 trucks with Waymo's self-driving software and a safety driver. This test demonstrates the system's maturity and performance, potentially addressing the long-haul driver shortage for C.H. Robinson and commercializing Waymo's autonomous vehicle technology. The companies are working towards deploying service without a test driver in the coming years.

title: TTAC: Overweight Tech & Energy, Underweight Industrials & Communication
summary: The FCF US Quality ETF (TTAC) focuses on free cash flow to select approximately 150 stocks, aiming to outperform the Russell 3000. As of late August, TTAC was overweight in technology and energy sectors and underweight in industrials and communication services. FCF Advisors prioritizes free cash flow metrics, which they believe are more difficult to manipulate than GAAP earnings, especially in the current challenging investment environment.

title: Microsoft recognized as a Leader in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud ERP for Product-Centric Enterprises
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud ERP for Product-Centric Enterprises for the second consecutive year. This recognition is attributed to their Completeness of Vision and Ability to Execute, with Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Dynamics 365 Finance highlighted for their cloud-native architecture, integration with the Microsoft technology stack, embedded analytics, and flexible manufacturing capabilities. Microsoft continues to invest in innovation to make Dynamics 365 smarter and more efficient for enterprises of all scales.

title: Tims China Completes Business Combination with Silver Crest Acquisition Corporation
summary: Tims China has completed its business combination with Silver Crest Acquisition Corporation, which is expected to provide nearly $200 million for continued growth. The combined company will be named TH International Limited, with shares and warrants trading on NASDAQ under "THCH" and "THCHW." Tims China aims to build a profitable network of 2,750 stores by 2026, supported by this new funding and strategic partnerships.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock rises Wednesday, still underperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. stock rose 0.86% on Wednesday to $150.17, despite an overall positive day for the stock market where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also saw gains. However, the company's stock still underperformed several key competitors, including Microsoft, Adobe, and SAP SE. Salesforce Inc. remains significantly below its 52-week high.

title: OPG and Microsoft announce strategic partnership to power a Net-Zero future for Ontario
summary: Ontario Power Generation (OPG) and Microsoft have formed a strategic partnership in Canada to tackle climate change and promote sustainable growth in Ontario. Microsoft will purchase Clean Energy Credits (CECs) from OPG's carbon-free hydro and nuclear assets on an hourly basis, aiming for 100% carbon-free energy for its datacenters globally by 2030. The collaboration also includes co-developing an hourly energy matching platform, modernizing OPG's IT infrastructure with Microsoft Azure, and exploring digital co-innovation for OPG's Small Modular Reactor program.

title: Artificial Intelligence at Dow Chemical - Two Use Cases at the World's Largest Chemical Company
summary: Dow Chemical, the world's third-largest chemical company, is leveraging AI to address significant business challenges. This article details two key AI use cases: automating and predicting polyurethane fitting for customized products and detecting containment leaks in its chemical plants using computer vision. These initiatives, developed in partnership with Microsoft, aim to enhance product development efficiency and improve safety standards.

title: Shrugging off crypto winter, Galaxy Digital’s Mike Novogratz calls inaugural NFT launch ‘building for the future’
summary: Despite the ongoing "crypto winter" and declining NFT sales, Galaxy Digital CEO Mike Novogratz remains bullish on NFTs, launching the company's inaugural collection of 3,210 digital collectibles. The NFTs, created in partnership with Time's Web3 initiative TIMEPieces, will be airdropped for free to employees and partners, with Novogratz emphasizing it as "building for the future" and a way to foster community spirit rather than a financial endeavor. He points to corporate adoption of NFTs by companies like Nike and the NBA as evidence of their long-term viability.

title: 'Productivity paranoia': Microsoft study of corporate workplaces finds big disconnect in hybrid work
summary: A new Microsoft study reveals a significant "productivity paranoia" gap between employees and leaders regarding hybrid work. While 87% of employees feel productive, only 12% of leaders are confident in their employees' productivity, creating a disconnect that could threaten the sustainability of hybrid work. Microsoft suggests focusing on outcomes, clear communication, and continuous feedback, rather than monitoring hours, and is updating its Viva platform with features to address these challenges.

title: R2 is now Generally Available
summary: Cloudflare announced the general availability of R2, its object storage service. R2 differentiates itself by eliminating egress fees, addressing a major cost concern for developers using traditional cloud providers. The service offers S3 compatibility, automatic regional optimization, integration with Cloudflare Workers, and transparent pricing based on storage volume and operation types, with a free tier for initial usage.

title: Herbalife Nutrition Survey Reveals Top Ten Modern Day Entrepreneurs and What Traits are Needed to Join the List
summary: A Herbalife Nutrition survey identified Bill Gates, Jeff Bezos, and Steve Jobs as the top three most influential modern entrepreneurs, followed by Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg. The study, involving 2,750 respondents across the U.S., Mexico, and Israel, also explored traits essential for entrepreneurial success, highlighting creativity and intelligence as most important. Herbalife Nutrition emphasized the ongoing strength of the entrepreneurial spirit and the company's commitment to fostering it.

title: S|W: The SaaS Weekly – Adobe has $20 billion designs on Figma
summary: This edition of S|W: The SaaS Weekly highlights Adobe's significant $20 billion acquisition of Figma and Google facing a $25 billion lawsuit. The newsletter also covers various funding rounds for Canadian startups like GrowerIQ and Bright, leadership changes at Thinkific, and financial updates from companies like D2L and Byju's, alongside news of layoffs at GoStudent and Twilio.

title: Slack’s brand-new feature has an unexpectedly rich backstory
summary: Slack has launched a new feature called "canvas," which is based on technology from Quip, a company acquired by Salesforce. This feature aims to provide a flexible, interactive tool for sharing information within Slack, fulfilling a long-held vision of Slack's cofounder and CEO Stewart Butterfield. Canvas allows for collaborative document creation and organization, addressing a gap in Slack's previous capabilities for persistent information sharing and long-term project documentation.

title: Palo Alto close to buying Israeli cyber co Apiiro
summary: US cybersecurity firm Palo Alto Networks is reportedly close to acquiring Israeli cybersecurity company Apiiro for over $550 million. This would mark Palo Alto's eighth acquisition in Israel, continuing its strategy of integrating Israeli tech startups. Apiiro, founded in 2019, specializes in identifying risks in cloud-based applications early in the development process, an approach known as "Shift Left."

title: Salesforce unveils Genie, a real-time data platform to power its apps
summary: Salesforce Inc. has unveiled Salesforce Genie, a new real-time data platform designed to power its entire suite of customer relationship management products. Genie aims to unify and personalize customer data in real-time, enabling highly personalized experiences across marketing, sales, and commerce, and addressing data fragmentation issues caused by numerous separate applications.

title: How CrowdStrike plans to become a generational platform
summary: CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. has rapidly become a leading security firm, boasting over $2 billion in annual recurring revenue and a $40 billion market capitalization, with projections to reach $5 billion in revenue by mid-decade. The company's success is attributed to its architectural platform, strong go-to-market strategies, and strategic acquisitions, positioning it as a potential generational platform in the cybersecurity sector, despite broader market headwinds. The article delves into CrowdStrike's platform, customer spending momentum, and its focus on extended detection and response (XDR) as it aims to consolidate point products in the market.

title: Expert: Zillow Privacy Lawsuit Has Wider Implications
summary: A civil lawsuit filed against Zillow Group Inc. and Microsoft Corp. alleges privacy violations through the collection of user interaction data on Zillow's website, including mouse movements and keystrokes. An expert in internet privacy law suggests this case, and similar ones, could force significant changes in how companies draft their privacy policies and collect user data. The core issue revolves around the vagueness of Zillow's privacy policy and whether it adequately discloses the extent of data collection to consumers.

title: S&P 500 could see another '10-15% correction downwards': Strategist
summary: Ann Berry, founder of Threadneedle Ventures, predicts the S&P 500 could face another 10-15% correction due to macroeconomic challenges like the strong dollar, rising energy prices in Europe, and persistent inflation concerns. Despite the gloomy outlook, she suggests opportunities for value stock picking, particularly in companies like Netflix that have credible turnaround plans, and stable companies with good dividends for long-term retail investors. The market is seen as under-pricing broader macro issues beyond just Fed rate hikes.

title: Rigetti Announces New Partnerships and Details Multi-Year Roadmap Designed to Reach Quantum Advantage
summary: Rigetti Computing, Inc. announced an updated multi-year roadmap and key partnerships at its inaugural investor day, focusing on achieving Quantum Advantage. The roadmap includes the upcoming Ankaa™ 84-qubit system and Lyra™ 336-qubit system, alongside collaborations with companies like Keysight, NVIDIA, Bluefors, and Microsoft Azure to enhance hardware, software, and climate modeling applications. Rigetti is also expanding its Fab-1 facility and developing next-generation cryogenic platforms.

title: What’s New in Artificial Intelligence from the 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle™
summary: The 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle for Artificial Intelligence highlights key AI innovations expected to drive significant business benefits and will see mainstream adoption within two to five years. These innovations are categorized into data-centric, model-centric, applications-centric, and human-centric AI, with a focus on impact on both business leaders and engineering teams. The article emphasizes technologies like composite AI, decision intelligence, edge AI, and responsible AI as crucial for competitive advantage and solving complex business problems.

title: Blameless announces integrations with ServiceNow and Microsoft Teams
summary: Blameless has announced new integrations with ServiceNow and Microsoft Teams to enhance its incident management platform for enterprise customers, streamlining workflows and improving incident response. These integrations centralize incident management, automate channel creation, and provide real-time updates and reliability insights, ultimately reducing workload on engineering teams. This move helps Blameless expand its presence in the enterprise SaaS market and further invest in DevOps and IT workflow tooling.

title: Cloud optimization co Zesty raises $75m
summary: Israeli cloud optimization company Zesty has raised $75 million in a Series B funding round co-led by B Capital and Sapphire Ventures, bringing its total funding to $116 million. The company's automated system dynamically adjusts cloud configurations to ensure stability and optimize performance rather than solely focusing on cost reduction. Zesty has doubled its annual recurring revenue since early 2022 and employs 120 people, serving over 300 customers with most revenue from North America.

title: Oracle offers its MySQL HeatWave database and analytics on Amazon’s cloud
summary: Oracle has made its MySQL HeatWave cloud database service available on Amazon's AWS cloud, allowing customers to use the service without migrating their data from AWS. This move enables Oracle to reach customers who have historically stored their data on AWS, even though Oracle directly competes with Amazon's database services. Oracle also plans to offer this database platform on Microsoft's Azure cloud in the future.

title: UnitedHealth Group’s Ann Williamson: Protecting privacy through security
summary: Ann Williamson, Chief Privacy Officer and Deputy General of UnitedHealth Group, discusses the critical link between privacy and security, stemming from her diverse career path in tech and law. She emphasizes that an effective privacy program is impossible without a robust security program and highlights the importance of collaboration between privacy and security teams. Williamson is also passionate about mentoring women in technology, advocating for training successful women from other fields to address cybersecurity staff shortages.

title: Small Business UCaaS M&A: Ooma Acquires OnSip -
summary: Ooma has acquired OnSip, a unified communications service provider specializing in small businesses, for $9.75 million in cash. This acquisition aims to expand Ooma's leadership in serving SMB customers and accelerate growth for Ooma Business. The article also provides context on the broader UCaaS market, noting some signs of consolidation and slowing M&A activity in 2022.

title: Microsoft, Lululemon take lead scooping up downtown Vancouver office space in 2022
summary: In 2022, Microsoft Corp. and Lululemon Athletica Inc. have become major acquirers of downtown Vancouver office space, leading to a stabilization in the market despite increased vacancy rates due to new building deliveries. Microsoft secured 468,000 square feet, while Lululemon leased 237,000 square feet, indicating strong demand for top-quality office space. This activity suggests that the current abundance of office space in Vancouver's downtown core will likely be short-lived.

title: Trimble to purchase France-based PAg spraying company
summary: Trimble Inc., a California-based technology company, is acquiring Bilberry, a French manufacturer of selective weed spraying systems. Bilberry's AI and camera system, the Intelligent Spot Spraying System, identifies weeds in real-time and significantly reduces herbicide usage. This acquisition will enhance Trimble’s crop protection portfolio, adding green-on-green selective spraying capabilities and supporting their autonomous solutions development.

title: Buy stocks with wide moats to protect your profits
summary: The article discusses Warren Buffett's "economic moat" concept, highlighting companies with sustainable competitive advantages. It outlines five key characteristics of such companies—intangible assets, cost advantage, switching costs, network effects, and efficient scale—and provides examples like Coca-Cola, Salesforce, and Alphabet. The piece concludes with advice on how investors can identify and invest in these wide-moat companies, including building a personal portfolio or using ETFs and investment trusts.

title: How Telecom Argentina is evolving its B2B segment
summary: Telecom Argentina is aggressively expanding its B2B segment, with 38% of June revenues coming from cloud, cybersecurity, SD-WAN, and IoT solutions, a significant increase from 5% two years prior. The company has invested US$5bn in digital transformation between 2017 and 2021 to become a technology company and is also pursuing international expansion of its B2B services, particularly cybersecurity under the Ubiquo brand in neighboring countries.

title: How to Buy NASDAQ Stocks
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to buy NASDAQ stocks, detailing what the NASDAQ is, who owns its shares, and the pros and cons of investing in them. It covers the steps to purchase NASDAQ stocks, from fixing a budget and choosing a broker to placing an order, and includes a brief history of the exchange. The article also mentions specific index funds and prominent companies listed on the NASDAQ.

title: Jim Chanos Takes Aim at Data Centers and Their High Valuations
summary: Noted contrarian investor Jim Chanos is challenging the high valuations of data center REITs, despite their apparent growth potential. He argues that major cloud providers building their own facilities pose a competitive threat, potentially limiting future growth for companies like Equinix and Digital Realty Trust. Chanos and other analysts also raise concerns about rising costs, intense competition, and opaque valuation metrics for these firms.

title: Software superpower India to join world data capitals: Microsoft Corp president Brad Smith
summary: Microsoft Corp president Brad Smith states that India has become a software superpower and is poised to become one of the world's great data capitals, joining the top 2-3 software economies globally. He highlights India's significant digital progress, its influential role in technology regulation, and its potential to export its software stack to other countries, citing initiatives like ONDC, Aadhaar, and UPI. Smith also notes that India's growing working-age population presents an opportunity amidst an aging workforce in other major economies, and he emphasizes Microsoft's commitment to supporting India's digital growth.

title: Formerly Sacred Now Rotting Silicon Valley Dictum of “Growth at All Costs” Crushes Okta: Shares Collapse 80% from Peak
summary: Okta, a company that provides secure access to cloud-based systems, has seen its shares collapse by 80% from their February 2021 peak after reporting a $210 million net loss and lowering its guidance. Despite consistent and growing annual net losses exceeding $2 billion, executives and analysts have ironically reframed these as "profitability," highlighting a prevailing Silicon Valley mantra of "growth at all costs." The company's struggles are attributed to "sales challenges" and "integration challenges" related to its 2021 acquisition of Auth0, signaling the potential end of an era for this business model.

title: 3 Quantum Computing Stocks That Could 10X by 2030
summary: This article highlights three quantum computing investment opportunities – the Defiance Quantum ETF (QTUM), Honeywell International (HON), and IonQ (IONQ) – that could offer significant returns by 2030. It discusses the disruptive potential of quantum technology across various industries and its rapidly growing market valuation. The article provides an overview of each investment, outlining their current performance, key developments, and analyst forecasts for their future growth.

title: How Royal Caribbean set up a seafaring cloud strategy
summary: Royal Caribbean Group has adopted a multicloud strategy to manage the complex IT needs of its cruise ship fleet, leveraging Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft Azure for different workloads. This approach helps address the unique challenges of seafaring operations, such as unreliable satellite connectivity and the need for robust hybrid solutions. The company emphasizes the importance of balancing internal expertise with external partners and carefully considering cost and talent access in its vendor selection process.

title: Microsoft Korea introduces its new startup program ‘Microsoft Launcher’
summary: Microsoft Korea launched "Microsoft Launcher," a new program designed to support local startups at every stage of their growth. This platform offers benefits valued up to ₩500,000,000, including technology, tools, Azure credits, and mentorship, aiming to address common challenges faced by Korean startups. The initiative is part of Microsoft's broader effort to foster a healthy digital ecosystem in Asia, a region recognized as a global innovation powerhouse.

title: Amazon not expected to bid for Electronic Arts, says CNBC
summary: CNBC reported that Amazon.com Inc is not expected to bid for Electronic Arts Inc, refuting an earlier report about a potential takeover. This news caused EA's stock to fluctuate, initially jumping 15% on the acquisition rumor before settling to a 4% gain. Amazon has recently been active in acquisitions, diversifying its business, while analysts see EA as an attractive target due to its strong licenses and metaverse potential, despite a struggling global gaming industry.

title: Microsoft Wants Uber Drivers’ Facial Recognition Privacy Case Tossed on Jurisdictional Grounds
summary: Microsoft has filed a motion seeking to dismiss remaining biometric privacy claims against it regarding Uber's use of its facial recognition technology, "Real Time ID Check." The company argues that Illinois courts lack general or specific jurisdiction over it as Microsoft is headquartered in Washington and incorporated in Delaware, and its technology does not specifically target Illinois. The plaintiffs, Illinois-based Uber drivers, allege that the consentless capture of their faceprints by Uber through Microsoft's technology violates the Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act (BIPA).

title: These Wide-Moat Stocks Are Gaining Ground
summary: Quality stocks with wide economic moats, including Microsoft and Amazon, have outperformed since the bear market low in June, despite still being undervalued. While narrow-moat stocks have seen stronger recent gains due to market-cap weighting of companies like Apple and Tesla, wide-moat companies are better positioned to handle inflation due to their pricing power. Overall, Morningstar analysts consider wide-moat stocks to be deeply undervalued compared to overpriced narrow-moat stocks.

title: Microsoft named a Leader in 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Data Integration Tools
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Data Integration Tools, signifying its ongoing commitment to comprehensive and cost-effective data integration solutions. The company's offerings, including Azure Data Factory and Azure Synapse Link, provide end-to-end data integration strategies to help organizations manage and gain insights from their rapidly growing data. This recognition highlights Microsoft's focus on empowering businesses to achieve competitive advantages and better outcomes through data.

title: Why the ESG/Tech Combination Is Important
summary: Broad market environmental, social, and governance (ESG) exchange-traded funds (ETFs) frequently have significant allocations to technology stocks. For example, the Invesco ESG Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQMG) has a technology weight of almost 62%. While some critics view this as over-reliance on tech, experts argue that technology companies often embody sustainable development principles, making them suitable for ESG funds despite facing scrutiny on issues like data privacy and energy consumption.

title: No, Microsoft did not acquire Sony
summary: A widespread but fake news report claimed that Microsoft had acquired Sony for $130 billion, including all its divisions like Sony Music and PlayStation. The article debunks this claim, citing the lack of credible media coverage, absence of official statements from either company, and the complex regulatory approvals such a deal would require.

title: Aflac virtualizes the customer enrollment experience
summary: Aflac successfully virtualized its customer enrollment experience during the pandemic to support its independent agents, who were facing significant business risks due to social distancing. By combining existing technologies and building a new enrollment platform on AWS, Aflac enabled agents to conduct virtual meetings, co-browse with clients, and process policy purchases more efficiently. This digital transformation, which included the development of microsites and a "bionic" agent approach, earned Aflac a CIO 100 Award and lays the groundwork for a full migration to the cloud and further intelligent automation.

title: Amazon (AWS) and Microsoft Data Centers in Virginia
summary: This article details the extensive presence of Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft data centers across Virginia, highlighting locations in both Northern Virginia and emerging areas like Boydton. It outlines specific data center sites, their sizes, and ongoing development plans for both companies, emphasizing their investments and strategic growth in the region. The report also covers their respective cloud regions, availability zones, and cloud on-ramps to support demand for compute, storage, and database capabilities.

title: Microsoft plans to shut down its Olympia Corp test lab for Windows Enterprise
summary: Microsoft Corporation is closing its 'Olympia Corp' program, a test lab designed for Windows enterprise users to test business-oriented features. Participants were notified via email about the impending shutdown, effective September 12, 2022, and advised to back up any data. Launched in 2017, the program helped Microsoft gather feedback for enterprise Windows versions, but the company now believes other simulations and demos can achieve similar goals.

title: PTC Channel Chief Stuart Heavyside On The ‘Massive’ SaaS Opportunity And Why Digital Marketing Is Key To Partner Success
summary: PTC Channel Chief Stuart Heavyside emphasizes the significant revenue growth opportunity for partners in the transition to Software as a Service (SaaS). He details PTC's strategic shift to SaaS for core products like Windchill and Creo, highlighting the importance of customer success and digital marketing for partner profitability. Heavyside asserts that the SaaS market for PLM is projected to double, presenting a massive opportunity for partners to earn substantially more per license dollar with increased service revenue.

title: Buffett's Berkshire boosts Ally, Activision holdings; sheds Verizon
summary: Berkshire Hathaway significantly increased its stakes in Ally Financial and Activision Blizzard while completely exiting its investment in Verizon Communications by June 30. The conglomerate, run by Warren Buffett, also slowed its overall stock buying in the second quarter, making fewer new purchases and sales compared to the first quarter. Berkshire's portfolio continues to be dominated by Apple, with substantial investments in oil companies Chevron and Occidental Petroleum.

title: Thematic Investing: 3 Key Trends in Cybersecurity
summary: This article examines three key trends shaping the cybersecurity industry: increasing costs of data breaches, new vulnerabilities created by remote work, and the role of AI in reducing breach costs. It highlights the financial impact of cybercrime and data breaches on businesses and illustrates how AI-based solutions are becoming crucial for detection and response. The article also introduces the Global X Cybersecurity ETF (BUG) for investors interested in this sector.

title: Johnson Controls AI-enhanced OpenBlue Platform Cuts Microsoft's Beijing Campus Energy Footprint
summary: Johnson Controls partnered with Microsoft Beijing Campus to implement its AI-enhanced OpenBlue platform, resulting in significant energy savings of 27.9% and 98% uptime for key equipment. This collaboration helped the campus receive an energy-saving endorsement and subsidy from the Beijing Municipal Government, highlighting the potential of advanced technology for sustainable building operations and carbon emission reduction. The project demonstrates a successful application of AI and integrated building management systems in achieving net-zero goals.

title: Russian hacking group claims attack on Lockheed Martin
summary: A prominent Russian hacking group called Killnet claims responsibility for a DDoS attack that took Lockheed Martin's websites offline. The group stated its motivation was Lockheed Martin's provision of M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems to Ukraine and also claims to have stolen information on Lockheed Martin employees. Lockheed Martin denies any system compromise, while Killnet's founder issued a chilling warning of escalating attacks.

title: Microsoft Sues “Black Market” Software Distributor for TM and Copyright Infringement
summary: Microsoft Corporation has filed a lawsuit against The Search People Enterprises Ltd. and its principal for copyright and trademark infringement. The suit alleges the defendants are distributing "black market" access devices for Microsoft software, which they falsely advertise as genuine. Microsoft conducted over two dozen test purchases to confirm the illegality and is seeking a permanent injunction and damages.

title: SoFi launches first-of-its-kind web3 ETF
summary: SoFi has launched its first-of-its-kind Web 3 ETF (TWEB), providing investors access to companies powering the next tech revolution, including the metaverse and artificial intelligence. The ETF tracks the SoFi Solactive ARTIS® Web 3.0 Index, diversifying investments across 40 securities in NFTs & Tokenization, Blockchain Technology, Metaverse, and Big Data & AI. The article also highlights various risks associated with investing in these rapidly evolving technologies.

title: Security for next generation telecommunication networks
summary: Microsoft emphasizes security as a first principle in developing networks and systems for next-generation telecommunication, particularly 5G and 6G, by adopting a zero-trust security architecture. The article details how the disaggregated software components in modern telecom networks increase the attack surface and how Microsoft Azure's massive scale and sophisticated defenses, including AI/ML and cloud security capabilities, are leveraged to protect against threats to Open RAN architecture and critical infrastructure. It also addresses strategies for mitigating the impact of compromised systems through rapid detection and recovery mechanisms.

title: Nvidia warns of lower second-quarter revenue on gaming weakness
summary: Nvidia Corp warned of a 19% drop in second-quarter revenue from the prior quarter due to weakness in its gaming business, sending its shares down by about 8%. This follows similar warnings from other chipmakers and is attributed to consumers weighing purchases of discretionary items amidst economic concerns, as well as continued supply chain issues. The company expects to report overall Q2 revenue of approximately $6.70 billion, significantly below analyst estimates.

title: An oil company is seeking property tax breaks to finance its plans to remove carbon dioxide from Texas skies
summary: Occidental Petroleum is seeking significant property tax breaks in Texas to finance its ambitious plans for large-scale direct air capture projects aimed at removing carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. These projects, potentially worth tens of billions of dollars, would be the first commercial-scale operations of a technology that is currently expensive and has raised concerns among some environmentalists about its effectiveness and potential impacts. The company plans to use the captured carbon dioxide for enhanced oil recovery and to sell carbon offsets, leveraging federal and state incentives to make the projects viable.

title: Large Indiana employers Eli Lilly and Cummins speak out about the state's new restrictive abortion law
summary: Large Indiana employers Eli Lilly and Cummins have voiced strong opposition to the state's newly passed restrictive abortion law. Eli Lilly stated the law would hinder its ability to attract diverse talent and force it to plan for employment growth outside Indiana, while Cummins expressed concerns about its impact on talent attraction and retention. Both companies emphasized that the law conflicts with ensuring women's full participation in the workforce and the need for inclusive environments.

title: Gartner CFO Survey Reveals Real Estate and Finance Functions Most Likely to Face Cuts Within a Year
summary: A July 2022 Gartner survey of over 200 CFOs indicates that real estate/facilities management and finance functions are most vulnerable to budget cuts in the next year due to factors like increased remote work. Conversely, IT and sales functions are expected to see spending increases, with 40% of CFOs planning to boost IT investment, reflecting a focus on digital technology and automation to combat inflation and drive growth. The report suggests that "efficient growth" companies, which strategically invest during economic difficulties, achieve better long-term results.

title: How the economic downturn is affecting the AI sector
summary: The economic downturn is impacting the AI sector, with enterprises cutting budgets and slowing AI projects, despite AI being an integral part of the economy. While some vendors and venture capitalists are feeling the squeeze through stricter investment processes and hiring freezes, others remain insulated due to prior budgeting or long-term investment strategies. Experts suggest experimental AI projects will be paused, but the long-term outlook for next-generation AI technologies remains positive.

title: Microstrategy Outperforms Every Asset Class and Big Tech Stock Since Adopting Bitcoin Strategy, Says CEO
summary: Microstrategy CEO Michael Saylor highlights that the company's bitcoin strategy has led to significant outperformance against all asset classes and major tech stocks since its adoption. Saylor attributes this success to bitcoin's digital property characteristics and its appeal as a safe haven asset. The company's unique approach involved acquiring substantial bitcoin holdings and integrating it into their corporate strategy.

title: Salesforce Shuts Hong Kong Office Amid Brewing US - China Tensions; Consolidates Partnership With Alibaba
summary: Salesforce is closing its Hong Kong office and consolidating its strategic partnership with Alibaba Group Holding Limited to expand its software relationship management presence in Greater China. This move comes amid increasing US-China tensions and new Chinese data regulations, following other tech giants scaling back their presence. Salesforce will focus on hiring in Guangzhou, with Alibaba handling sales in mainland China and Hong Kong, and Singapore managing Taiwan.

title: Palo Alto Networks Unit 42 Helps Customers Better Address Cybersecurity Threats Through New Managed Detection and Response Service
summary: Palo Alto Networks introduced its Unit 42 Managed Detection and Response (MDR) service to address the growing cybersecurity skills gap and increasing attack surfaces. This new service combines Cortex XDR technology with Unit 42's threat intelligence to provide 24/7 threat detection, investigation, and response. It aims to help organizations identify and respond to security threats in real-time, allowing them to focus on other security priorities.

title: Arista Buys Pluribus Networks To Grow Cloud Networking Offering
summary: Arista Networks has acquired Pluribus Networks to enhance its Converged Cloud Fabric offering and strengthen its partnership with Ericsson. This is Arista's second acquisition in the quarter, following Untangle, as it focuses on acquiring technology and talent that align with its culture to expand its cloud networking solutions and address lower-end security and edge threat management markets. The acquisition was disclosed as Arista reported surpassing $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time, despite ongoing global supply chain challenges.

title: Oracle reportedly implements layoffs as part of cost-cutting initiative
summary: Oracle Corp. is reportedly implementing layoffs in the San Francisco Bay Area and its customer experience software division as part of a cost-cutting initiative aiming to reduce expenses by up to $1 billion. These layoffs are expected to affect thousands of employees across the U.S., Canada, India, and Europe, aligning with previous reports from July. Despite these cuts, Oracle continues to experience growth in its cloud infrastructure and managed enterprise resource planning platforms, supported by its acquisition of Cerner Corp.

title: Microsoft Links Raspberry Robin USB Worm to Russian Evil Corp Hackers
summary: Microsoft has identified a potential connection between the Raspberry Robin USB-based worm and the Russian cybercrime group Evil Corp. The tech giant observed FakeUpdates malware delivered via Raspberry Robin infections, which subsequently led to actions resembling pre-ransomware behavior associated with Evil Corp (DEV-0243). While this marks the first evidence of post-exploitation activity for Raspberry Robin, the exact relationships between the involved threat actors remain unclear, according to experts.

title: Microsoft named a Leader in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Robotic Process Automation
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Robotic Process Automation for the second consecutive year. This achievement underscores the significant momentum and expansion of their RPA offerings since 2019, including the integration of Power Automate for desktop into Windows and new features like hosted RPA bots and pay-as-you-go options. The company acknowledges the crucial contributions of its customers, community, and partners to the success of Power Automate.

title: How a Top T. Rowe Price Manager Is Positioned for a Continued Bear Market
summary: Justin White, manager of the T. Rowe Price All-Cap Opportunities Fund, is preparing his portfolio for a prolonged bear market by focusing on inflation- and recession-resistant stocks like Visa, Chubb, Veeva Systems, and Moderna. While he believes much of the market pain has already occurred, he anticipates further challenges, particularly given uncertainties surrounding a potential recession and the Federal Reserve's battle against inflation. White emphasizes individual stock selection over broad sector trends and has adjusted his portfolio by trimming growth stocks and increasing positions in more resilient companies.

title: Seagate Technology Holdings PLC stock rises Wednesday, outperforms market
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings PLC (STX) saw its stock rise 3.54% on Wednesday, outperforming the broader market which also had a strong day. Despite the rise, the stock remains $38.99 short of its 52-week high. Seagate's performance was mixed compared to competitors like Microsoft Corp. and Western Digital Corp., but its trading volume surpassed its 50-day average.

title: Rumors of Oracle Layoffs Highlight Company's Position in Cloud Race
summary: Rumors are circulating about potential Oracle layoffs affecting thousands of workers across multiple divisions, following reports from The Information and CRN. This comes as Oracle intensifies its efforts to compete in the cloud market against giants like AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud, despite facing an uphill battle in developer preference. While Oracle has secured wins like TikTok as a cloud client and offers competitive salaries for in-demand tech roles, its broad transformation to keep pace in the rapidly evolving cloud landscape is under scrutiny amid tech industry hiring slowdowns.

title: Lumen advances 5G technology with a simplified, holistic cybersecurity mindset
summary: Lumen embraced a simplified, holistic cybersecurity mindset to advance its 5G technology, partnering with Microsoft to address identity and compliance challenges during its cloud migration and system modernization. By implementing Azure Active Directory and other Microsoft Security solutions, Lumen has enhanced data protection, streamlined operations, and achieved greater transparency and automation in managing data access. This strategic move allows Lumen to focus on innovation while ensuring robust security and compliance for its cutting-edge 5G infrastructure.

title: Manufacturing Titan 3M Is Spinning Off Its Healthcare Business Into A Separate Company
summary: 3M announced its plan to spin off its healthcare division into a separate, publicly traded company. This new healthcare entity, with approximately $8.6 billion in sales in 2021, will focus on innovation in areas like wound care, oral care, healthcare IT, and biopharma filtration. The move aims to create two well-capitalized companies better positioned to pursue their respective growth strategies.

title: iRhythm Gains FDA Clearance for its Clinically Integrated ZEUS System
summary: iRhythm Technologies announced FDA 510(k) clearance for its ZEUS System for the Zio Watch, developed in partnership with Verily. This integrated solution provides a clinical-grade, wrist-worn wearable for long-term continuous monitoring to detect and characterize atrial fibrillation (AFib), aiding clinicians in diagnosis and intervention. The Zio Watch with the ZEUS System aims to enhance patient care by offering a cost-effective and noninvasive monitoring platform, leveraging iRhythm's extensive ECG data repository and proprietary AI algorithms.

title: ServiceNow Inc. stock falls Monday, underperforms market
summary: ServiceNow Inc. stock saw a 1.52% decline on Monday, closing at $440.00, despite an overall positive trading session for the stock market. This marks the second consecutive day of losses for the company, which is $267.60 short of its 52-week high. ServiceNow also underperformed against competitors like Microsoft and Qualcomm, although it did better than International Business Machines Corp.

title: Healthcare Triangle launches regional HQ in Singapore to bolster medical innovation in APAC
summary: Healthcare Triangle Inc. has inaugurated its regional headquarters in Singapore, planning to invest $25 million to advance digital healthcare across the Asia Pacific region. This expansion aims to foster medical innovation, create over 500 jobs, and support the digital transformation of healthcare and pharmaceutical sectors by leveraging cloud-based platforms. The company's focus includes strategic partnerships and collaborations to build a more resilient healthcare ecosystem in the APAC region.

title: Oracle adds new chapter for multicloud story through cloud database service with Microsoft
summary: Oracle and Microsoft have announced the availability of Oracle Database Service for Microsoft Azure, allowing Azure customers streamlined access to Oracle Database Services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). This partnership aims to simplify multicloud solutions for their shared enterprise customer base, building on a previous interoperability alliance from 2019. The new service enables Azure users to provision and monitor Oracle Database Services in OCI and build applications on Azure that connect to Oracle services such as Autonomous Database.

title: Microsoft Teams back up for most users after global outage
summary: Microsoft Teams has largely recovered from a global outage that affected tens of thousands of users. The disruption was attributed to a recent software update containing a broken connection to an internal storage service. The company is monitoring for any residual impact and ensuring all functions are fully restored.

title: Oracle and Microsoft Agree to Deepen Interoperability of Cloud Platforms
summary: Oracle Corp. and Microsoft Corp. have announced a deeper interoperability between their cloud platforms, enabling customers to more easily run projects across both services. This agreement reflects an evolving market where customers utilize multiple clouds and resist being locked into a single provider. The move acknowledges the multicloud environment, with about two-thirds of enterprise-level companies already using multiple cloud solutions.

title: Oracle and Microsoft announce availability of Oracle Database Service for Microsoft Azure
summary: Oracle and Microsoft have announced the general availability of Oracle Database Service for Microsoft Azure, enabling Azure customers to easily provision, access, and monitor Oracle Database services on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). This collaboration extends their 2019 partnership on Oracle Interconnect for Microsoft Azure, simplifying multicloud operations for joint customers. The service bears no charges for usage, data egress/ingress between OCI and Azure, with customers only paying for consumed Azure or Oracle services.

title: First Lady of Ukraine Accepts Computer Donation from HP Inc. for Ukrainian Children and Healthcare Workers
summary: First Lady of Ukraine, Olena Zelenska, met with HP Inc. and the Global Business Coalition for Education to accept a donation of technology and learning materials for Ukrainian children and healthcare workers. This initiative, "Digital Equity for Ukraine," is a $30 million partnership aimed at providing computers to displaced students and families, with Microsoft offering software support. The computers will be distributed both within Ukraine and to refugees outside the country to ensure continued learning and support during the ongoing conflict.

title: Netflix Lost Nearly 1 Million Subscribers Last Quarter. Here’s What That Means for Its Future
summary: Netflix reported a loss of nearly 1 million subscribers in the second quarter of 2022, compounding its 200,000 subscriber loss from the previous quarter. Despite this, the total loss was less than projected, leading to a temporary stock surge, though shares remain significantly down for the year. In response, Netflix is pursuing efforts like an ad-supported tier and focusing on high-quality original content to drive future growth and revenue.

title: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce – Digital Transformation Strategies
summary: This report details Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce's (CIBC) digital transformation strategies, focusing on its use of AI, cloud, blockchain, and online payments. It covers CIBC's ICT spending, technology focus areas, partnerships, investments, and initiatives to enhance its digital banking capabilities. The article also provides insights into key ICT spending categories and technology themes for the company.

title: Microsoft Cloud for Sovereignty: The most flexible and comprehensive solution for digital sovereignty
summary: Microsoft Cloud for Sovereignty is a new solution enabling public sector customers to use Microsoft Cloud while meeting compliance, security, and policy needs, including data residency and sovereign controls. It provides increased control over data and transparency into cloud operations and governance processes. The solution is partner-led and focuses on working with in-country partners to deliver customized cloud solutions that address unique government requirements.

title: Microsoft wants to add Stories to company intranets
summary: Microsoft is introducing a "Stories" feature to its Viva "employee experience" platform, called Viva Engage, aiming to bring the popular snackable content format to corporate intranets. This new AI-powered component for Microsoft Teams will allow employees to create and share video Stories, serving as a replacement for Yammer Communities for Teams. While questions remain about its adoption given past intranet engagement issues, Microsoft believes Stories can foster connections and cater to a workforce familiar with such modalities from personal social platforms.

title: Reddit Turns One Down Under
summary: Reddit is celebrating its one-year anniversary of expanding into Australia, which is now its fourth-largest user base. To commemorate this milestone, Reddit is launching its inaugural Australian consumer brand campaign, "Find your people," highlighting its diverse communities and increasing engagement with Australian users and brands. The platform has seen significant growth in local teams and user activity across various communities, including a successful partnership with the Australian Football League and effective ad campaigns for brands like Up.

title: Tech Moves: Vimeo hires Seattle execs; Microsoft corporate VP retires; and more
summary: Vimeo has appointed Lynn Girotto as chief marketing officer and Ashraf Alkarmi as chief product officer, both based in the Seattle area. Microsoft corporate vice president Sam George is retiring after 25 years with the company. The article also details new hires at Absci, Amazon, SeekOut, RealNetworks, and TEAL, covering key personnel changes in the Pacific Northwest tech community.

title: Twelve and Alaska Airlines to collaborate with Microsoft to advance sustainable aviation fuel derived from recaptured CO2 and renewable energy
summary: Twelve, Alaska Airlines, and Microsoft have partnered to advance sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) derived from recaptured CO2 and renewable energy. The collaboration aims to develop and demonstrate Twelve's E-Jet®, a low-carbon jet fuel, with the ultimate goal of powering commercial flights and reducing the aviation industry's reliance on fossil fuels. This initiative supports Alaska Airlines' path to net-zero emissions by 2040 and Microsoft's efforts to decarbonize hard-to-abate sectors.

title: WaterNSW lays the foundation for HR automation using robust technology
summary: WaterNSW, a state-owned corporation, has implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 Human Resources as a core component of its digital transformation, aiming to automate HR processes and enhance employee experience. This initiative, part of a three-horizon strategy, focuses on simplifying HR operations, improving data management, and providing self-service capabilities for its 1,000 employees. The transition to an agile delivery model allowed for rapid development and optimization of the HR case management platform, leading to better reporting and cost efficiencies.

title: FMET Makes It Simple to Take Long View of Metaverse
summary: The Fidelity Metaverse ETF (FMET) offers investors a way to engage with the growing metaverse theme, which is projected to be worth over $800 million by 2028. Despite a retrenchment in growth stocks, the long-term outlook for the metaverse remains compelling, especially with established companies like Meta Platforms, Alphabet, Apple, and Nvidia investing heavily in its development. FMET provides a diversified basket approach to this theme, including exposure to gaming and numerous mega-cap growth companies, with an affordable annual fee.

title: Big Companies Offering Employees Mid-Year Raises to Cope with Inflation
summary: Many large U.S. corporations, including Exxon Mobil Corp., PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, Microsoft Corp., and T. Rowe Price Group Inc., are implementing mid-year raises or special bonuses for their employees to combat inflation and retain talent in a tight labor market. These moves are a response to increased living expenses and a desire to remain competitive employers, even as some executives express concerns about a potential economic slowdown. Companies are proactively adjusting compensation, with some even granting raises to new hires to address attrition and inflation pressures.

title: What's the Impact of the Strong Dollar on My Portfolio?
summary: The strong U.S. dollar, experiencing its biggest rally in 20 years, negatively impacts non-U.S. fund returns and profitability for American companies operating overseas. While it offers advantages for consumers traveling abroad, investors in international stocks and bonds face challenges due to unfavorable exchange rates and increased repayment costs for dollar-denominated debt. Despite the difficulties, some Morningstar analysts suggest currency hedging can minimize volatility, and others view the current currency weakness as an attractive buying opportunity for international funds.

title: 8x8 Deploys XCaaS to 1,500 Hounslow Borough Council Employees
summary: 8x8 has deployed its XCaaS platform to 1,500 employees at Hounslow Borough Council, integrating Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS) and Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS) with Microsoft Teams. This deployment aims to simplify communications, enhance efficiency for staff across various departments, and improve interactions with the borough's 270,000 residents. The initiative further solidifies 8x8's presence in the UK public sector, with XCaaS now used in over one-third of London's boroughs.

title: Discord IPO: Everything to know about Discord
summary: This article provides an in-depth look at Discord ahead of its anticipated IPO, covering its valuation, business model, competitors, and growth strategy. It details how the company generates revenue primarily through its Nitro subscription service and outlines its efforts to expand beyond its core gaming audience. The piece also discusses Discord's profitability status, ownership, and key personnel.

title: Merck and NJIT's New Jersey Innovation Institute Partner on Health Care Startup Development
summary: Merck and the New Jersey Innovation Institute (NJII) have launched the Merck Digital Sciences Studio (MDSS) to foster innovative technologies for drug discovery and development. The MDSS will support early-stage biomedical startups, particularly those focusing on AI and machine learning, with direct investment, cloud computing access, and opportunities to pilot technologies with Merck scientists. This collaboration aims to accelerate digital technologies in pharmaceutical research and development through locations in Newark, N.J., and Cambridge, Mass.

title: HPE Is The First Big OEM To Adopt Ampere Computing Arm Chips
summary: HPE has announced its adoption of Ampere Computing's "Mystique" Altra Max Arm server chip in its standard ProLiant rack-mounted server, marking Ampere's first major OEM server maker partnership. This move, showcased with the ProLiant RL300 server, signifies HPE's renewed commitment to Arm-based processors after previous cautious ventures. The decision is driven by the Altra chips' deterministic performance and competitive price/performance, particularly for cloud-native workloads, positioning HPE to compete aggressively against Intel Xeon and AMD Epyc processors.

title: I tried Elon Musk's Starlink internet on a Royal Caribbean cruise ship
summary: The author tested Elon Musk's Starlink internet on Royal Caribbean's Freedom of the Seas. Initial speeds were significantly faster than Royal Caribbean's typical Voom service, allowing for streaming and Zoom calls. While speeds varied slightly in different ship locations, Starlink generally far exceeded expectations for internet at sea.

title: Accenture and Avanade Named Microsoft 2022 Global SI Partner of the Year for 17th Time
summary: Accenture and Avanade have been named the Microsoft 2022 Global SI Partner of the Year for the 17th time, a record achievement. They also received ten additional awards, including several country-level Partner of the Year awards, recognizing their excellence in innovation and implementation of customer solutions based on Microsoft technology. This acknowledges their combined service capabilities, global scale, and solution development in solving complex client challenges and addressing sustainability.

title: HoloLens 2 helps Novo Nordisk employees see work in new ways
summary: Novo Nordisk is implementing Microsoft HoloLens 2 and related Dynamics 365 technologies to transform its manufacturing operations and employee training. This includes using augmented instructions for complex procedures and facilitating virtual site visits, significantly improving efficiency, onboarding, and reducing travel needs across its global facilities. The technology has been well-received by employees, leading to improved performance consistency and a more flexible workplace.

title: Abortion assistance: Kroger to offer up to $4,000 of out-of-state travel costs for employees seeking abortion
summary: Kroger announced it will offer up to $4,000 to cover out-of-state travel costs for employees seeking abortion and fertility treatments, following the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade. The company, headquartered in Cincinnati, operates stores in states like Ohio and Kentucky where abortion is now banned or mostly banned. This move aligns Kroger with nearly two dozen other major U.S. companies providing similar assistance.

title: Roe v. Wade overturned: Here are companies paying for abortion travel costs for employees
summary: Following the Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade, numerous major U.S. companies announced expanded support and financial assistance for employees seeking abortions in states with new restrictions. This support often includes covering travel expenses for medical care unavailable in their home states. Corporations are responding to pressure from investors, customers, and employees, and are concerned about the impact on talent attraction and retention.

title: Cloudflare recognized by Microsoft as a Security Software Innovator
summary: Cloudflare announced it has won the Security Software Innovator award at the 2022 Microsoft Security Excellence Awards. This recognition highlights Cloudflare's innovative approach to Zero Trust and security solutions through deep integrations with Microsoft, helping joint customers secure their web applications and employees. The article emphasizes the importance of Zero Trust in the modern threat landscape, detailing Cloudflare One's comprehensive capabilities.

title: Avnet, and Amazon Web Services enters into a global strategic partnership
summary: Avnet and Amazon Web Services (AWS) have formed a global strategic partnership aimed at helping Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) of IoT solutions accelerate their time to market. This collaboration will enable Avnet’s IoTConnect Platform to leverage AWS's extensive portfolio of services, creating a scalable and secure platform for application-specific usage. The partnership provides OEMs with pre-integrated and abstracted capabilities, such as device provisioning, multi-layer security, and business intelligence, allowing them to focus on differentiating their connected products.

title: Microsoft stops selling emotion-reading tech, limits face recognition
summary: Microsoft Corp announced it will stop selling emotion-reading technology based on facial images and will also limit unfettered access to its facial recognition technology. This move aligns with efforts by leading cloud providers to self-regulate sensitive technologies as lawmakers consider new legal limits. Existing customers of emotion-reading tools will have one year before losing access, and facial recognition services will now require approval for use.

title: Microsoft Office 365 has ability to ‘spy’ on workers
summary: Research has revealed that Microsoft Office 365 contains tools that allow employers to monitor staff emails and computer usage, raising privacy concerns. Despite Microsoft's 2020 changes to protect employee privacy by aggregating data, UCL research found that "content search" and "audit" tools still enable detailed individual surveillance. This has led to calls for Microsoft to increase transparency and notify employees when such monitoring tools are enabled.

title: Corsair Dark Core RGB Pro SE wireless gaming mouse review
summary: The Corsair Dark Core RGB Pro SE is a heavy, feature-rich wireless gaming mouse offering excellent connectivity and ergonomics. While praised for its build quality, customizable RGB, and precise sensor, its significant weight (142g) and mediocre battery life (20 hours with RGB on) are notable drawbacks, especially for competitive FPS players. The review concludes that it's a great option for those who prefer comfortable, heavier mice for productivity and slower-paced games, rather than twitch shooters.

title: Native Advertising Examples: 17 of the Best and Most Inspiring Native Ads
summary: This article showcases 17 successful native advertising campaigns by various global brands, highlighting how native ads integrate seamlessly into content to drive engagement, awareness, and sales. It emphasizes native advertising's effectiveness as a non-interruptive and contextually relevant alternative to traditional ads, detailing increased CTRs, lead generation, and ROAS achieved by companies like Adidas, Vodafone, and Square Yards through platforms like Taboola. The article concludes by reinforcing why native advertising is a powerful digital marketing technique, citing its non-disruptive nature and contextual relevance.

title: Is Juneteenth being observed by companies in the Dow industrials? Here's how some are handling it.
summary: This article explores how companies in the Dow industrials are observing Juneteenth, a federal holiday. While many Dow components are closed, some are open, and others offer employees the choice to take it as a paid holiday. The article also notes the relatively quick adoption of Juneteenth as a day off for exchanges compared to Martin Luther King, Jr. Day.

title: Procter & Gamble Partners With Microsoft To Transform And Accelerate Digital Manufacturing
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) has partnered with Microsoft to advance digital manufacturing through cloud, AI, and digital transformation technologies. This multiyear collaboration aims to make manufacturing smarter by utilizing Microsoft Cloud, Azure data, and AI solutions to optimize P&G's manufacturing and packaging processes, initially focusing on diaper and paper towel production. The initiative seeks to improve predictive quality, reduce downtime, enhance supply chain efficiency, and explore the concept of an "industrial metaverse" for simulating manufacturing environments.

title: L3Harris in talks to buy Israeli spyware firm NSO - reports
summary: U.S. defence contractor L3Harris is reportedly in talks to acquire Israeli spyware firm NSO Group, a deal that would require approvals from U.S. and Israeli authorities and L3Harris's board. The potential acquisition raises concerns in the White House due to NSO's controversial Pegasus software, which has been used by governments to spy on individuals, leading to the company being blacklisted by the U.S. Commerce Department. If approved, the deal could potentially remove NSO from the banned list and allow its assets to be exclusively used with the United States and its allies.

title: P&G taps Microsoft for cloud services to boost production efficiency
summary: Procter & Gamble has partnered with Microsoft to utilize its Azure cloud computing services and predictive analytics to enhance manufacturing efficiency, reduce costs, and improve product delivery. This collaboration aims to leverage digital manufacturing visibility and advanced analytics to optimize production processes for various P&G products globally. The initiative builds on four years of prior cooperation, focusing on better data utilization, automation, digital twins, and sustainability.

title: How Jabil’s New HQ Facilitates Collaboration Between Worldwide Teams
summary: Jabil, a global technology solutions company with 260,000 employees worldwide, opened a new 175,000-square-foot headquarters in St. Petersburg, Florida, designed to foster collaboration. The facility, equipped with state-of-the-art Crestron technology, allows seamless communication between local and international teams. Clearwater, Fla.-based APG Technology was the audiovisual integrator for the project, ensuring a uniform and user-friendly experience across various collaboration spaces.

title: Oracle women stumble in pay bias suit while Google cuts a deal
authors: Malathi Nayak and Robert Burnson and Bloomberg
summary: Women at Oracle Corp. face a setback in their pay disparity lawsuit as a judge tentatively revoked their class-action status, making it more difficult to proceed. Meanwhile, Google agreed to pay $118 million to settle a similar lawsuit alleging pay disparities for more than 15,000 female workers. The Google settlement includes provisions for independent oversight of hiring practices and pay equity studies.

title: Is the Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF (METV) Right for You?
summary: The Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF (METV) offers investors diversified exposure to companies benefiting from the metaverse's growth. This article examines METV's top holdings, including Meta Platforms, Nvidia, Roblox, Microsoft, and Autodesk, highlighting their roles in the metaverse ecosystem. It also discusses the fund's expense ratio and the potential market size of the metaverse industry.

title: 3 Excellent Dividend-Stock ETFs
summary: This article highlights three excellent dividend-stock ETFs: Vanguard Dividend Appreciation ETF (VIG), Schwab U.S. Dividend Equity ETF (SCHD), and Vanguard International High Dividend Yield Index ETF (VYMI). These ETFs are lauded for their low cost, sensible index construction, and backing by investor-friendly firms, catering to different dividend investment strategies. The author provides details on each ETF's methodology, performance, and the types of companies it invests in.

title: P&G Levels Up Manufacturing With Machine Learning and AI
summary: Procter & Gamble is partnering with Microsoft to implement AI, machine learning, and edge computing across over 100 manufacturing sites globally to improve productivity, reduce costs, and increase consumer satisfaction. This multiyear relationship will leverage Microsoft Azure to digitize and integrate data, enabling real-time, data-informed decisions and innovations in areas such as energy use, downtime reduction, and product quality. The collaboration includes the creation of a Digital Enablement Office to incubate and deploy high-priority business scenarios.

title: Procter & Gamble’s CIO believes passion is contagious. His latest passion: digitally remaking the 185-year-old company
summary: Vittorio Cretella, CIO at Procter & Gamble, is leading a massive digital transformation of the 185-year-old company. P&G has partnered with Microsoft to leverage the Microsoft Cloud, aiming to accelerate its digital manufacturing platform and enrich the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT). This collaboration seeks to improve productivity, speed up product delivery, boost customer satisfaction, and reduce costs, while also enhancing environmental sustainability through optimized energy and water consumption.

title: Oracle closes $28B buy of ‘huge growth engine’ Cerner
summary: Oracle has completed its $28.3 billion acquisition of electronic health record company Cerner, marking its largest acquisition to date and a significant move into the healthcare sector. The deal, an all-cash tender offer of $95 per share, aims to make Cerner an "anchor asset" for Oracle's expansion into healthcare, focusing on improved usability and voice-enabled interfaces for medical software. This acquisition is a substantial digital health deal, following other major acquisitions in the industry, and positions Cerner as a standalone business unit within Oracle.

title: Microsoft announces four new employee workforce initiatives - Microsoft On the Issues
summary: Microsoft is implementing four new workforce initiatives to enhance employee relationships and workplace culture. These changes include removing non-competition clauses for most U.S. employees, strengthening protections against disclosure of alleged misconduct, increasing pay transparency by publicly disclosing salary ranges, and conducting a civil rights audit of its workforce policies. These initiatives aim to empower employees, foster a safe environment for concerns, and reinforce the company's commitment to diversity and inclusion.

title: InfoComm Panel: Enter The Metaverse, What Virtual Worlds Mean For AV
summary: An InfoComm panel discussed the metaverse's impact on audiovisual and design professionals, emphasizing its role as a new channel for marketing, training, entertainment, and work. Panelists urged businesses to strategically incorporate the metaverse, starting small and aligning initiatives with their brand values, while also addressing challenges like ethics and content protection. The discussion highlighted the potential for "digital twins" and immersive collaboration in the workplace, with Gartner predicting widespread adoption.

title: Oracle closes $28B deal to buy EHR giant Cerner
summary: Oracle has finalized its $28.3 billion acquisition of health IT company Cerner, marking its largest acquisition to date and a significant move to expand into the healthcare market. The deal, which involved Oracle finalizing a stock tender offer with 69.2% of Cerner shares, aims to leverage Cerner as an "anchor asset" to scale Oracle's cloud business in hospitals and health systems. This acquisition positions Oracle to transform healthcare delivery through new information systems and addresses the growing trend of big tech companies investing heavily in the healthcare IT sector.

title: Oracle quietly closes $28B deal to buy electronic health records company Cerner
summary: Oracle has officially closed its $28 billion acquisition of electronic health records company Cerner, a deal initially announced just before Christmas last year. This move positions Oracle deeper into the healthcare market, aiming to bring Cerner's extensive workload to the Oracle cloud. Analyst Holger Mueller highlighted the strategic importance of this acquisition for Oracle's presence in a rapidly growing vertical industry.

title: Intel Demonstrates Commitment to Security at RSA Conference 2022
summary: At RSA Conference 2022, Intel reinforced its commitment to security, showcasing innovations and partnerships aimed at addressing complex cyber challenges like hybrid workforces and connected devices. The company highlighted new solutions such as the Intel® NetSec Accelerator Reference Design, the expansion of Project Circuit Breaker, and advancements in hardware-based security with the Intel vPro® platform and confidential computing initiatives like Project Amber. Intel emphasized its holistic approach to security, spanning products, research, and ecosystem collaboration.

title: Gen-trepreneur Z is making its mark on the future of small business
summary: A Microsoft Store report "Small Business State of Mind" highlights how Generation Z is redefining entrepreneurship. Gen Z small business owners prioritize social good, work unconventional hours, and are using platforms like TikTok for business advice, aiming for early retirement rather than traditional corporate paths. The article emphasizes their unique perspective on work, success, and the future of small business, despite challenges like inflation and data security risks.

title: Nvidia TAO Toolkit update aims to simplify deep learning model development
summary: Nvidia has updated its TAO Toolkit platform to simplify and accelerate deep learning model creation for enterprise applications, making AI development more accessible and less time-consuming. The toolkit now includes new capabilities like "bring your own model weights" and integration with TensorBoard for better visualization, along with the option to deploy as-a-service with REST APIs. While other companies have also worked on simplifying AI pipelines, analysts note that Nvidia's TAO Toolkit, with its low-code nature and pre-trained models, aims to speed up time-to-market for AI models and reduce the need for extensive data science expertise.

title: Teresa Carlson returns to Microsoft
summary: Teresa Carlson has rejoined Microsoft as a corporate Vice President and executive-in-residence, nearly 12 years after her previous departure. Carlson, a prominent figure in government cloud computing, left Amazon Web Services where she led their public sector growth, and then had a brief stint as chief growth officer at Splunk before her recent move back to Microsoft. Her return marks a significant development in her career trajectory within the technology industry.

title: What Can a Multi-Factor Screening Methodology Do for Your Core Equity Exposure?
summary: This article discusses how applying a multi-factor screening methodology can improve risk-adjusted returns for large-cap equity portfolios. It highlights factors such as value, quality, and momentum, and introduces the FlexShares US Quality Large Cap Index Fund (QLC) which integrates these factors. The fund aims to provide benefits of these factor exposures while maintaining a similar risk profile to the broader large-cap market.

title: What Can a Multi-Factor Screening Methodology Do for Your Core Equity Exposure?
