summary: PLDT Inc. and Microsoft have formed a strategic partnership through Microsoft's Cyber Threat Intelligence Program (CTIP) to enhance the Philippines' digital security against cyber threats. This collaboration provides PLDT with real-time access to Microsoft DCU's Azure-based cyber threat intelligence, enabling better identification and mitigation of cybercrime. Both companies aim to strengthen cybersecurity capabilities and protect over 70 million mobile and 3.7 million broadband customers in the country.

title: International Funds Stop Fresh Transactions. Is It a Worrying Sign?
summary: Mutual fund investors were surprised when fund houses stopped fresh transactions in schemes offering exposure to offshore equities. This industry-wide decision was prompted by the Indian mutual fund industry reaching its overall investment limit of USD 7 billion in offshore securities, set by the RBI in 2008. While many funds have temporarily suspended inflows into schemes with overseas exposure, certain overseas ETFs may still accept investments as they fall under a separate, unbreached limit.

title: Alphabet eyes $2 trillion value after blowout results
summary: Alphabet Inc. is on the verge of joining Apple and Microsoft in the $2 trillion market valuation club after a strong quarterly report led to an over 8% surge in its shares. The company also announced a 20-to-1 stock split, aiming to make shares more accessible to retail investors. At least 20 brokerages raised their price targets on Alphabet's stock.

title: Alphabet brings big stock splits back to market
authors: Jeran Wittenstein and Vivianne Rodrigues and Bloomberg
summary: Alphabet Inc. announced a 20-for-1 stock split, aiming to make its shares more accessible to small investors by reducing the per-share price. This move is also seen as a step towards potential inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which has historically been a barrier due to Alphabet's high stock price. The announcement led to a 10% jump in shares during premarket trading.

title: LGD and BOE Competing with SDC for Larger Share of iPhone Business
summary: LG Display (LGD) and BOE are increasing their competition with Samsung Display (SDC) for a larger share of Apple's iPhone OLED panel supply. While Samsung has historically dominated, Apple's strategy to minimize dependency has encouraged LGD and BOE to expand capacity and technology, leading to forecasted shifts in panel supplier percentages for future iPhone models. Chinese display manufacturers like BOE, Visionox, and CSOT are also significantly investing in flexible OLED screens, challenging South Korean dominance and aiming to capture a larger portion of the growing foldable smartphone market.

title: Amazon and Microsoft led the world in corporate purchases of clean energy in 2021
summary: Amazon and Microsoft were global leaders in corporate clean energy power purchase agreements in 2021, with Amazon holding the top spot for the second consecutive year. Combined, the two tech giants procured 12.4 GW of wind and solar power, contributing significantly to a record-setting year for corporate carbon-free energy deals. Both companies are committed to achieving 100% renewable energy for their operations by 2025, with Microsoft aiming for 24/7 clean energy by 2030.

title: Morgan Stanley Sees $8 Trillion Metaverse Market — In China Alone
summary: Morgan Stanley predicts an $8 trillion metaverse market in China alone, replacing the mobile internet with a more "immersive experience." The investment bank acknowledges significant technological and regulatory hurdles for mass adoption, estimating an initial total addressable market of $4 trillion before expanding to $8 trillion as it disrupts offline activities.

title: The Great Video Game Consolidation Is Just Beginning
summary: Sony Group Corp. is acquiring Bungie Inc., creator of Halo and Destiny, for $3.6 billion, signaling a growing consolidation in the video game industry. This acquisition follows other major deals, such as Microsoft's planned purchase of Activision Blizzard and Take-Two Interactive's deal for Zynga, suggesting a "feeding frenzy" as tech and entertainment companies seek talent for metaverse projects. The article predicts more such mergers to come.

title: Home Depot launches training program to support construction industry
summary: Home Depot has launched a free job-training program called "Path to Pro" to address the significant labor shortage in the construction industry. The program offers self-paced training focused on basic construction skills, job site safety, and soft skills, aiming to connect qualified candidates with potential employers through its "Path to Pro network." This initiative seeks to rebuild interest in construction careers and fill the labor gap with entry-level workers.

title: Electronic Arts Names Chris Suh as Chief Financial Officer
summary: Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) announced Chris Suh as its new Chief Financial Officer, effective March 1. Suh, previously Corporate Vice President and CFO of Microsoft's Cloud + AI group, will report to Chairman and CEO Andrew Wilson and oversee various financial functions. He replaces Blake Jorgensen, who is stepping down after nearly a decade.

title: Reference design offers wireless docking over Wi-Fi 6E for PCs
summary: Synaptics Incorporated has introduced Gemini, a reference design that offers wireless docking over Wi-Fi 6E for PCs, claiming it's the world's first true Wi-Fi 6/6E wireless docking experience for laptops. This technology enables full dual-4K display capability and ultra-low latency, comparable to wired connections, and integrates hardware and software components like the BCM43752 Wi-Fi 6/6E radio and DL-1950 video interface IC. While initially focused on PC docking, Gemini's applications extend to tablets, gaming, and VR, with analyst Patrick Moorhead highlighting its potential to revolutionize connectivity in hybrid work environments.

title: Gartner Recommends Organizations Confront Three Internal Labor Market Inequities to Retain Talent
summary: Gartner advises organizations to address three internal labor market inequities to improve employee retention amidst the ongoing "Great Resignation." These inequities—unequal awareness, access, and support—hinder employee agility and fair internal hiring processes. By leveraging technology to democratize awareness, opening access to opportunities, and encouraging manager support for mobility, companies can foster a more equitable environment, leading to higher performance and reduced turnover.

title: DISH Sets Data in Motion with Confluent, Unlocking the Power of the First 5G Smart Network™
summary: DISH Network Corporation is partnering with Confluent to leverage cloud-native data streaming with Apache Kafka for real-time analytics on its new smart 5G network. This collaboration, using AWS infrastructure, aims to create a central network nervous system, enabling DISH to deploy a scalable and elastic data architecture that enhances performance, streamlines dynamic behaviors, and provides game-changing real-time intelligence for DISH and its enterprise customers.

title: Is chip giant Nvidia going to scrap its $40BN bid for Arm?
authors: Giles Turner and Peter Elstrom and Bloomberg
summary: Nvidia is reportedly preparing to abandon its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Ltd. due to fierce regulatory backlash and little progress in securing approvals. Regulators and customers, including the U.S. FTC, have expressed concerns that the deal would make Nvidia too powerful. SoftBank, Arm's current owner, is stepping up preparations for an Arm initial public offering as an alternative.

title: Microsoft to Acquire Activision Blizzard for $68.7B, Becoming Third Largest Gaming Company
summary: Microsoft Corporation is set to acquire Activision Blizzard Inc. in a $68.7 billion cash deal, which will make Microsoft the third-largest gaming company globally. This acquisition will add major game franchises like Warcraft and Call of Duty to Microsoft's portfolio and integrate them into its Game Pass service, significantly expanding its presence in mobile, PC, console, and cloud gaming. The deal is expected to close in fiscal year 2023, pending regulatory approval.

title: Ministry of the Presidency and Microsoft sign collaboration agreement to improve protection and defense against cyberthreats
summary: The Ministry of the Presidency of the Dominican Republic and Microsoft Corporation have signed a collaboration agreement to enhance protection and defense against cyberthreats. This agreement makes the Dominican Republic the first Caribbean country and the only active Latin American country to join Microsoft's Government Security Program (GSP). The program provides access to Microsoft technology, security information, and facilitates collaboration between Microsoft and government cybersecurity experts.

title: FedEx and Microsoft announce new cross-platform logistics solution for e-commerce
summary: FedEx and Microsoft are expanding their collaboration to introduce a new cross-platform "logistics as a service" solution for retailers, merchants, and brands. This offering will integrate FedEx network intelligence with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Intelligent Order Management to improve customer engagement, shipping options, and supply chain visibility. The initiative aims to help businesses better fulfill, ship, and service customer orders by leveraging AI and machine learning from the vast data generated by FedEx's daily operations.

title: How to Invest in the Top 100 U.S. ESG Companies
summary: The article discusses the 2022 list of top 100 U.S. ESG companies compiled by Just Capital, highlighting major movements like Alphabet's rise and Meta's fall. It explains the methodology behind the rankings, which prioritize issues important to Americans, and introduces the Goldman Sachs JUST U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (JUST) as a way to invest in companies demonstrating "just business behavior."

title: Microsoft to acquire Activision Blizzard to bring the joy and community of gaming to everyone, across every device
summary: Microsoft announced its plans to acquire Activision Blizzard, a major player in game development, to expand its gaming business across mobile, PC, console, and cloud platforms. This acquisition will make Microsoft the world's third-largest gaming company by revenue and include iconic franchises like “Warcraft,” “Diablo,” “Call of Duty,” and “Candy Crush,” aiming to accelerate the development of metaverse platforms. Satya Nadella emphasized the investment in world-class content, community, and cloud to create a safe, inclusive, and accessible gaming experience for all.

title: Microsoft announces new research and technology to empower millions of frontline workers
summary: Microsoft has released new research and technology, including updates to Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Viva, aimed at empowering millions of frontline workers globally. The company saw 400% growth in monthly active Teams usage by frontline workers since March 2020, and the new features address challenges identified in a Work Trend Index report, such as communication gaps and the need for better training and technology integration. These developments aim to modernize workflows, enhance job performance, and improve workplace culture for the 2 billion frontline workers worldwide.

title: Palo Alto Networks Joins Microsoft 365 Networking Partner Program
summary: Palo Alto Networks announced its integration into the Microsoft 365 Networking Partner Program, aiming to provide secure and efficient connectivity for Microsoft 365 users through its Prisma Access service. This collaboration ensures an optimal user experience aligned with Microsoft's connectivity principles, particularly for hybrid workforces. Prisma Access offers a cloud-delivered security platform that meets Microsoft 365 requirements, enabling Zero Trust access and robust threat protection for enterprise customers.

title: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies: Reimagining the patient journey in a digital era - Source
summary: Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies (JJMDC) and Microsoft have entered a multiyear collaboration to reimagine the patient journey in a digital era. Microsoft will become JJMDC’s preferred cloud provider for its digital surgery solutions, with the goal of using AI, machine learning, and data insights to improve patient outcomes, increase consistency in care, and enhance surgical performance. The partnership aims to connect medical devices, patient records, and hospital information systems through Azure to provide comprehensive patient views and predictive maintenance capabilities.

title: Oracle Corp. stock rises Monday, outperforms market
summary: Oracle Corp. (ORCL) stock increased by 2.02% to $89.28 on Monday, outperforming the broader market downturn where the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average fell. This marks the stock's second consecutive day of gains, although it remains $17.06 short of its 52-week high. Oracle's performance was mixed compared to competitors like Microsoft, Adobe, and Salesforce.com, and trading volume exceeded its 50-day average.

title: JVAL Stock Price | JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF
summary: This article provides detailed information about the JPMorgan U.S. Value Factor ETF (JVAL), including its current stock price, trading exchange (NYSE), and comprehensive financial metrics such as dividend yield, expense ratio, and market capitalization. It also offers technical analysis insights and lists the ETF's top holdings, outlining its investment strategy as a value-focused equity fund targeting the U.S. market.

title: Machine Customers Will Decide Who Gets Their Trillion-Dollar Business. Is It You?
summary: The article explores the rise of "machine customers" and their potential to drive a trillion-dollar business opportunity. It outlines how these nonhuman entities, ranging from bound to autonomous customers, make purchasing decisions differently from humans by being transparent, processing vast amounts of data, and prioritizing efficiency over emotional loyalty. Businesses must adapt their corporate strategy, sales, marketing, and data analytics to cater to this evolving market.

title: What Crypto-related ETFs Could Hit the US Market in 2022?
summary: The article discusses the potential for various crypto-related ETFs, particularly metaverse products, to launch in the US market in 2022, while the approval of spot bitcoin and ether futures products remains uncertain. Industry experts express apprehension about the immediate investability of metaverse ETFs due to potential crossover in holdings and a lack of pure-play names. There's also skepticism regarding the SEC's approval of a spot bitcoin ETF in 2022, with some analysts expecting an ether futures-based ETF to gain approval sooner.

title: Hasbro Promotes Chris Cocks to CEO
summary: Hasbro has named Chris Cocks as its new CEO, succeeding the late Brian Goldner and interim CEO Rich Stoddart. Cocks, previously president and COO of Wizards of the Coast and digital gaming, will focus on evolving Hasbro’s brand blueprint strategy and generating growth. Eric Nyman has been appointed president and COO of Hasbro, while Stoddart will become chair of the board.

title: Legal tech buzzed throughout 2021 with IPOs, new 'unicorns'
summary: The legal technology sector experienced significant growth in 2021 with several companies going public, including LegalZoom.com Inc, CS Disco Inc, and Intapp Inc. Investors also poured capital into private legal tech companies, leading to at least two, Clio and Everlaw Inc, achieving "unicorn" status with valuations exceeding $1 billion. This activity signals a maturation of the legal tech market, driven partly by increased technology adoption due to COVID-19.

title: Social Media Company Quora Is Going Public: Here Are the Details
summary: Quora is considering going public, potentially following other social media companies like Reddit, Rumble, and TMTG. While no IPO date has been set, Reuters reported Quora could go public in 2022 with a valuation of $4 billion, a significant increase from its 2019 private funding. The company generates revenue through advertising and subscription products, aiming to become free-cash-flow-positive on ad revenue alone.

title: Shun Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted S&P 500 indexes due to the massive market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It promotes equal-weight ETFs, such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to this problem, highlighting their comparable performance with superior diversification. The piece draws historical parallels to the tech bubble, emphasizing the benefits of a less concentrated portfolio.

title: Shed Concentration Risk With Equal-Weight ETFs
summary: This article discusses the increasing concentration risk in cap-weighted indexes like the S&P 500, primarily due to the large market capitalization of a few tech giants like Apple and Microsoft. It advocates for equal-weight exchange-traded funds (ETFs), such as the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), as a solution to provide comparable returns with superior diversification. The article highlights how equal-weight ETFs mitigate the risks associated with an over-reliance on a few mega-cap stocks.

title: KKR to Acquire Leading Software Provider Yayoi from ORIX
summary: KKR has announced a definitive agreement to acquire Yayoi Co., Ltd., a leading software provider for small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Japan, from ORIX Corporation. Yayoi is Japan's largest financial and accounting software provider for SMEs, with over 2.5 million registered users and a strong track record of digital transformation support. KKR aims to leverage its global expertise in technology and software businesses to further penetrate the Japanese market and promote Yayoi's growth, with the transaction expected to close by March 1, 2022.

title: Boeing Wants to Build its Next Airplane in the 'Metaverse'
authors: VOA - Voice of America English News
summary: Boeing plans to revolutionize its aircraft manufacturing by uniting design, production, and services under a single digital system, aiming to build its next airplane in the "metaverse" within the next two years. This digital transformation, involving 3-D designs, robots, and mixed reality headsets, seeks to improve quality, safety, and efficiency while reducing design-related issues. The initiative also comes as the company tries to regain trust after the 737 MAX crisis and avoid future manufacturing problems like those encountered with the 787 Dreamliner.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: OpenText Closes Zix Corporation Acquisition
summary: OpenText announced the completion of its acquisition of Zix Corporation for approximately C$860 million. This acquisition aims to expand OpenText's SMB platform for data protection, threat management, email security, and compliance solutions. OpenText expects Zix to be accretive to organic growth and margin dollars within 12-18 months of integration.

title: Moody's gives Apple top 'AAA' credit rating on growth promise
summary: Ratings agency Moody's upgraded Apple Inc.'s long-term credit rating to 'AAA' with a stable outlook, citing its exceptional liquidity and robust earnings. This places Apple in an elite group of companies with the highest rating. While Apple's financial performance was strong in fiscal 2021, the company faces execution risks from short product cycles, shifting consumer preferences, and supply chain management.

title: Oracle Cerner Acquisition Opens the Door for Deeper Inroads into the Healthcare Data Business
summary: Oracle has announced its acquisition of Cerner Corp for $28.3 billion, marking its largest deal to date and signifying a major push into the healthcare data business. This strategic move aims to solidify Oracle's presence in the cloud and healthcare sectors, leveraging Cerner's electronic medical records expertise and addressing the rising demand for cloud-based healthcare solutions. The acquisition is viewed as a power move that allows Oracle to compete more effectively with other tech giants in the cloud arena while enabling Cerner to continue its transformation and growth.

title: Apple’s long-term credit rating upgraded to AAA by Moody’s
authors: Jack Pitcher and Mark Gurman and Bloomberg
summary: Moody’s Investors Service upgraded Apple Inc.’s long-term credit rating to Aaa, placing it in an exclusive group with Microsoft and Johnson & Johnson as the only U.S. S&P 500 corporations with the highest possible credit score. This upgrade reflects Apple's exceptional liquidity, robust earnings, and strong business profile, as the company continues to focus on a net cash-neutral position and expand into new markets like augmented reality and cars. Despite potential chip-related supply shortages impacting revenue, investors remain optimistic about Apple's long-term prospects.

title: AT&T to sell Xandr ad unit to Microsoft
summary: AT&T announced it is selling its advertising unit, Xandr, to Microsoft, partly exiting a venture that had proven expensive for the telecom company. This sale aligns with AT&T's efforts to reduce debt amidst its broader strategy shifts, including the pending WarnerMedia-Discovery Inc deal. For Microsoft, the acquisition aims to accelerate its digital advertising and retail media solutions.

title: AT&T Sells Xandr Ad Business to Microsoft for $1 Billion
summary: AT&T Inc. has agreed to sell its Xandr digital advertising division to Microsoft Corp. for approximately $1 billion. This sale marks AT&T's retreat from the digital ad market, as it deemed Xandr non-core to its operations after seeking a buyer for over a year. The acquisition will allow customers on Microsoft's properties, like MSN, to access Xandr's automated online advertising marketplace.

title: Oracle to buy Cerner for $28.3 bln in healthcare sector push
summary: Oracle announced its acquisition of Cerner for $28.3 billion, marking its largest deal ever and a significant push into the healthcare sector. This acquisition gives Oracle access to a vast amount of healthcare data, which it plans to leverage for its AI-based cloud services and to migrate Cerner's software to its own cloud platform. The deal is expected to close in 2022 and contribute to Oracle's revenue growth and earnings.

title: Oracle to acquire Cerner in $28.3B deal
summary: Oracle announced its acquisition of medical record technology provider Cerner in an all-cash deal valued at $28.3 billion, or $95 per share. This strategic move aims to expand Oracle's presence in the healthcare sector and boost its cloud business globally, with the transaction expected to close in 2022. Oracle CEO Safra Catz anticipates the deal will be a significant revenue growth engine, while chairman Larry Ellison highlighted the potential to reduce administrative burdens for medical professionals and improve patient care.

title: 5 things to know about Oracle after $28.3 billion acquisition of Kansas City’s Cerner
summary: Oracle has announced a $28.3 billion acquisition of Cerner Corp., Kansas City's largest private employer, marking one of the year's biggest deals. This move signifies Oracle's growing push into the healthcare industry, following similar expansions by other tech giants. The acquisition brings together Oracle, an $280 billion company with 133,000 employees globally, and Cerner, valued at $23 billion with 28,000 employees worldwide, notably 13,000 in Kansas City.

title: Oracle snags Cerner in $28B mega deal to make a big move into healthcare
summary: Oracle announced its acquisition of electronic healthcare records company Cerner for approximately $28.3 billion, a move designed to significantly bolster Oracle's presence in the healthcare vertical and expand its cloud infrastructure business. This acquisition represents Oracle's largest to date and aligns with its strategy for substantial revenue growth by penetrating a fast-growing industry. The deal faces potential regulatory scrutiny, similar to Microsoft's recent healthcare acquisition, but Cerner's CEO sees it as an opportunity to accelerate EHR modernization and improve patient care.

title: Amazon silenced criticism of Xi to do business in China: Report
summary: A Reuters report alleges that Amazon.com Inc. quieted criticism of President Xi Jinping's book on its Chinese platform to maintain business in China. This involved scrubbing negative ratings and reviews for "The Governance of China" following requests from Beijing. This situation mirrors cases of other US companies like Apple and contrasts with others like Yahoo! and LinkedIn that have exited the Chinese market due to a challenging business environment.

title: At Waters, a digital workplace strategy pays off amid crisis
summary: Waters Corp. CIO Brook Colangelo's decision to migrate the company to cloud-based productivity and collaboration software before the coronavirus pandemic proved prescient, enabling its 7,000 employees to stay connected and secure while working from home. This digital workplace strategy, supported by a modified Spotify "squad" model, improved the employee experience and allowed the company to handle an increased volume of online engagements and Microsoft Teams usage during the crisis. Colangelo emphasizes thinking like a platform leader, adopting a growth mindset, and obsessing over user adoption for a successful digital workplace.

title: Cerner could be acquired by Oracle, says WSJ
summary: Oracle is reportedly in talks to acquire health IT giant Cerner Corp. for an estimated $30 billion, which would be Oracle's largest acquisition to date. This move would significantly bolster Oracle's presence in healthcare technology, particularly in cloud computing and AI, following a trend of major tech companies investing heavily in healthcare-focused firms. The potential acquisition comes amidst a challenging year for Cerner, despite its CEO expressing optimism about long-term growth.

title: Focus: Boeing wants to build its next airplane in the 'metaverse'
authors: Eric M. Johnson and Tim Hepher
summary: Boeing is launching an ambitious strategy to integrate a digital ecosystem for designing, producing, and servicing its aircraft, utilizing technologies like immersive 3-D engineering and HoloLens headsets. This "metaverse" approach aims to improve quality, safety, and efficiency, preventing issues like those encountered with the 737 MAX and 787 Dreamliner. While facing challenges and skepticism due to past technological hurdles and R&D cuts, Boeing believes this digital transformation is crucial for its future aircraft programs and competitive edge against rivals like Airbus.

title: Where Are the Best Places for Women to Work? Mainly in Tech
summary: A new survey by Comparably reveals that six of the top ten best companies for women to work at in the U.S. are in the technology sector. IBM Corp. was ranked as the top large company for women, with Adobe Inc., HubSpot, Inc., Medallia Inc., Microsoft Corp., and The Knot Worldwide Inc. also making the list from the tech industry. The rankings are based on ratings provided by female users between November 2020 and November 2021.

title: Desktop computers and All-in-One PCs
summary: HP offers a wide range of desktop computers and All-in-One PCs designed for various uses, including work, entertainment, gaming, and creative tasks. The article highlights new AI PC models like the HP OmniDesk and OmniStudio X, alongside established lines such as HP Pavilion, Envy, OMEN, and VICTUS, detailing their specifications and intended applications. Customers can filter choices by use case, series, operating system, product type, and screen size to find the perfect device.

title: Vertical Aerospace Lists on NYSE Following Merger with Broadstone Acquisition Corp.
summary: Vertical Aerospace announced the closing of its business combination with Broadstone Acquisition Corp. and its listing on the NYSE under the ticker EVTL. The company aims to pioneer zero-carbon aviation with its VX4 electric aircraft, backed by significant funding and pre-orders from major airlines, targeting certification by 2024. This milestone marks a significant step towards commercial operations in the mid-2020s, with strong support from key partners and investors.

title: The Invesco QQQ Stock Price Is Up 23.7% Since January. Could There Be More Gains?
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ) has seen its stock price rise 23.7% since January, driven by major tech companies like Apple and Google, despite recent pullbacks. Investors are closely watching the Federal Reserve's monetary policy meeting for potential hawkish policies that could further impact the Nasdaq index and the QQQ ETF. While the ETF is currently in a downtrend, its present stock price may be attractive for a future rally, though a clear upward trend based on EMA crossings is yet to materialize.

title: What Zoom’s $85m class action lawsuit means for data privacy
summary: Zoom has agreed to pay an $85 million settlement in a class action lawsuit alleging it shared user data without consent and falsely claimed end-to-end encryption. This case highlights a broader data privacy movement forcing companies to increase transparency and adjust to stricter regulations. Experts believe the lawsuit serves as a cautionary tale for the digital ecosystem and will prompt other companies to re-evaluate their data protection policies.

title: TeraWulf Is Attracting A-List Investors For Its Sustainable Bitcoin Solution
summary: TeraWulf, a company focused on environmentally-friendly Bitcoin mining, is attracting A-list investors due to its sustainable approach. Notable investors like Gwyneth Paltrow, Mindy Kaling, and Sara Foster have joined, supporting TeraWulf's goal of achieving 100% zero-carbon emissions in its operations by leveraging nuclear, hydro, and solar power. The company aims to address environmental concerns associated with cryptocurrency mining and is preparing for a public debut to expand its substantial mining capacity.

title: Perion Network Announces Closing of $180.0 Million Follow-on Offering of Ordinary Shares, Including Full Exercise of Underwriters’ Option to Purchase Additional Shares
summary: Perion Network Ltd. announced the closing of its $180.0 million follow-on public offering, which included the full exercise of the underwriters’ option to purchase additional shares. A total of 8,372,092 ordinary shares were sold at $21.50 per share, generating aggregate gross proceeds of $180.0 million to the Company. Perion intends to use the net proceeds for working capital, business growth including potential mergers or acquisitions, and general corporate purposes.

title: Healthcare Triangle (HCTI) Acquires DevCool, an Electronic
summary: Healthcare Triangle (HCTI) announced the acquisition of DevCool, an EHR-focused healthcare IT and managed services company, a move expected to add approximately $20 million in revenues. This acquisition aims to strengthen HCTI's leadership in healthcare IT by improving patient care, reducing IT costs, and accelerating EHR deployments, especially for cloud hosting. The combined entity plans to leverage cloud technologies to enhance clinical, operational, and financial performance for healthcare providers and integrate DevCool’s client base with HCTI’s SaaS platforms.

title: Why Oracle’s stock is surging to an all-time high
summary: Oracle's stock surged nearly 16% to an all-time high after strong earnings and guidance, driven by its license business and improved cloud performance. The company's strategy of deeply integrating hardware and software and investing in next-gen cloud has been key to its success, particularly in its Fusion ERP business. While skeptics question the true cloud momentum due to reporting methods, market watchers note Oracle's strong performance compared to competitors like SAP and IBM.

title: 4 Charts on Apple's $3 Trillion Market Cap
summary: Apple Inc. has become the first company to achieve a $3 trillion market capitalization, briefly hitting $182.88 per share. This article highlights the immense scale of Apple's market cap through various comparisons, such as its value exceeding the total market cap of all public companies in Canada. It also discusses Apple's dominance within the U.S. market, making up nearly 22% of all U.S.-domiciled technology companies' total market capitalization.

title: How ConocoPhillips is opening an innovation treasure trove
summary: ConocoPhillips is fostering a culture of innovation, led by Director Liz Jolley, to drive success and adapt to a changing industry. The company utilizes its "Fuel" software platform to facilitate global collaboration, allowing employees to share ideas and adopt proven solutions. This approach has led to significant improvements in operations, cost reduction, and problem-solving across various business units worldwide.

title: Pure Storage Takes On Tier 1 Storage With FlashArray//XL
summary: Pure Storage has launched its new FlashArray//XL family, comprising the XL130 and XL170 models, to target the high-end, mission-critical storage market previously dominated by companies like Dell EMC. These new systems are designed to provide cloud-like scalability and flexibility in on-premises datacenters, offering significant improvements in IOPS, effective capacity, and density compared to previous FlashArray//X systems. This move aims to fill a gap in Pure Storage's portfolio and challenge competitors for the most demanding enterprise workloads like SAP HANA and Oracle databases.

title: NetApp appoints chief product officer who doesn’t look after all products
summary: NetApp has appointed Harvinder (Harv) Bhela as its first chief product officer, who will oversee most, but not all, of NetApp's products. Anthony Lye will continue to lead the Cloud Management and Platform Services Business Unit, specifically focusing on CloudOps, while Bhela will handle cloud storage, data services, and hybrid cloud businesses. This dual leadership aims to accelerate the company's pivot to cloud while maintaining leadership in flash and object storage.

title: Zscaler Extends its Proven Zero Trust Exchange Platform to Deliver Zero Trust for Workloads
summary: Zscaler announced the general availability of its new Workload Communications solution, extending Zero Trust security to workloads and applications in public clouds. This solution aims to simplify multi-cloud workload connectivity, eliminate attack surfaces, and enhance application performance by moving away from traditional VPNs and firewalls. It provides Zero Trust for cloud workloads across cloud-to-internet, cloud-to-cloud, cloud-to-data center, and intra-cloud communications.

title: New Aruba EdgeConnect Microbranch Solution Modernizes the Home/Small Office Experience for Hybrid Workplaces
summary: Aruba, a Hewlett Packard Enterprise company, has introduced its new EdgeConnect Microbranch solution, designed to modernize the home and small office experience for hybrid workplaces. This solution provides remote workers with complete in-office connectivity and security services through a single Wi-Fi access point, without requiring additional hardware or agents. It extends SD-WAN and SASE security frameworks to remote locations, ensuring consistent employee experience and bolstering corporate protections.

title: CVS enters digital health partnership with Microsoft
summary: CVS Health is partnering with Microsoft to create innovative digital health solutions and enhance its customer experience. This collaboration will leverage Microsoft Azure for advanced machine learning, automate processes, and utilize tools like Microsoft HoloLens to support customers, employees, and partners. CVS Health aims to become a consumer-centric, integrated health solutions company through a digital-first approach.

title: The metaverse needs aggressive regulation
summary: The author, a pioneer in AR/VR technology, argues for aggressive regulation of the metaverse to prevent large corporations from extensive monitoring and manipulation of users. He emphasizes the need to restrict data collection, regulate real-time marketing tactics, and ensure transparency regarding AI-controlled agents and targeted placements. The article warns that without regulation, the metaverse risks becoming an environment where powerful entities exploit user data and emotions for commercial gain.

title: Moody’s upgrades VPBank’s rating to Ba3
summary: Moody's Investors Service has upgraded Việt Nam Prosperity Bank (VPBank)'s foreign currency deposits from B1 to Ba3, matching the country's rating with a positive outlook. This upgrade follows VPBank's sale of a 49% stake in FE Credit, which improved its capital adequacy ratio and overall financial profile. Moody's also highlighted VPBank's strong business results despite the pandemic and expects continued stability in asset quality and profitability.

title: Nasdaq dives over 2% as tech stocks slide at end of volatile week
summary: Wall Street's major indexes, particularly the Nasdaq, experienced a significant decline as tech stocks slid at the end of a volatile week. This downturn was influenced by mixed jobs data, uncertainty surrounding the Omicron coronavirus variant, and the Federal Reserve's policy tightening signals. Major tech companies such as Apple, Meta Platforms, Alphabet, Amazon, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla all saw their shares fall, contributing to the broader market dip.

title: Market Expert: Fall For Quality, Not Just Tech
summary: A market expert suggests investors prioritize high-quality stocks over solely focusing on big tech names. Mark Mahaney of Evercore ISI advocates for investing in "dislocated high-quality" companies with large total addressable markets and strong innovation, rather than just trading tech stocks. The article highlights the FlexShares US Quality Low Volatility Index Fund (QLV) as an example of an ETF that focuses on quality while managing volatility.

title: Deloitte buys Oracle Cloud specialist BIAS Corporation
summary: Deloitte US has acquired BIAS Corporation, an IT consultancy specializing in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), to enhance its cloud migration capabilities. BIAS, founded in 2000, has over 350 employees and was recognized as an Oracle Global and North American Partner of the Year. This acquisition addresses the increasing demand for cloud services and follows Deloitte's fiscal year 2021 revenue growth to over $50 billion.

title: Market Expert: Fall For Quality, Not Just Tech
summary: An article discussing the importance of balancing tech investments with high-quality stocks. It highlights Mark Mahaney's "dislocated high-quality" (DHQ) investment tenet and introduces the FlexShares US Quality Low Volatility Index Fund (QLV) as a suitable option for investors seeking quality and reduced volatility.

title: U.S. FTC sues to block Nvidia deal to buy Arm
summary: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has sued to block Nvidia Corp's more than $80 billion acquisition of British chip technology provider Arm, citing concerns that the deal would give Nvidia undue control over crucial computing technology and designs. This move complicates an already challenging regulatory path for the acquisition, which has faced opposition from the chip industry and scrutiny from British and European Union regulators. The FTC argues the merger would harm competition, reduce innovation, and lead to higher prices by giving Nvidia the ability and incentive to undermine competitors who rely on Arm's technology.

title: Adopt a data-centric approach to cyber security
summary: This article emphasizes the need for organizations to shift from traditional perimeter-based security to a data-centric approach for cybersecurity. It highlights the importance of discovering and classifying data, implementing a layered security framework, and balancing security with usability. The article also discusses the advantages of cloud-native architectures and emerging AI-based tools for enhancing data protection against evolving cyber threats.

title: Microsoft and CVS Health Partner to Accelerate Personalized Care Experience
summary: CVS Health and Microsoft have announced a new strategic alliance to revolutionize personalized care and accelerate digital transformation. This collaboration aims to leverage data and advanced technologies like Azure and Machine Learning to enhance customer experience, empower over 300,000 CVS Health employees, and improve care access and health outcomes for more than 100 million people. Key initiatives include enabling frontline workers, digitalizing operations, expanding cloud services, and exploring innovative solutions using Microsoft HoloLens and Azure AI.

title: CVS Health and Microsoft announce new strategic alliance to reimagine personalized care and accelerate digital transformation
summary: CVS Health and Microsoft Corp. announced a new strategic alliance to develop innovative solutions for personalized health care and accelerate digital transformation. This collaboration aims to enhance customer experience, empower over 300,000 CVS Health employees with better tools, and improve operational efficiency across the company, utilizing Microsoft's Azure cloud and AI capabilities. The partnership will focus on data-driven customer experiences, enabling frontline workers, digitalizing operations, and expanding cloud services for CVS Health.

title: What Stocks Are in QQQ? Rebound Likely, Good Long-Term Pick
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust Series 1 ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq 100, is a tech-heavy fund that experienced a nosedive following the omicron variant news and inflation concerns in December 2021. Despite this slump, the article suggests that QQQ is likely to recover due to its diverse holdings and past performance, making it a potentially smart long-term investment. The article details the top 20 holdings and the industry breakdown of the ETF.

title: CVS Health, Microsoft Partner To Bring ‘Digital First’ Care To Customers
summary: CVS Health and Microsoft Corp. announced a five-year partnership to personalize care for CVS's over 100 million customers, utilizing Microsoft's technology and cloud services. The collaboration aims to accelerate CVS's digital transformation, deliver customized health recommendations, improve medication adherence, and enhance operational efficiency for front-line workers. Financial terms were not disclosed, but the initiative focuses on leveraging data and technology to improve customer experience and care delivery.

title: Top 6 ETFs for Growth in 2021
summary: This article identifies six top Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs) for investors seeking growth in 2021. It details each ETF's investment strategy, top holdings, and expense ratios, highlighting their potential for long-term growth by focusing on companies with high growth potential or employing active management strategies. The selection includes ETFs targeting small-cap growth, long/short equity, semiconductors, momentum, large-cap, and technology sectors.

title: The FAANG Market Is Fading
summary: The article discusses the fading hyper-concentration of stock market returns from a handful of large technology stocks, particularly the FAANGs, in 2021 compared to 2020. This shift suggests a healthier market dynamic with less risk for index funds and more opportunities for stock-pickers. While large stocks still contribute significantly, their overall impact on market returns has decreased, resembling a more traditional market distribution.

title: How a Stanford couple created Taiwan’s best-known AI start-up
summary: This article details how a Stanford couple, Chih-Han Yu and Winnie Lee, founded Appier, Taiwan's first AI unicorn. After eight failed attempts and nearly two decades, their company, which develops AI-based precision marketing solutions, went public on the Tokyo Stock Exchange in March, becoming a success story for both Taiwan's tech scene and Japan's IPO market.

title: Bret Taylor appointed co-CEO of Salesforce as shares drop on lower-than-expected forcecast
summary: Bret Taylor has been appointed co-chief executive officer of Salesforce Inc. The announcement came the same day Salesforce's shares dropped in after-hours trading due to a lower-than-expected earnings forecast. Despite better-than-expected Q3 results of $1.27 a share profit and $6.86 billion in revenue, investors reacted negatively to Q4 guidance that projected lower profits than analysts anticipated.

title: Meet the top 7 Indian Americans CEOs in corporate America
summary: This article highlights seven prominent Indian American CEOs leading major US corporations, whose combined revenue in 2020 exceeded $530 billion. It details the careers and achievements of individuals like Sundar Pichai (Alphabet/Google), Satya Nadella (Microsoft), and Parag Agrawal (Twitter), showcasing their rise in corporate America. The piece also provides context on the historical progression of Indian Americans into top executive roles since the 1990s.

title: Microsoft is Equipping People with Low-Code AI
summary: Microsoft is empowering "citizen developers" with low-code AI solutions, exemplified by its Azure AI Platform and Project Bonsai. These tools enable businesses to integrate advanced AI capabilities without extensive data science expertise, as demonstrated by PepsiCo's successful implementation of Project Bonsai to improve Cheetos production consistency. The initiative aims to make AI more accessible and practical for everyday business applications.

title: Observing Attacks Against Hundreds of Exposed Services in Public Clouds
summary: Unit 42 researchers deployed a global honeypot infrastructure of 320 nodes to study attacks against exposed services in public clouds. They found that 80% of honeypots were compromised within 24 hours and all within a week, highlighting the rapid pace at which attackers exploit misconfigured services. The research emphasizes the ineffectiveness of IP-based firewalls and the critical need for quick vulnerability remediation in cloud environments.

title: Ballard, Caterpillar And Microsoft To Produce Back-up Power For Data Centres
summary: Ballard Power Systems, Caterpillar Inc., and Microsoft have launched a three-year collaboration to demonstrate a 1.5 MW hydrogen fuel cell power system for data center backup. This project, supported by the U.S. Department of Energy and the National Renewable Energy Lab, aims to provide reliable, sustainable backup power with significantly reduced emissions. The demonstration will take place at a Microsoft data center in Quincy, Washington.

title: Ballard teams up with Caterpillar & Microsoft to demonstrate megawatt-scale hydrogen fuel cell backup generator system for datacenters
summary: Ballard Power Systems, in collaboration with Caterpillar Inc. and Microsoft, has launched a three-year project to demonstrate a megawatt-scale hydrogen fuel cell backup generator system for data centers. This initiative, supported by the U.S. Department of Energy, aims to develop a 1.5 MW backup power system with significantly reduced emissions compared to current diesel systems. The project will provide insights into scaling fuel cell technology for multi-megawatt data centers, leveraging low-carbon-intensity hydrogen.

title: Why Sabre is betting against multi-cloud
summary: Sabre, a travel technology company, has entered a 10-year, $2 billion partnership with Google Cloud, committing to a single cloud provider despite the prevailing multi-cloud trend among large enterprises. CIO Joe DiFonzo explains that an initial multi-cloud exploration led them to realize the inefficiencies of managing disparate architectures and the benefits of leveraging a single vendor's full capabilities and engineering mindset. This decision allows Sabre to focus on modernizing operations, decomposing applications into microservices, and integrating AI-powered services by leaning on Google's extensive technological advancements.

title: How Constellation Brands built a better ordering system on AWS
Health tech: The 15 next big things, from easier dialysis to AI ultrasounds
summary: Fast Company's first Next Big Things in Tech awards highlight 15 health tech innovations, ranging from easier dialysis solutions to AI-powered ultrasounds. These advancements address a spectrum of medical challenges, including blood pressure monitoring via smartphones, mapping plant chemical diversity for medicine, and using AI to predict patient outcomes and improve cardiac care. The article features winners such as Biospectal, Brightseed, Caption Health, ClosedLoop AI, Microsoft and Adaptive Biotechnologies, and Outset Medical.

title: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud secures cloud assets for Microsoft customers
summary: Saviynt has released its 2021 Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud (EIC), enhancing security and compliance for Microsoft customers with privileged identity and session management via a new Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) PIM integration. This release aims to minimize access sprawl, reduce privilege risks, and simplify identity and access technologies by building on Azure AD and offering features like end-to-end PIM, Microsoft Teams integration for access approvals, and improved Active Directory support. Saviynt EIC 2021 is designed to eliminate the need for multiple identity management products and streamline identity governance.

title: Texas Instruments selects Sherman for potential $30 billion semiconductor chipmaking campus
summary: Texas Instruments announced plans to invest up to $30 billion to build as many as four new semiconductor fabrication plants in Sherman, Texas. The company plans to begin construction next year on the first two plants, with chip production estimated to start by 2025. This significant investment aims to strengthen TI's manufacturing capabilities and address the growing demand for semiconductors.

title: Qualcomm, diversifying from mobile phones, to supply chips for BMW self-driving cars
summary: Qualcomm announced that it will supply chips for BMW's next generation of driver-assistance and self-driving systems, marking a significant diversification beyond its core mobile phone chip business. This move underscores Qualcomm's strategic expansion into the automotive sector, aiming to challenge competitors like Nvidia and Intel in the self-driving technology market. The new chips will be used in BMW's "Neue Klasse" series of cars, with production slated to begin in 2025.

title: IonQ Announces Third Quarter 2021 Financial Results
summary: IonQ announced its third-quarter 2021 financial results, highlighting total contract value (TCV) bookings of $15.1 million year-to-date and updated its 2021 TCV bookings guidance to $15.8 million at the midpoint. The company also reported significant technological milestones, including industry-first error correction demonstration and superior quantum computer performance, alongside strategic collaborations and a strong financial position after its business combination. Financial highlights included $223 thousand in revenue for the quarter, $587 million in cash and cash equivalents, and a net loss of $14.8 million.

title: Data storytelling company Narrative Science will join Tableau via Salesforce acquisition
summary: Narrative Science, a Chicago-based data storytelling company known for its Lexio software, will be acquired by Salesforce and integrated into Tableau Software. This move aims to expand Tableau's offerings through language-centric mediums like Slack and help more people understand and act on data. Narrative Science, founded in 2010, has raised $43 million in funding and has employees in Seattle, Chicago, and New York.

title: Human Capital Management Market Size to Reach USD 32.84 Billion in 2028 | Rising Usage of Cloud Services and Increasing Government Initiatives to Bolster Digitization are Key Factors Driving HCM Market Revenue Growth
summary: The Human Capital Management (HCM) market is projected to reach USD 32.84 billion by 2028, growing from USD 18.04 billion in 2020 at a CAGR of 7.9%. This growth is primarily driven by the increasing adoption of cloud services, advanced HR technologies, and government initiatives promoting digitization. Despite data security concerns, the integration of AI and ML into HCM solutions is further boosting market expansion, particularly in the Asia Pacific region.

title: Former Federal CIO Tony Scott Named President, CEO of Cyber Firm Intrusion
summary: Tony Scott, former federal chief information officer during the Obama administration, has been appointed president and CEO of cybersecurity company Intrusion, effective Monday. Scott previously led The TonyScottGroup, a consulting firm he established in 2017 to manage cybersecurity posture for clients. His career also includes CIO roles at VMware and Microsoft, and CTO at General Motors, as well as overseeing the government's $85 billion annual IT budget as federal CIO.

title: Accelerating the transition
summary: This article summarizes a fireside chat with Satya Nadella (CEO, Microsoft) and Lorenzo Simonelli (Chairman and CEO, Baker Hughes) at the Annual Meeting 2021. Nadella discusses the digital transformation of industries, the excitement around new technology frontiers like elastic computing and distributed computing, and Microsoft's sustainability commitments. He also shares his views on the future of work, emphasizing hybrid models and employee well-being post-pandemic.

title: Microsoft’s shift to the cloud is a lesson in corporate evolution
summary: This article details Microsoft's successful transition to cloud computing, highlighting the internal and external challenges faced and overcome. It examines how the company, under both Steve Ballmer and later Satya Nadella, navigated customer skepticism and internal resistance to redefine its business model. The narrative emphasizes the importance of anticipating market shifts and making bold strategic decisions even when ahead of current customer demand.

title: 5 Charts on General Electric's Fall From Grace
summary: This article details General Electric's significant decline in value over the past two decades, from once being the most valuable company globally to its current 75th position in the U.S. stock market. It attributes GE's fall to a deterioration of culture, poor capital allocation decisions, and an over-reliance on its financial unit. The article discusses GE's recent decision to split into three companies (aviation, healthcare, and energy), a move applauded by analysts and seen as a potential catalyst for closing the persistent price/value gap for the stock.

title: Google-owner Alphabet breaches $2 trillion market cap, joins Apple and Microsoft
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market capitalization for the first time, driven by increased digital ad spending and growth in its cloud business. This achievement places Alphabet alongside Apple and Microsoft in the exclusive $2 trillion club. The company reported a record third quarter in 2021 with $65.1 billion in earnings.

title: Microsoft Teams device news, November 2021
summary: This article provides an update on the latest Microsoft Teams device news as of November 2021, covering new features for Teams Rooms and Panels, device management improvements, and SIP Gateway general availability. It also highlights various partnerships and product releases from companies like Bose, Crestron, EPOS, HP, Jabra, Logitech, Poly, Sennheiser, and Yealink, showcasing advancements in hardware for hybrid work environments.

title: OpenText to acquire Zix in $860 million deal meant to bolster Microsoft relationship
summary: OpenText has announced an agreement to acquire Texas-based Zix for $860 million USD, including debt. This acquisition aims to create a "powerhouse SMB platform" for data protection, threat management, and compliance solutions by integrating Zix's offerings with OpenText's previous acquisitions, Carbonite and Webroot, and to deepen its relationship with Microsoft. The deal is expected to expand OpenText's cloud revenues, adjusted EBITDA, and cash flows.

title: Google’s parent Alphabet breaches $2 trillion in market value
authors: Katrina Lewis and Nico Grant and Bloomberg
summary: Google's parent company, Alphabet Inc., reached a $2 trillion market valuation for the first time, driven by strong growth in digital advertising and its cloud business. This puts Alphabet in an exclusive club with Apple Inc. and Microsoft Corp., with analysts remaining optimistic about its future growth due to a cheaper valuation and increasing cloud adoption.

title: CMO of the Week: Campbell Soup Company’s Linda Lee
summary: Linda Lee, CMO of Meals and Beverages at Campbell Soup Company, discusses the company's recent initiatives, including the first redesign of its iconic soup can in over 50 years and partnerships with artists and music labels. She also details how Campbell's adapted its marketing strategy and media mix during the pandemic, focusing on digital engagement, entertainment, and diversity & inclusion efforts.

title: AMD shares close up 10% after company wins Meta partnership, announces new chips
summary: AMD shares surged 10% after the company announced a partnership with Meta (formerly Facebook) as a chip customer and unveiled a new range of chips at its Accelerated Data Center Premiere event. This move strengthens AMD's position against competitors like Intel, as the company continues to gain market share with its data center chip sales experiencing significant growth. Additional details about the Meta partnership are expected to be revealed later in the week at the Open Compute Project summit.

title: EXPLAINED: What is Metaverse and Why Facebook/ Meta Thinks it's the Future of Internet
summary: This article explains the concept of the metaverse, why Facebook (now Meta) views it as the future of the internet, and what its potential applications are. It details how the metaverse would work, from virtual interactions and business opportunities to the technologies being developed to build it, while also touching on data privacy concerns.

title: ‘Business needs a noble purpose and a human-centric approach — these core principles revived Best Buy’
summary: Hubert Joly, former CEO of Best Buy, discusses how a human-centric approach and noble purpose revived the company, leading its share price to rise 11-fold. He emphasizes that putting people at the center and embracing all stakeholders is crucial for businesses today, especially in navigating challenges like the pandemic and climate change. Joly argues that the "Milton Friedman doctrine" of profit-first is outdated and highlights companies like Microsoft, Ralph Lauren, and Unilever as examples of successful human-centric models.

title: Google invests $1bn into Chicago Mercantile Exchange as part of cloud migration deal
summary: Google Cloud has signed a 10-year deal with CME Group to migrate all of CME's infrastructure and markets to the cloud starting in early 2022. As part of this agreement, Google has also made a $1 billion equity investment in CME Group. The partnership aims to enhance CME's services, introduce new products, and accelerate technological innovation in capital markets while strengthening Google Cloud's position in the financial services sector.

title: Micron Technology to invest more than US$150 bln globally in manufacturing and R&D until 2030
summary: Micron Technology announced plans to invest over US$150 billion globally by 2030 in leading-edge memory manufacturing and R&D, including potential US fab expansion. This investment aims to meet the increasing demand for memory, essential for computing driven by technologies like 5G and AI. The company, which already has extensive global operations, is optimistic about its growth in Malaysia and expects strong revenue and profit margins in 2022.

title: Arista Gains Big on Cloud Boom
summary: Arista Networks experienced significant stock gains following strong earnings and boosted guidance, driven by increased capital spending from hyperscalers like Meta and Microsoft. The company also continues to gain market share from competitors like Cisco in both data center, cloud, and campus networking segments, indicating a robust cloud boom across the industry. Other infrastructure vendors like NVIDIA, Amazon Web Services, and Broadcom are also seeing growth.

title: Israeli firm Beamr awarded Emmy for video compression tech
summary: The Israeli company Beamr received an Emmy in the Technology & Engineering category from the National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences for its patented video compression technology. This technology reduces video file sizes while maintaining high quality, benefiting streaming services and broadcasters. Beamr's solution uses a quality measure called BQM to adjust bitrate automatically, saving bandwidth and improving efficiency for major clients like Netflix and Microsoft.

title: Investing in Mark Zuckerberg’s vision of the Metaverse with an ETF
summary: This article discusses investing in Mark Zuckerberg's vision of the Metaverse following Facebook's rebranding to Meta. It explains what the Metaverse is, how investors can gain exposure through companies involved in its creation like Roblox and Unity Software, and highlights the Roundhill Ball Metaverse ETF (NYSE:META) which tracks a basket of such stocks. The article also provides information on thematic ETFs and the fund manager, Roundhill Investments.

title: Monthly Market Wrap - October 2021
summary: The October 2021 market wrap highlights a month of economic observations including rising inflation, the Federal Reserve's anticipated tapering, and varied performance across domestic and international equities. It also covers positive trends in alternative investments and the increasing integration of ESG factors into investment strategies. The report details specific market indices and economic indicators, providing a comprehensive overview of the financial landscape during the month.

title: AT&T selects Amdocs to support its Business Support Systems evolution to make life easier and enjoyable for customers
summary: AT&T has chosen Amdocs' CES cloud-native platform to support its Business Support Systems evolution (BSSe) program, aimed at modernizing and simplifying technology. This long-term agreement includes next-generation cloud operations for BSSe, launching on Microsoft Azure and initially focusing on AT&T's consumer business units, including mobility with 5G, fixed wireless, broadband, and IoT. The initiative seeks to increase speed-to-market, improve customer experiences, and achieve long-term cost-effectiveness.

title: Microsoft and AES Partner to Bring Around-the-Clock Renewable Energy to Data Centers
summary: Microsoft and AES have signed a 15-year agreement to provide around-the-clock renewable energy to Microsoft's data centers in Virginia. This partnership supports Microsoft's goal of achieving 100/100/0 by 2030, meaning 100% of its electricity consumption will be matched by 100% zero-carbon sources, 100% of the time, in all grids, every day. AES will supply the energy from a portfolio of wind, solar, and battery energy storage projects.

title: Big data and analytics to reach $684.12 billion by 2030
summary: The global big data and business analytics market is projected to reach $684.12 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 13.5% from 2021. This growth is driven by the vast amounts of data generated by online and offline trading and the increasing adoption of cloud solutions by SMEs. The banking, financial services, and insurance sector is expected to be the most lucrative segment, with emerging trends like social media and text analytics creating new opportunities.

title: André Christ, CEO of LeanIX: Leveraging corporate experience to bootstrap a startup
summary: André Christ, CEO of LeanIX, discusses his journey from working at DHL to founding his own startup. He highlights how his corporate experience helped him identify a market need for IT landscape transparency and validate his business idea. Christ also shares insights into bootstrapping LeanIX for three years and the challenges and successes of acquiring early enterprise customers.

title: Mesh for Microsoft Teams aims to make collaboration in the ‘metaverse’ personal and fun
summary: Microsoft unveiled Mesh for Microsoft Teams, a new feature combining mixed-reality capabilities with productivity tools to make online collaboration more personal and engaging. This initiative addresses the challenges of remote work by allowing users to join meetings as customized avatars and create immersive virtual spaces, serving as a gateway to the metaverse. The feature aims to enhance team effectiveness and individual engagement by bringing the spontaneity and personal connection of in-person interactions to virtual environments.

title: Johnson & Johnson advances global health and avoids supply chain disruptions - Source
summary: Johnson & Johnson leverages its collaboration with Microsoft to implement digital manufacturing transformation, including Azure, AI, and IoT, to enhance its global supply chain efficiency and resilience. By shifting to a pull supply chain and using smart manufacturing, J&J can ensure products are delivered precisely when needed, reduce errors, and mitigate disruptions. The company has seen improved quality output, a reduction in "field actions," and moved from 28th to 3rd globally in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Supply Chain Leaders, driven by its technological advancements.

title: Iron Mountain’s Hollywood Treasures
summary: Iron Mountain Entertainment Services' Hollywood facility safeguards significant assets from theatrical and TV production history, including iconic props and celebrity documents. The company offers secure physical storage in an earthquake-resistant building, along with digital asset management, digitization, and media services, focusing on preserving older formats and leveraging cloud security for remote access. This comprehensive approach ensures the secure storage and accessibility of invaluable media and entertainment archives.

title: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger’s “insane” plan to restore the company’s glory days
summary: Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger is implementing an "insane" and ambitious plan to regain the company's market leadership. This involves massive capital expenditures between $25 billion and $28 billion annually, along with $15 billion in R&D, to improve technology and capacity, especially in foundry business. The strategy aims for performance parity by 2024 and industry leadership by 2025, a bold move given Intel's recent struggles against competitors like Apple and ARM-based chips.

title: Dual Interface Payment Card Market Size Report, 2022-2030
summary: The global dual interface payment card market reached USD 8,026.4 million in 2023 and is projected to grow at a CAGR of 16.7% from 2024 to 2030, driven by advancements in payment card chips, integration of NFC and RFID, and increasing demand for contactless payments. Key factors include consumer preference for fast and secure transactions, the COVID-19 pandemic's impact on contactless adoption, and rising demand in the banking sector for biometric-integrated cards. The market also faces challenges such as security concerns and the cost of hardware upgrades, with plastic and retail segments holding significant shares.

title: Commvault Metallic launches backup security dashboard
summary: Commvault Metallic has launched Metallic Security IQ, a new dashboard designed to provide visibility into potential security vulnerabilities in Metallic backup environments. The tool calculates a security posture score and gamifies security to encourage IT admins to address weaknesses, directly benefiting both end customers and managed service providers (MSPs) in protecting against cyberattacks like ransomware. This initiative reflects a growing trend among backup vendors to integrate security with data protection.

title: US tech company NetApp to open international headquarters in Cork
summary: US-based technology company NetApp is establishing its international headquarters in Cork, Ireland, aiming to create up to 500 jobs by 2025. This expansion is part of NetApp's strategy to grow its business and international presence, capitalizing on Ireland's strong ecosystem for tech companies and skilled graduates. The new office will support its global operations outside the US, aligning with the accelerated digital transformation trends observed during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Trimble and Microsoft Partner to Drive Digital Transformation Across Industries
summary: Trimble and Microsoft have announced a strategic partnership to accelerate digital transformation in the construction, agriculture, and transportation industries. Their initial focus will be on building the "Trimble Construction Cloud" powered by Microsoft Azure, aimed at improving productivity, reducing costs, and increasing collaboration in the fragmented construction sector. This collaboration expands their existing relationship, leveraging Microsoft's cloud technologies with Trimble's industry expertise to deliver innovative solutions and support infrastructure investments in 2022.

title: Goldman Sachs, Harvard team up with Al Gore’s investment firm
authors: Tasneem Brogger and Alastair Marsh and Bloomberg
summary: Al Gore's investment firm, Generation Investment Management LLP, is partnering with Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund, and Harvard Management Co. to launch "Just Climate." This new venture aims to channel capital into companies and projects focused on decarbonizing the economy, with the goal of limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. The initiative highlights a shift from traditional ESG investing, which is seen as insufficient to address the urgent climate crisis, towards more direct "climate-led investing."

title: Microsoft brought 1,500 jobs to Atlanta. A wave of tech investments followed.
summary: Microsoft's expansion in Atlanta, bringing 1,500 jobs with its Atlantic Yards office, has spurred further technology investments in the city. The state views Microsoft's presence as a catalyst for attracting other Fortune 500 tech companies, particularly from the West Coast. This move is seen as a significant development for Atlanta's technology sector.

title: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) Will not be Taken Private, But it Might go to US$420
summary: Microsoft Corporation continues its strong performance, reporting solid earnings and expanding partnerships. A discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis suggests the company might be undervalued, with an estimated intrinsic value higher than its current trading price, driven by growth in all three business segments and an expanded share buyback program. The article details the methodology and key financial metrics supporting the valuation, emphasizing positive catalysts for future growth.

title: Cybersecurity More Important Than Ever as Russia-Linked Hackers Target Tech Companies
summary: Microsoft announced that Russia-linked hackers, responsible for the 2020 SolarWinds hack, have significantly increased their attacks on technology companies this year, targeting 609 companies 22,868 times. These attacks highlight the growing need for enhanced cybersecurity measures and investment. The article also discusses the ProShares Ultra Nasdaq Cybersecurity ETF (UCYB) as an investment vehicle for exposure to the cybersecurity sector.

title: Predictions 2022: This Is A Year To Be Bold
summary: Forrester's 2022 Predictions anticipate a year of bold decisions driven by critical business trends such as heightened expectations for digital experiences and the shift to human-centered technology transformations. The article highlights key predictions including consumers viewing the world as "ALL digital," B2B marketers adopting "always on" strategies but missing ROI goals, and accessibility becoming a major CX priority. It also forecasts that one-third of firms shifting to hybrid work models will fail without adapting their processes.

title: AMD sales rise 54% on strong demand for chips for servers and game consoles
summary: AMD reported strong third-quarter earnings, beating analyst expectations for both revenue and EPS, driven by high demand for its chips in PCs, servers, and game consoles. The company also issued a robust forecast for the fourth quarter, expecting continued growth in server and semi-custom segments amidst ongoing chip shortages. AMD's strategic acquisition of Xilinx is proceeding, aiming to strengthen its position in the data center market.

title: CEO Says Bank of America is a Technology Company
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan stated at Yahoo Finance’s All Markets Summit that he views the bank as a financial technology company due to its extensive digital operations and significant technology investments. The company has seen substantial growth in digital banking users and transactions, incorporating features like Zelle and virtual assistant Erica. Bank of America's commitment to digital innovation has contributed to an 80% stock increase over the past three years.

title: Silicon Valley Battery Veteran Ronnie Tao Joins Amprius Technologies As Vice President Of Business Development
summary: Amprius Technologies, Inc. announced the appointment of Ronnie Tao as Vice President of Business Development. Tao brings extensive experience from companies like Sony Electronics and Amazon, and will focus on expanding Amprius's market reach for its high-energy density lithium-ion batteries. This strategic hire aims to capitalize on increasing commercial opportunities for their Silicon Nanowire anode battery platform.

title: Navitas Semiconductor Goes Public With $1.7B Valuation
summary: Navitas Semiconductor went public on October 20 under the symbol "NVTS" with a market value of roughly $2 billion, having completed a reverse merger with Live Oak Acquisition Corp. II. The company, which develops gallium nitride semiconductors, expects $27 million in revenue for 2021 and anticipates its revenue to more than double next year with an influx of $320 million from going public, allowing expansion into data centers, solar, and electric vehicles. Co-founders Gene Sheridan and Dan Kinzer celebrated the IPO seven years after starting the El Segundo-based company.

title: Mindtree Launches Industry-Specific IoT Solutions Built on ServiceNow Connected Operations
summary: Mindtree has launched new industry-specific IoT solutions leveraging ServiceNow Connected Operations. These solutions are designed to enhance operational efficiency and service management across various sectors. The article highlights the strategic collaboration between Mindtree and ServiceNow to deliver advanced IoT capabilities.

title: Kickstart your internal communications strategy with these best practices
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide to developing an effective internal communications strategy, highlighting its increased importance in a remote and hybrid work environment. It outlines seven key steps, from assessing current strategies and setting goals to segmenting audiences and identifying communication tools, and further details best practices for engaging employees and building a strong company culture. The piece emphasizes the necessity of measuring progress and continually optimizing internal communication efforts to improve employee engagement, productivity, and retention.

title: Microsoft cloud agreement aims to boost NZ health service equity – New Zealand News Centre
summary: Microsoft New Zealand has signed a three-year cloud services agreement with the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) to migrate its New Zealand operations to Azure. This agreement aims to enhance ACC's data utilization for better healthcare pathways and more equitable health outcomes across the country. It also positions ACC to leverage Microsoft's forthcoming hyperscale datacenter region in New Zealand for secure data storage and scalable capacity.

title: PayPal in $45 bln bid for Pinterest -sources
summary: PayPal Holdings Inc is reportedly offering to acquire digital pinboard site Pinterest Inc for $45 billion, mostly in stock, which would be the largest acquisition of a social media company. The potential deal aims to capitalize on the growing social commerce trend and diversify PayPal's income with advertising revenue. While no deal is certain, the proposed offer represents a 26% premium to Pinterest's recent closing price.

title: Microsoft’s 2021 Diversity & Inclusion report: Demonstrating progress and remaining accountable to our commitments
summary: Microsoft's Chief Diversity Officer, Lindsay-Rae McIntyre, shares the company's 2021 Diversity & Inclusion report, highlighting progress in workforce representation across various groups. The report emphasizes measurement and data, along with employee experiences, showcasing increases in representation for women, Black and African American, Hispanic and Latinx, and Asian employees, as well as those self-identifying with a disability. It also details advancements at leadership levels and Microsoft's commitment to its Racial Equity Initiative goals.

title: Cloud Security Should Be the CEO’s Wheelhouse Too
summary: This article argues that CEOs must be deeply involved in cloud cybersecurity due to increasing digital threats like ransomware, emphasizing that it's no longer just an IT concern but a crucial business risk. It highlights the importance of CEOs understanding cybersecurity risks, mitigation plans, and investing in the right technology and personnel, with a direct reporting line from the CISO. The piece also discusses the WisdomTree Cloud Computing Fund (WCLD) as an investment vehicle for the rapidly growing cloud computing industry.

title: Inside TSMC, the Taiwanese chipmaking giant that's building a new plant in Phoenix
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) is investing $100 billion to ramp up chip production and address the global chip shortage. The company is building a $12 billion fabrication plant in Phoenix, Arizona, set to produce 5-nanometer chips in 2024, aiming to bring advanced chip manufacturing back to the U.S. TSMC, a "pure-play foundry," dominates the advanced chip market and is a key supplier for companies like Apple, making its expansion crucial for global technology supply chains and national security.

title: How Stephen Garden took Onica from class assignment to a multi-million dollar acquisition in just 6 years
summary: Stephen Garden transformed Onica from a class assignment at London Business School into a multi-million dollar acquisition by Rackspace in just six years by focusing on Amazon Web Services expertise. Despite Onica's rapid success and global reach, Garden stepped down from his SVP role at Rackspace in 2020 to prioritize personal well-being, taking a year-long sabbatical. The article highlights the intense dedication required for such entrepreneurial success and the importance of finding life balance.

title: Does Microsoft own Forza?
summary: Microsoft owns the Forza gaming franchise, encompassing both the Forza Motorsport and Forza Horizon series.
