Turn 10 Studios, a first-party Microsoft studio, develops Forza Motorsport, while Playground Games, also owned by Microsoft, collaborates with Turn 10 on Forza Horizon using shared assets. This ownership ensures Forza titles are available on Xbox Game Pass from launch day but exclusively for Xbox and PC platforms.

title: Microsoft announces proposed election of new board member
summary: Microsoft announced the nomination of Carlos A. Rodriguez, president and CEO of Automatic Data Processing (ADP), to its board of directors. Rodriguez will be presented for election at the company's annual shareholders meeting on November 30, 2021. This addition is expected to bring valuable industry and technology expertise, particularly concerning changing work norms, to Microsoft's board.

title: Paltalk Drops Data-Sharing Patent Case Against Game Makers
summary: Paltalk Holdings has voluntarily dismissed its 2009 lawsuit against several prominent game publishers, including Sony, Activision Blizzard, Turbine, and NCSoft. The lawsuit accused these companies of infringing on Paltalk's patent for "controlling interactive applications over multiple computers." While the reasons for the dismissal are unknown, a similar 2009 case against Microsoft was settled out of court.

title: GitLab: Another Overpriced Tech Company
summary: This article argues that GitLab (GTLB) is an overpriced tech company ahead of its IPO, with a projected valuation of $8.2 billion being significantly higher than its intrinsic value. The author highlights GitLab's unprofitable freemium model, fierce competition from profitable industry giants like Microsoft, and several red flags for investors including insider control and potentially misleading non-GAAP metrics. The analysis suggests a fair value for GitLab's stock could be as low as $5/share.

title: BNY Mellon Moves Wire Payments into Microsoft Azure, Increasing Resiliency and Capacity of Payments Industry
summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with Microsoft to migrate infrastructure supporting wire payments into Microsoft Azure, significantly enhancing the resiliency and capacity of the global payments industry. This collaboration also includes a treasury cash management relationship with Microsoft Treasury built on the Azure cloud payment system. The move aims to digitize payments, making them faster, more transparent, and more resilient, especially in response to market volatility.

title: Oracle Expands Global Cloud Footprint to Meet Continued Triple-Digit Growth
summary: Oracle announced plans to significantly expand its cloud region footprint globally, aiming for at least 44 cloud regions by the end of 2022 to meet strong customer demand. This expansion includes new locations across Europe, the Middle East, Asia Pacific, and Latin America, reinforcing Oracle's dual-region strategy for business continuity and compliance. Oracle also highlighted its commitment to sustainability, planning to power all cloud regions with 100 percent renewable energy by 2025.

title: Microsoft named as a Leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Full Lifecycle API Management
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Full Lifecycle API Management for its Azure API Management platform. The article highlights Azure API Management's comprehensive features for managing APIs, its role in enabling digital transformation for customers, flexible pricing, and deep integration with other Azure services. The platform is noted for its global availability and significant customer momentum, with enterprises like Schindler and DHL utilizing it for digital transformation.

title: Emerson to Accelerate Software Strategy to Capitalize on High Growth Industry Verticals and Technology Segments in Transaction with AspenTech
summary: Emerson and AspenTech announced a definitive agreement where Emerson will contribute its industrial software businesses (OSI Inc. and Geological Simulation Software) and $6.0 billion in cash to AspenTech, creating a new diversified industrial software leader. Emerson will hold a 55% stake in the new AspenTech, which aims to accelerate its software strategy, drive growth, and pursue strategic acquisitions, while providing immediate cash value and future upside to AspenTech shareholders. This transaction is expected to significantly enhance the combined company's industrial AI and asset optimization offerings, expand into high-growth markets, and realize substantial revenue and cost synergies.

title: Highest Density SuperBlade® Server for HPC Applications
summary: Supermicro's SuperBlade® server solutions offer high density and efficiency for HPC, enterprise cloud, and other demanding applications. Available in 8U, 6U, and 4U enclosures, these systems support advanced processors from Intel and AMD, high-speed networking, and various storage options, alongside resource-saving architecture for optimal TCO. The article highlights successful deployments by companies like HEROZ and Korea Hydro and Nuclear Power, and provides extensive details on features and configurations.

title: Microsoft Philippines Appoints New Small & Medium Corporate Director
summary: Microsoft Philippines has appointed Ms. Elizabeth Pangan as the new Director for its Small and Medium Corporate (SMC) segment. Pangan brings over 30 years of experience in cloud, IT, and enterprise industries, with previous roles at Microsoft and leadership positions elsewhere. Her return is expected to significantly contribute to Microsoft's mission and digital transformation efforts for customers in the Philippines.

title: Microsoft named as a Leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Integration Platform as a Service (EiPaaS) for the fourth consecutive year. Their Azure Integration Services (AIS), including Logic Apps, API Management, Service Bus, Event Grid, and Data Factory, enable customers to connect applications, data, and services across various environments. AIS emphasizes empowering diverse user personas, offering flexible pricing, and strong customer momentum across various industries for modern integration solutions.

title: In Atlanta's Grove Park, Microsoft Corp. will try to succeed where Big Tech often fails - Atlanta Business Chronicle
summary: Microsoft Corp. is establishing a 15,000-job campus in Atlanta's Grove Park, a Black working-class neighborhood characterized by significant income inequality and poverty. This move presents a challenge for Microsoft to avoid the pitfalls of gentrification often associated with Big Tech expansions in historically underserved communities. The article implies that Microsoft aims to make a positive impact, addressing the complexities of revitalization in an area with a low average disposable income.

title: Paul Marshall and Ian Wace’s Stock Picks: Biogen Inc (BIIB), Apple Inc (AAPL) and More
summary: This article details the top stock picks of hedge fund managers Paul Marshall and Ian Wace, based on their Q2 2021 holdings. It highlights a selection of companies including Biogen Inc (BIIB), Apple Inc (AAPL), Zoetis Inc. (ZTS), ViacomCBS Inc. (VIAC), and Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (TMO), providing details on their stake value, company background, and recent analyst ratings or news. The piece also explains the investment philosophy and background of Marshall Wace LLP.

title: EXCLUSIVE US electronics firm struck deal to transport and hire Uyghur workers
summary: Universal Electronics Inc (UEIC.O), a U.S. remote-control maker, confirmed entering an agreement with Xinjiang authorities to transport and employ hundreds of Uyghur workers at its plant in Qinzhou, China. This marks the first confirmed instance of an American company participating in a worker-transfer program described by some rights groups as forced labor. The article details the conditions of these workers, including police escorts, segregated living quarters, and mandatory "education activities," raising concerns among human rights organizations and prompting responses from UEI's business partners like Sony and Microsoft.

title: Infographic: Why Are You Wasting Your SaaS Expenditure?
summary: Gartner's analysis projects a 19% growth in annual SaaS expenditure, yet identifies that a quarter of this software will be underutilized or over-deployed. The article suggests that executive leaders can mitigate this waste by mandating the use of software asset management functions. This infographic highlights the inefficiencies in SaaS spending and offers a solution to improve cost-effectiveness.

title: Discover Equal Weight Benefits With RSP
summary: This article discusses the benefits of equal weight ETFs, using the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP) as a prime example. It explains how equal weighting offers diversification beyond cap-weighted funds and benefits from mean-reversion, despite critics associating its outperformance with size and value factors. The article highlights RSP's long-term outperformance potential and its role in true diversification by preventing a few mega-cap stocks from dominating the index.

title: GM aims to build Netflix-sized subscription business by 2030
summary: General Motors announced its ambitious goal to generate $25 billion in annual revenue from in-car subscription services by 2030, putting it in the same league as Netflix. The automaker expects nearly $2 billion in revenue from these services this year, driven by its current base of 4.2 million subscribed vehicles and the upcoming Ultifi software platform. GM plans to monetize features like OnStar, Maps+, and fleet management solutions, projecting a serviceable addressable market of $80 billion by 2030.

title: Integra LifeSciences enhances multicloud capability with OCI, achieves 90% time savings and boosts IT efficiency
summary: Integra LifeSciences significantly improved its IT efficiency and multicloud capabilities by migrating its mission-critical E-Business Suite applications to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). This move resulted in a 90% time savings for daily sales invoice reports and a reduction of nightly data analytics processing from 8.5 to 3.5 hours, leveraging OCI's high-performance platform and its interconnection with Microsoft Azure. The company also enhanced business resiliency and gained proactive performance insights, solidifying a strategic position for future growth.

title: Informatica Named a Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader—For The 14th Time
summary: Informatica has been recognized as a Leader in the Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Data Quality Solutions for the 14th consecutive time. The article emphasizes the growing importance of data quality in technology, especially for AI initiatives, and highlights Informatica's consistent innovation, integrated end-to-end solutions, and cloud offerings as key strengths. It also cites customer success stories to demonstrate the value data quality brings to various organizations.

title: U.S. Supreme Court rebuffs Oracle challenge to Pentagon cloud contract
summary: The U.S. Supreme Court declined to hear Oracle Corp's challenge to the Pentagon's now-canceled $10 billion JEDI cloud computing contract. A lower court had ruled that Oracle was not harmed by any errors in the contract award process as the company would not have qualified. The JEDI contract, initially awarded to Microsoft Corp and later scrapped, is being replaced by a new contract expected to include Amazon.com.

title: GINN's Got the Goods of Quality Disruptive Companies
summary: The article highlights the Goldman Sachs Innovate Equity ETF (GINN) as a strong investment opportunity, particularly for those seeking exposure to high-quality, disruptive growth companies. Despite the S&P 500 Technology Index's flat performance in the third quarter, GINN focuses on larger, mature yet innovative companies with high return on equity (ROE), such as Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. The fund's significant allocation to technology and healthcare sectors, combined with its emphasis on quality traits and R&D-focused companies, positions it well for continued upside.

title: Zoom and Five9 abandon $14.7 billion acquisition
summary: Zoom and Five9 have called off their $14.7 billion all-stock acquisition after Five9 shareholders rejected the deal and regulators raised concerns about foreign participation. This marks a missed opportunity for Zoom to quickly expand its capabilities following its pandemic-driven growth, and Five9 shareholders were reportedly unsatisfied with the premium offered. Despite the termination, both companies plan to maintain their existing product partnership.

title: Warby Parker opens at $54.05 per share in public debut on NYSE, soaring more than 30% above reference price
summary: Eyewear company Warby Parker made its public debut on the NYSE via a direct listing, with its stock, WRBY, opening at $54.05 per share, significantly above its $40 reference price. The company, valued at over $6 billion after its first day of trading, aims to expand its market share in eyeglasses, contact lenses, and eye exams, despite recent losses, through continued physical retail growth and its strong digital presence. Co-CEOs Dave Gilboa and Neil Blumenthal see massive growth opportunities in its various categories.

title: Specifications of Personal Computers Over Time
summary: This article traces the evolution of personal computer specifications over 50 years, from the 1971 Kenbak-1 to modern HP Pavilion models. It highlights significant advancements in RAM and processing speed, and discusses key PC specifications like processor speed and RAM, explaining their importance and upgradeability. An infographic details spec changes for popular computers through the years.

title: Western States Caterpillar – fusion teams use Microsoft Power Platform to build mobile apps for field staff
summary: Western States Caterpillar leveraged Microsoft Power Platform to build mobile apps for field staff, specifically addressing the digitization of rental returns and enabling sales teams to better understand customers. This initiative involved a "fusion team" approach, combining low-code (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) and pro-dev technologies (ASP.NET Core, Azure Blob storage, Azure SQL), resulting in significant improvements in operational efficiency and sales effectiveness. The success of these solutions, "Return to Ready" and "Client Connect," has led to substantial growth in Power BI and Power Apps usage across the company, inspiring other Caterpillar dealers.

title: What Is Blockchain?
summary: This article defines blockchain as a decentralized ledger of shared data, explaining how its cryptographic hashes and peer-to-peer network ensure data integrity, security, and immutability. It details the three main types of blockchain—public, private, and federated—and highlights the significant business benefits, including establishing trust, streamlining operations, and improving security, particularly when integrated with technologies like IoT and AI. The article also introduces Hyperledger as a key open-source initiative promoting enterprise blockchain solutions.

title: Microsoft is a Leader in the 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Enterprise Low-Code Application Platforms
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Low-Code Application Platforms for its Power Apps product. The article highlights how Microsoft has invested significantly in making its Power Platform the most comprehensive low-code application development platform, used by 92% of Fortune 500 organizations. It outlines five key reasons for Power Apps' leadership, including its trusted cloud infrastructure, support for fusion teams, enterprise reliability, superior innovation, and design for all developers.

title: Why Intuit Paid $500 Million for Naming Rights at Clippers Arena
summary: Intuit paid $500 million for the naming rights to the Los Angeles Clippers' new 18,000-seat arena, the Intuit Dome, for 23 years. This deal is part of a broader partnership focusing on fan experience, technology, and community involvement in Inglewood. The agreement aims to boost Intuit's public profile and contribute to the economic development and job creation in the area.

title: Digital Turbine Stock, Builders FirstSource, Cricut Among 19 New IBD Watchlist Stocks
summary: Investor's Business Daily (IBD) has added Digital Turbine, Builders FirstSource, and Cricut to its updated watchlist, which includes 19 new stocks. IBD regularly updates its stock screens, such as the IBD 50 and IBD Sector Leaders, to help investors identify promising stocks, and the article provides a detailed list of these additions and removals.

title: Windows 11 is coming. Here’s what you need to know about updates and upgrades
summary: Microsoft Corporation announced that Windows 11 is set to release on October 5, featuring an upgraded UI, improved widgets, and optimizations for various hardware. While new eligible devices will receive the upgrade first, users with older hardware may need to upgrade their systems to meet the higher requirements. Windows 10 support will continue until October 14, 2025, offering users ample time to transition.

title: RIM delays new BlackBerry launch; sales crumble
summary: Research In Motion Ltd (RIM) has delayed the launch of its next-generation BlackBerry phones until early 2013, a significant setback for the company facing crumbling sales, a deeper-than-expected quarterly operating loss, and deep job cuts. The delay, coupled with a 30% workforce reduction and mounting financial pressure, signals a potential terminal decline for the once-dominant technology firm. Analysts are concerned about RIM's survival as it misses crucial shopping periods and struggles to compete with Apple and Android.

title: Modi, Qualcomm CEO discuss semiconductor
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon in the US to discuss investment opportunities in India's telecom and electronics sectors, particularly focusing on the semiconductor supply chain and the government's production-linked incentive schemes. This meeting was Modi's first engagement upon his arrival in the US, highlighting India's push to attract semiconductor companies and build a local innovation ecosystem. Modi also met with top officials from Adobe, First Solar, General Atomics Global Corporation, and Blackstone to discuss various investment and collaboration opportunities in India.

title: Papa Johns Opening Headquarters in Atlanta
summary: Papa John's International is relocating its headquarters for commercial, communications, development, operations, people operations, and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion teams to Atlanta. The Louisville-based pizza company will occupy the top two floors of Three Ballpark Center at The Battery, totaling 60,000 square feet, and expects to house 190 employees in the new location. This move follows Papa John's announcement last September about establishing a corporate office in Atlanta, joining other major companies in the area.

title: Cisco Named a Leader in 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for WAN Edge Infrastructure
summary: Cisco has announced its recognition as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for WAN Edge Infrastructure, highlighting its SD-WAN solutions. These solutions focus on enabling secure, predictable digital experiences for hybrid workforces, building dynamic workspaces, and securing multi-cloud environments, accelerating the transition to a SASE-enabled architecture. Cisco emphasizes its comprehensive capabilities in seamless multicloud access, integrated security, and optimized insights through ThousandEyes integration.

title: The 4 Trends That Prevail on the Gartner Hype Cycle for AI, 2021
summary: This article outlines the four major trends dominating the Gartner Hype Cycle for AI in 2021: operationalizing AI initiatives, efficient use of data, models, and compute, responsible AI, and data for AI. It emphasizes the need for organizations to move AI proofs of concept into production faster, leverage composite and generative AI, ensure ethical and transparent AI systems, and adapt to "small data" and "wide data" approaches due to disruptions like the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Salesforce Launches Updated Sustainability Cloud Integrating Newly Acquired Slack, as Company Achieves Net Zero
summary: Salesforce announced it has achieved net zero emissions across its full value chain and 100% renewable energy for its operations. The company also launched Sustainability Cloud 2.0, which now integrates Slack for enhanced collaboration, to help organizations track and reduce carbon emissions. This updated platform comes alongside Salesforce's climate action plan and advocacy for mandatory climate reporting.

title: Inside Wells Fargo’s multicloud strategy
summary: Wells Fargo is implementing a decade-long multicloud strategy, partnering with Microsoft and Google to modernize its technology infrastructure for public cloud operations. This approach, while different from some competitors, aims for portability, resilience, and avoids vendor lock-in, addressing the challenges of migrating highly regulated data and upskilling its workforce. The financial institution plans to progressively move existing applications to the public cloud, prioritizing impact over speed, with the ultimate goal of moving away from traditional data centers.

title: Wells Fargo cloud plans revealed amid sweeping IT overhaul
summary: Wells Fargo has unveiled a new multi-cloud infrastructure strategy, selecting Azure as its primary public cloud provider and Google Cloud for AI solutions, alongside existing HPE GreenLake contracts. This move is part of a sweeping IT overhaul aimed at driving technological speed, agility, and scalability, as well as addressing risk and compliance issues following a major scandal. The bank plans a hybrid approach, initially utilizing third-party data centers while aspiring to predominantly rely on public cloud offerings.

title: Is a stock market correction on the horizon?
summary: The S&P 500 has seen a recent dip, leading analysts to narrow predictions for the U.S. equity market. While tech stocks may face challenges due to Fed policy and rising interest rates, other sectors like energy and small-caps are showing potential. Despite concerns, corrections are normal, and many analysts remain bullish on long-term market growth, suggesting current dips could be buying opportunities.

title: How an ERP System Helped a Medical Device Manufacturer Meet Customer Demands
summary: This article details how Insulet Corporation, a medical device manufacturer, successfully upgraded its ERP system to meet increased customer demand and overcome regulatory challenges. By partnering with Alithya and implementing a new Microsoft Dynamics AX system, Insulet expanded into European markets, opened a new manufacturing facility, and scaled its operations. The upgrade provided crucial supply chain and manufacturing functionality while remaining within budget and timeline constraints.

title: Microsoft collaborates with AICTE, NASSCOM, EY, GitHub, and Quess Corp to empower India’s youth with tech skills to be job-ready
summary: Microsoft, in collaboration with AICTE, NASSCOM, EY, GitHub, and Quess Corp, has launched the "Future Ready Talent" program in India. This initiative aims to skill over 1.5 lakh higher education students in areas like data and AI, cloud computing, and cybersecurity to enhance their employability. The program provides a comprehensive platform from digital skilling and project work to mentorship and access to potential employers.

title: Palo Alto Networks’s new Prisma SASE offers integrated cloud-delivered service
summary: Palo Alto Networks Inc. announced Prisma SASE, a new integrated cloud-delivered service combining network security (SASE) and software-defined wide-area networking (SD-WAN). The product aims to enhance security and productivity for organizations by integrating 5G, Autonomous Digital Experience Management (ADEM), and various cloud services through CloudBlades. It offers a simplified approach to adopting SASE with integrated web security rules and capabilities for a hybrid workforce.

title: Customize Your Spartan Faster Thanks to Double XP With Purchase of Kellogg's® Products For Halo Infinite
summary: Kellogg's, in partnership with Halo, is offering Double XP in Halo Infinite Multiplayer to fans who purchase select Kellogg's snack products including Pringles, Cheez-It Grooves, Pop-Tarts, and Bear Naked. This promotion runs from September 15, 2021, to January 31, 2022, allowing gamers to earn in-game rewards by uploading receipts. The initiative aims to enhance the player experience for the upcoming Halo Infinite launch on December 8.

title: Gartner® Recognizes Microsoft as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud ERP for Product-Centric Enterprises
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Cloud ERP for Product-Centric Enterprises due to its Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Dynamics 365 Finance solutions. These offerings provide composable ERP capabilities, enabling product-centric enterprises to transform their systems by moving to the cloud, improving agility, and leveraging AI-based predictive insights. Recent investments, including the acquisition of Suplari and the general availability of Dynamics 365 Intelligent Order Management, further enhance Microsoft's commitment to delivering advanced ERP solutions.

title: Microsoft to Open Regional Hub, Latin American Offices in Miami
summary: Microsoft is establishing a new regional hub and Latin American offices in Miami, leasing approximately 42,000 square feet at 830 Brickell. This new location will serve as headquarters for Microsoft Latin America and aims to deepen relationships with customers while supporting collaboration and productivity among employees. The regional hub is anticipated to open in mid-2023.

title: How Navi's FoF on Vanguard US Total Stock Market ETF could add value to your portfolio
summary: Navi Mutual Fund has filed for a new Fund of Fund (FoF) that will invest in the Vanguard Total Stock Market Index Fund ETF (VTI), a passively managed US-based ETF with a very low expense ratio. This FoF will allow Indian investors to access the broad US equity market, including companies typically unavailable in India, potentially adding value due to low correlation with the Indian market. However, investors should be aware of debt fund taxation rules for international funds.

title: The effects of remote work on collaboration among information workers
summary: A study using data from 61,182 US Microsoft employees explores the causal effects of firm-wide remote work on collaboration and communication during the first six months of 2020. The findings indicate that remote work led to a more static and siloed collaboration network with fewer cross-group connections, as well as a decrease in synchronous communication and an increase in asynchronous communication. These changes may hinder employees' ability to acquire and share new information across the organization.

title: The Top 8 Security and Risk Trends We’re Watching
summary: Gartner identifies eight top security and risk trends for 2021, driven by factors like security breaches and the COVID-19 pandemic. These trends highlight strategic shifts in the security ecosystem, including cybersecurity mesh, cyber-savvy boards, vendor consolidation, and identity-first security, emphasizing the need for flexible and agile security solutions. The report also addresses the rising importance of managing machine identities, the permanence of remote work, breach and attack simulation, and privacy-enhancing computation techniques.

title: Lumen’s Paul Savill shares his view from the edge of the Fourth Industrial Revolution
summary: Paul Savill of Lumen Technologies discusses the strategic alliance between Lumen and Microsoft, focusing on how their combined strengths in global networking and cloud services are accelerating the Fourth Industrial Revolution. The partnership aims to provide businesses with more technology choices through edge compute nodes, enabling lower latency, cost optimization, and the development of next-generation applications. Savill highlights initiatives in smart cities, retail, and manufacturing, and envisions Lumen as a network technology company focused on moving and securing digital assets globally.

title: Microsoft acquires Clipchamp to empower creators
summary: Microsoft has acquired Clipchamp, an in-browser video creation and editing experience founded in 2013. The acquisition aims to empower creators by integrating Clipchamp's easy-to-use, powerful video editing tools into Microsoft 365, making video creation accessible for individuals, families, schools, and businesses. This move highlights video's growing importance as a communication medium across various aspects of life, from personal projects to professional documentation.

title: Telkom outlines three key strategies to develop its digital business
summary: PT Telkom Indonesia (Persero) Tbk has detailed three key strategies—build, borrow, and buy—to advance its digital business. The "build" strategy focuses on developing digital infrastructure and talent, "borrow" emphasizes strategic partnerships with technology giants like Microsoft, and "buy" involves investments in various digital companies and startups, including increased investment in Gojek and MDI Ventures. These strategies aim to drive synergy within TelkomGroup and have contributed to a 3.9 percent annual consolidated revenue growth.

title: Gartner Identifies Six Technologies to Drive New Customer Acquisition and Growth for Digital Marketing
summary: Gartner has identified six key technologies that digital marketers should leverage for new customer acquisition and growth in a post-pandemic world. These technologies include AI for Marketing, Multichannel Marketing Hubs, Influence Engineering, Customer Data Ethics, Event-Triggered Marketing, and Mobile Marketing Analytics. The shift from customer retention to acquisition highlights the increasing reliance on data-driven strategies and ethical considerations in marketing.

title: Microsoft reportedly paid $100 million to make Rise of the Tomb Raider timed exclusive for Xbox
summary: New reports claim that Microsoft paid Square Enix $100 million for the one-year Xbox timed exclusivity of Rise of the Tomb Raider in 2015. This information appeared on the LinkedIn page of Square Enix's former director of strategic planning, Fabien Rossini, before being deleted. Microsoft has never officially commented on the financial terms of the deal, but the game sold over 7 million units by 2017 after the exclusivity period ended.

title: Transforming change management at Microsoft with Microsoft 365
summary: This article details how Microsoft adapted its change management strategies for Microsoft 365 as it transitioned to a Software as a Service (SaaS) model. It highlights the challenges of integrating continuous updates, the impact of remote work, and the role of AI in reducing meeting fatigue. The piece outlines Microsoft's approach to change management, focusing on initial triage, implementing guardrails for innovation, and staying current with updates, using concepts like 'posture' and 'ring structure' for controlled deployment.

title: Arlo Offers Comprehensive Third-Party Compatibility With Amazon, Apple, Google, Samsung, And Others For Seamless Smart Home Security Experience
summary: Arlo Technologies announced enhanced compatibility for its smart home security systems with major platforms like Amazon Alexa, Apple HomeKit, Google Home Assistant, IFTTT, and Samsung SmartThings. These integrations provide users with seamless control over their Arlo devices through voice commands, notifications, and live video feeds on various smart home devices, reflecting Arlo's commitment to a robust and integrated security experience. The updates aim to offer peace of mind regardless of the user's preferred smart home ecosystem.

title: Cybersecurity giant Check Point acquires Israeli startup to protect cloud emails
summary: Cybersecurity firm Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. announced its acquisition of Israeli startup Avanan, a cloud email security provider, for an estimated $270-$280 million in cash and stocks. Avanan, founded in 2015, protects cloud collaboration solutions like Microsoft Office 365, G-Suite, and Slack from cyberattacks, with over 5,000 global clients and 2.5 million inboxes protected. This acquisition aims to integrate Avanan's technology with Check Point's existing threat prevention software to enhance cloud email security, especially in the context of increased remote work and phishing attacks.

title: An investor with a flair for tech could push Fiserv to the next level
summary: ValueAct Capital has invested $1.2 billion in Fiserv (FISV), believing the payment technology company is misunderstood by the market and poised for significant growth through transformation. ValueAct aims to assist Fiserv in leveraging its technology, like Clover, to achieve higher growth rates and better communicate its strategic opportunities to the market, drawing parallels to its successful investments in other perceived "legacy" tech companies like Microsoft and Adobe. This partnership could help Fiserv enhance its valuation by clarifying its position as a "new world company" with substantial growth potential.

title: Women's Equality Day: How one ETF up nearly 20% this year promotes female empowerment
summary: Ahead of Women's Equality Day, two prominent female empowerment ETFs, WOMN and SHE, have achieved all-time highs. The Impact Shares YWCA Women's Empowerment ETF (WOMN) is up nearly 19% this year, while the SPDR SSGA Gender Diversity Index ETF (SHE) is up 17%. These thematic ETFs not only promote women's empowerment through their investment criteria but have also outperformed broader market indices like the Russell 1000.

title: Synopsys' AI-Assisted EDA Tools Aim To Cut GPU Design Costs in Half
summary: Synopsys' new AI-assisted Electronic Design Automation (EDA) tools promise to significantly reduce the cost and time required for chip design, particularly for GPUs. The DSO.ai platform can optimize various aspects of chip design, potentially cutting development time from 24 months to 24 weeks and reducing costs by as much as 50%. Companies like Samsung, Google, and Nvidia are already adopting this technology, which could also democratize chip development for smaller firms.

title: UK 3D CAD Software Market Size & Share, Application Analysis,
summary: The 3D CAD Software Market is valued at USD 9.4 Billion in 2018 and is expected to reach USD 13.8 Billion by 2025, growing at a CAGR of 5.62%. This growth is driven by increasing demand for 3D modeling and innovative technologies, despite restraints like high software costs and security concerns with cloud-based solutions. Oracle Corporation, Bricsys NV, Autodesk Inc., CAXA Technology Co., Ltd, and PTC Inc. are key vendors in this market, which sees strong regional growth in North America and Asia Pacific.

title: Like the QQQ ETF? Don't Forget About 'QQQM'
summary: This article highlights the Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) as an alternative to the popular Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) for long-term investors. While QQQ is favored by traders, QQQM offers a lower expense ratio and a more accessible share price, making it suitable for buy-and-hold strategies aiming to capitalize on the growth of Nasdaq's largest non-financial companies.

title: Duke Energy teams with Accenture and Microsoft to develop first-of-its-kind methane-emissions monitoring platform
summary: Duke Energy announced a collaboration with Accenture and Microsoft to develop a pioneering cloud-hosted platform for monitoring methane emissions from natural gas distribution systems. This platform will use satellites and ground sensors for real-time data collection and advanced leak detection, aiming to help Duke Energy achieve net-zero methane emissions by 2030. Implementation is expected by October 2021, with satellite captures beginning in Greenville, S.C., in August.

title: Cybersecurity Experts Worried by Chinese Firm’s Control of Smart Devices
summary: Cybersecurity experts are concerned about Chinese firm Tuya Inc.'s control over smart devices given China's law requiring companies to share data with the government. This raises significant privacy and security issues for consumer data collected through IoT devices in U.S. households and other sectors. Experts are urging U.S. lawmakers to implement regulations or bans on Tuya and other Chinese tech companies to mitigate these potential national security and privacy risks.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Apple’s Proposed Protections Against Child Predators — a Challenge to Privacy?
summary: Apple announced a new system to identify child predatory content in its photo cloud, sparking varied reactions from law enforcement, child protection groups, and privacy defenders. The system involves on-device scanning of iCloud Photos using an algorithm to detect known child abuse images, raising concerns among critics about potential privacy invasions and governmental pressure to expand surveillance capabilities. The article discusses the technical implementation, immediate reactions, and the broader implications for Apple's long-standing commitment to user privacy amidst new challenges.

title: Microsoft Corporation invests $5 million in Oyo
summary: Microsoft Corporation has invested nearly $5 million (about Rs 37 crore) in Oyo through the issuance of equity shares and compulsory convertible cumulative preference shares on a private placement basis. This investment follows Oyo's previous announcement in July of raising $660 million in TLB funding for debt reduction and business investments. The deal involves the issuance of equity shares and Series F2 CCCPS to Microsoft.

title: For Long-Term Investors, a QQQ-to-QQQM Switch May Make Sense
summary: The article discusses how long-term investors might benefit from switching from the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) to the Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) due to QQQM's lower expense ratio. While QQQM is newer and less liquid, its cost savings over time make it an attractive option for buy-and-hold investors seeking exposure to the Nasdaq-100 Index. The Nasdaq-100 Index has consistently outperformed other benchmarks, making both ETFs appealing for growth-oriented portfolios.

title: Adobe buying Frame.io in $1.28B deal
summary: Adobe announced its acquisition of Frame.io, a video review and collaboration platform, for $1.275 billion in cash. Frame.io aims to streamline video creation workflows for creative professionals by centralizing media assets and enabling real-time feedback. This acquisition is expected to enhance Adobe's video editing products by integrating Frame.io's collaboration features.

title: Edge Computing Market 2021-2025 Witnesses Emergence of Dominant Players Including Cisco Systems Inc., Dell Technologies Inc., and Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co.| Technavio
summary: The Edge Computing Market is projected to grow by USD 7.29 billion during 2021-2025, with a CAGR exceeding 26%. North America is expected to contribute 44% of this growth, while the industrial manufacturing segment will lead in end-user categories. Key players include Cisco Systems Inc., Dell Technologies Inc., and Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co., with the market facing challenges from competition with low-cost centralized computing.

title: Monday.com brings document editing to project management
summary: Monday.com has launched "workdocs," a new document editing tool integrated into its project management platform, designed for real-time collaboration, brainstorming, and goal setting. This tool allows multiple employees to edit documents simultaneously, embed widgets that update in real time from external data sources like Salesforce, and even edit Monday.com elements directly. Despite facing competition from established players like Microsoft and Google, workdocs aims to complement Monday's existing offerings by accommodating text-based work processes.

title: Perpetua to supply Ambri batteries with antimony
summary: Perpetua Resources has signed an agreement with Ambri Inc. to supply antimony from its Stibnite mine for Ambri's liquid-metal batteries. This partnership ensures a domestic supply of antimony for battery production and aligns with the goal of achieving 100% clean electricity in the U.S. The agreement coincides with Ambri securing $144 million in new financing to accelerate commercialization and build a domestic manufacturing facility.

title: Digital Market May See a Big Move | Adobe Systems Incorporated , Oracle , SAP SE , Salesforce , IBM , Marketo
summary: Ample Market Research has added a detailed report on the Digital Market, outlining current and future growth trends, supply and demand analysis, and key player participation. The report forecasts the market from 2020 to 2025, covering segmentation by type, application, and region, along with drivers, limitations, and opportunities. It also provides a competitive analysis of major industry players like Adobe Systems, Oracle, SAP SE, Salesforce, IBM, and Marketo.

title: Microsoft Partnership Puts the 'S' & 'G' Into the 'E' in ESG
summary: Microsoft has partnered with Volt Energy to bring carbon-neutral electricity to underserved communities, addressing both environmental and social justice issues within the ESG framework. This initiative, while small in scale regarding initial power purchase, is seen as a significant step in pushing the boundaries of corporate environmental and social leadership. The article also highlights the Putnam Sustainable Leaders ETF (PLDR), which invests in companies like Microsoft that demonstrate proactive leadership in ESG issues and includes Microsoft as a top holding.

title: Slingshot Aerospace Announces World’s First Collision Avoidance Collaboration & Communications Platform for Space; OneWeb, Spire Global Inc. & Orbit Fab to Pilot Technology
summary: Slingshot Aerospace launched Slingshot Beacon, the industry's first collision avoidance collaboration and communications platform for space, with OneWeb, Spire Global Inc., and Orbit Fab piloting the technology. The platform aims to improve transparency, safety, and sustainability in space by enabling communication and coordination among spacecraft owner-operators to mitigate potential collisions. Slingshot Aerospace acquired Stellatus Solutions LLC to accelerate the launch of Slingshot Beacon, which will provide features like asset monitoring, environmental anomaly reports, and conjunction data messages.

title: What’s Changed: 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Sales Force Automation
summary: Gartner, Inc. released the 2021 version of its Magic Quadrant for Sales Force Automation, identifying 16 significant SFA providers based on "Completeness of Vision" and "Ability to Execute." The report highlights market growth, changes in vendor rankings, and key functionalities necessary for successful SFA applications. It details leading vendors like Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, and Creatio, along with Challengers, Niche Players, and Visionaries.

title: Expedia Group pushes back its full return to the office to January 2022
summary: Expedia Group has announced a delay in its full return to office plans, now targeting January 2022 for a hybrid model due to evolving COVID-19 circumstances. This decision follows similar moves by other major tech companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Google, and Apple. The company's U.S. offices are open to vaccinated employees and visitors in the interim, with a global evaluation for similar approaches.

title: GE Healthcare Brings Radiology Without Walls to Resource-Constrained Small Imaging Centers With AI-Enabled, Cloud Imaging Solution
summary: GE Healthcare has launched Edison True PACS, an AI-enabled, cloud-based Picture Archive and Communication System designed to help resource-constrained small imaging centers and community hospitals improve efficiency and diagnostic precision. This solution addresses challenges like radiologist shortages and IT resource limitations, offering remote reading capabilities and seamless integration of AI algorithms. It is available as a SaaS or on-premise offering with flexible subscription models to match varying organizational needs and budgets.

title: ServiceNow Acquires Database Performance Software Company Swarm64 -
summary: ServiceNow has acquired Swarm64, a Berlin-based database performance software company, to enhance its ability to scale digital workflows and handle growing data volumes for customers. Swarm64, founded in 2013 and previously venture-backed by Intel Capital and Xilinx, specializes in combining analytics and transactional database functionality. This acquisition aligns with ServiceNow's broader strategy of evolving its offerings beyond IT service management and expanding its partner ecosystem.

title: Absolute Software Appoints Andre Mintz to Board
summary: Absolute Software Corporation announced the appointment of Andre Mintz to its Board of Directors, effective August 5, 2021. Mintz brings over 30 years of experience in information security and cyber risk management, having previously served as CISO for Newport Group and holding key security roles at Red Ventures, Reuters, Microsoft, and Kinko's. His expertise is expected to be invaluable in accelerating Absolute's growth and expanding its portfolio of resilient security solutions.

title: Elastic Announces the General Availability of Elastic Agent, General Availability of Support for Microsoft Azure Private Link, and New Visualization Capabilities in Kibana
summary: Elastic (NYSE: ESTC) has announced general availability for Elastic Agent, centrally managed by Fleet, to simplify data onboarding and management in the Elastic Stack and Elastic Cloud. The company is also rolling out general availability of support for Microsoft Azure Private Link, enhancing data security for cloud deployments. Additionally, new visualization capabilities have been introduced in Kibana, including time-shifted metrics, custom formulas, and a time slider in Elastic Maps for improved ad hoc analytics.

title: QQQ Versus QQQJ: Who’s Winning the Battle?
summary: This article compares the performance of the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and the Invesco NASDAQ Next Gen 100 ETF (QQQJ). QQQ, which focuses on large-cap tech companies, has outperformed QQQJ, a mid-cap focused ETF, across various timeframes. Chad Morganlander of Washington Crossing Advisors favors QQQ due to its higher quality large-cap names and stronger balance sheets.

title: Microsoft improves marketing operations efficiency with Microsoft Power Automate
summary: Microsoft's Global Demand Center leveraged Microsoft Power Automate to significantly improve the efficiency of its marketing operations, reduce costs, and free up employee time for higher-level tasks. By automating standardized and repeatable tasks in Adobe Marketo Engage, the GDC achieved a 26% reduction in program build costs and saved thousands of employee hours, while expanding its scope to cover the entire commercial portfolio. The initiative demonstrates how intelligent automation can sustain growth and innovation while managing budget constraints, with future plans to expand these capabilities to field marketers.

title: Opinion | If You Paid Your Debt to Society, You Should Be Allowed to Work (Published 2021)
summary: Jamie Dimon, chairman and CEO of JPMorgan Chase, argues that individuals who have paid their debt to society should be allowed to work, highlighting that nearly half of formerly incarcerated people are unemployed one year after leaving prison. He advocates for removing financial, legal, and logistical barriers that prevent re-entry into the workforce and shares JPMorgan Chase's efforts, including banning the "box" on job applications and establishing a Second Chance hiring program. Dimon also mentions the formation of the Second Chance Business Coalition with other major companies to promote best practices in hiring people with criminal backgrounds.

title: Baxter Begins Collaboration with Amazon Web Services
summary: Baxter International Inc. is accelerating its digital transformation by collaborating with Amazon Web Services (AWS) across digital health solutions, customer experience, and technology modernization. This multi-year strategic agreement focuses on leveraging cloud technology to personalize patient care, enhance customer experiences, and modernize business processes, building on their existing work of migrating Baxter's data centers to the cloud. The transformation has already enabled advancements in home dialysis patient management with Sharesource and pharmacy workflow with DoseEdge, while also improving supply chain resilience during the pandemic.

title: Deal Of The Century: How Michael Dell Turned His Declining PC Business Into A $40 Billion Windfall
summary: Michael Dell orchestrated a massive comeback for his company, Dell Technologies, transforming it from a declining PC business into an IT infrastructure giant with a $40 billion windfall for investors and a personal net worth of $50 billion. Through strategic leveraged buyouts, including taking the company private in 2013 and acquiring EMC in 2016, Dell successfully pivoted towards data center infrastructure, cloud management services, and the "edge" market. His financial engineering acumen and willingness to take on debt, combined with a correct reading of technology industry trends, allowed him to reassemble his empire and spin off VMware, solidifying his position in enterprise technology.

title: News Corp bets big on data with $1.2 bln OPIS buy
summary: News Corp announced its acquisition of Oil Price Information Service (OPIS) and related assets from S&P Global and IHS Markit for $1.15 billion in cash. This strategic move aims to expand News Corp's energy, commodity, and renewables database, integrating OPIS into its Dow Jones' Professional Information Business. The deal, expected to close in Q4 2021, underscores News Corp's focus on data-driven growth.

title: Google’s upcoming plans for Israel: a server farm and fiber optics network
summary: Google is significantly expanding its operations in Israel following being awarded a government tender for cloud computing. This expansion includes establishing a server farm in the Sharon region and rolling out an ultra-high-speed fiber optics network, complementing its existing subsea cables. These investments aim to ensure maximum availability of Google's services, improve local internet infrastructure, and enhance Google's presence as a global telecommunications provider.

title: AudioCodes RXVCam10 Personal Cam Review
summary: The AudioCodes RXVCam10 personal webcam offers exceptional image clarity with 1080p full HD video and plug-and-play compatibility, making it ideal for today's remote and hybrid workers. It integrates seamlessly with a variety of UC platforms like Zoom and Microsoft Teams, as well as AudioCodes' own ecosystem, providing flexibility and ease of use. The camera features automatic light adjustment and a portable design, ensuring high-quality video in diverse working environments.

title: Even if India Inc calls their employees back, we are leaving it to our employees to decide: Rajiv Burman, S&..
summary: Rajiv Burman, People Lead - India at S&P Global, discussed his company's "People's First" approach and its impact on HR policies during the COVID-19 pandemic. He highlighted measures like technology allowances, rapid response teams, wellness programs, and special leave provisions. Burman also indicated S&P Global's plans to offer hybrid working options and allow employees to decide whether to return to the office, even if other Indian companies mandate it.

title: Vittorio Cretella left school at 17 to join the Italian Army. Now he’s CIO at Procter & Gamble.
summary: Vittorio Cretella, CIO of Procter & Gamble, discusses his unconventional career path from the Italian Army to leading digital transformation at the $300+ billion CPG company. He emphasizes the importance of diversity and inclusion in hiring, along with the pervasive role of digital transformation, machine learning, and cloud adoption in P&G's strategy. Cretella also highlights his work with NPower, a non-profit helping veterans and underserved youth find careers in tech, and P&G's neurodiversity hiring program.

title: Nice expands contact center AI offering with ContactEngine buy
summary: Nice acquired ContactEngine, a conversational AI technology provider, to enhance its CXone suite with natural language AI for customer self-service and proactive customer communications. This acquisition allows Nice to automate customer interactions, anticipate needs, and route calls more efficiently, especially benefiting field service management by automating site visit confirmations and rescheduling. The move is part of Nice's active acquisition strategy in the competitive cloud contact center platform sector.

title: $264.7 million building permit issued by West Des Moines for Microsoft Corp.'s newest data center project
summary: West Des Moines has issued a $264.7 million building permit for Microsoft Corp.'s newest data center project, Project Ginger West. This permit was part of over $499.2 million in commercial permits issued in the Des Moines area in June, contributing to over $1.3 billion in the first half of 2021. The new data center will be a 184,596-square-foot building on Microsoft's 188-acre campus.

title: Microsoft acquires Seattle startup Suplari, which uses AI to analyze corporate spending
summary: Microsoft has acquired Suplari, a Seattle-based startup that leverages artificial intelligence to help companies analyze and manage corporate spending effectively. Suplari's technology provides recommendations for cost savings and risk exposure by analyzing procurement and spending data, which Microsoft plans to integrate with its Dynamics 365 offering. This acquisition highlights the growing trend of using AI and machine learning to automate data-intensive financial processes.

title: Microsoft cloud strength fuels fourth quarter results
summary: Microsoft announced strong fourth-quarter and full fiscal year 2021 results, driven by significant growth in its commercial cloud revenue. The company reported substantial increases across revenue, operating income, net income, and diluted earnings per share, with key contributions from sectors like Office 365 Commercial, Azure, LinkedIn, and Dynamics 365. Microsoft also detailed its shareholder returns and provided insight into a non-GAAP adjustment related to a tax benefit in India.

title: BlackRock, Others Invest $450 Million on PsiQuantum
summary: PsiQuantum has secured $450 million in Series D funding led by Blackrock, with participation from Baillie Gifford, Quantum1 Group, M12 – Microsoft's venture fund, Blackbird Ventures, and Temasek. The Palo Alto-based company, which leverages a photonic approach to quantum computing, plans to use the funds to expand its team and build a 1 million-quantum-bit machine. This latest funding round brings PsiQuantum's total raised since 2016 to $665 million and values the company at $3.15 billion, making it one of the largest independent Quantum Technology companies.

title: Sparkline Launches Intangible Value ETF, ‘ITAN’
summary: Sparkline Capital has launched the Sparkline Intangible Value ETF (ITAN), an actively managed fund that evaluates companies based on their "intangible value." This value is derived from four pillars: intellectual property, brand equity, human capital, and network effects, integrated with tangible assets using machine learning. The fund aims to provide a modern interpretation of value investing by focusing on high-quality companies with strong intangible drivers of growth.

title: Corporations want to shake Microsoft Excel. It’s not so easy.
summary: CFOs are increasingly looking to replace Microsoft Excel due to weaknesses exposed by remote work, such as its unsuitability for certain tasks, time-consuming manual data entry, and unnoticed errors. While corporations are exploring automated platforms like SAP, Oracle, Anaplan, and Workiva, transitioning away from Excel is challenging due to implementation time, employee learning curves, and Excel's widespread adoption and integration within the Microsoft Office suite. Despite new alternatives, Excel's dominance continues to grow, making replacement an uphill battle for finance chiefs.

title: Tobi Lutke becomes Canada’s wealthiest company founder as Shopify shares soar
summary: Tobi Lutke, founder and CEO of Shopify Inc., has become Canada's wealthiest company founder as his stake in the e-commerce software provider reached US$13.3-billion. This surge in wealth is attributed to Shopify's stock crossing the $2,000 mark on the Toronto Stock Exchange and increasing optimism surrounding the company's second-quarter earnings. Analysts have raised their price targets for Shopify, anticipating its revenue to surpass US$1-billion for the first time in the June 30 quarter.

title: Better Buy: Invesco QQQ or Fidelity MSCI IT Index ETF
summary: This article compares the Invesco QQQ and Fidelity MSCI IT Index ETF, both strong technology-focused ETFs. While QQQ tracks the Nasdaq 100 and holds diverse sectors, the Fidelity ETF is a pure-play IT fund with broader diversification within the tech sector. The author concludes that the Fidelity ETF is the better buy due to its higher historical returns, lower expense ratio, and more consistent performance.

title: Rackspace Layoffs, Offshore Strategy Buried in 'Growth' Announcement -
summary: Rackspace Technology announced plans to invest up to $75 million in growth, while simultaneously conducting layoffs affecting 10% of its workforce and shifting job responsibilities offshore. The company's press release focused on growth and financial guidance, but an SEC filing revealed the "termination" of employees and the backfilling of roles in offshore service centers. This led to criticism of Rackspace's "overly ambitious PR spin" for obscuring the job cuts despite increasing financial forecasts.

title: Carter's Inc. Jeff Jenkins Shares How the Brand Is Bringing Childhood Dreams to Life
summary: Jeff Jenkins, EVP of Global Marketing at Carter's Inc., discusses his decision to join the brand due to a deep emotional connection to parenthood. He highlights Carter's latest campaign featuring younger versions of American icons, including Mariah Carey's daughter, Monroe. Jenkins also emphasizes the importance of a strong leadership team and shares insights on mentorship and brand history.

title: Internet down: What is Akamai as PSN and other sites go offline?
summary: A global internet outage impacted numerous major sites, including PlayStation Network and several UK banks, due to issues with content delivery network (CDN) Akamai. This outage follows a similar incident involving Fastly months prior, highlighting the critical role CDNs play in internet infrastructure. While the exact cause of Akamai's disruption was initially unclear, the company confirmed it was not a cyberattack and services were restored.

title: Microsoft acquires security start-up CloudKnox
summary: Microsoft announced its acquisition of CloudKnox, a security start-up that develops software to help companies manage and reduce access permissions to their cloud resources. This acquisition is part of Microsoft's broader strategy to expand its security business, which has seen over $10 billion in revenue in the prior 12 months. CloudKnox's software functions across Microsoft Azure, Amazon, and Google public clouds, identifying and removing unused permissions and flagging unusual activity to prevent security breaches.

title: Solarwinds Spin-Off N-able Goes Public With Clear Focus On MSP Mission
summary: N-able, a spin-off from SolarWinds, completed its IPO with a strong focus on empowering MSPs to serve small and medium enterprises. Despite N-able's shares falling post-IPO, former parent SolarWinds saw its share price rise. N-able aims to be a "rule of 50" company by prioritizing growth and investing in new technologies to better support its MSP partners.

title: Zoom to Acquire Five9: Turns its Focus on the Contact Center
summary: Zoom Video Communications Inc. (ZM.O) announced its acquisition of cloud software provider Five9 Inc. (FIVN.O) in an all-stock transaction valued at approximately $14.7 billion. This strategic move aims to diversify Zoom's business beyond its core video conferencing services by expanding into the contact center market. The acquisition is seen as a logical horizontal expansion for Zoom, leveraging Five9's cloud-native offerings and significant growth.

title: EU and China Announce Greenhouse Gas Reduction Plans
summary: The EU and China have announced significant plans to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The EU's plan involves cutting reliance on fossil fuels, imposing taxes on imports from high-emitting countries, and increasing renewable energy goals. China launched a domestic cap-and-trade style emissions market, doubling the global emissions covered under such a program.

title: Zoom to buy cloud-based call center operator Five9 in $15 bln deal
summary: Zoom Video Communications announced its largest-ever acquisition, an all-stock deal to buy cloud-based call center operator Five9 Inc for $14.7 billion. This strategic move aims to expand Zoom's offerings beyond video conferencing into the $24 billion contact center market, enhancing its presence with enterprise customers. The deal is expected to close in the first half of 2022, with Five9 becoming an operating unit of Zoom.

title: Focus: Getting the cap on the bottle: Inside P&G's robot ambitions
summary: Procter & Gamble (P&G) is using advanced robotics and automation to maintain its competitive edge in the consumer goods market by reducing manufacturing costs and improving efficiency. Despite being known for branding, P&G develops its own automation solutions, focusing on tasks like precise packaging and handling diverse product shapes. This push for automation is also driven by the need for social distancing during the pandemic and labor shortages, with P&G continuously exploring new robotic applications for its factories.

title: The Zoom-Five9 deal is a big bet for the video conferencing company
summary: Zoom has announced its intent to acquire Five9 for $14.7 billion, representing nearly 15% of Zoom's market capitalization. This acquisition is seen as a significant bet for Zoom to expand its offerings beyond video conferencing and tap into Five9's customer base, despite Five9's slower revenue growth compared to Zoom's core business. The deal aims to enhance total addressable market and create accretive value for both companies.

title: What Zoom's Acquisition Of Five9 Means For Enterprises
summary: Zoom's $14.7 billion acquisition of Five9, a cloud-based contact center, is its largest M&A deal to date. This move aims to enhance Zoom's enterprise offerings by integrating Five9's CCaaS platform with its UCaaS, creating a comprehensive customer engagement solution. The acquisition is expected to impact the contact center market, particularly for enterprises leveraging video integration for improved customer experience, while also raising questions about Five9's shareholder valuation.

title: Putting the ‘Q’ in NASDAQ: Quantum Computing Inc. Lists on Nasdaq Capital Market
summary: Quantum Computing Inc. (QCI) has announced its listing on the Nasdaq Capital Market, with common stock trading under the symbol QUBT set to commence on July 15, 2021. QCI aims to democratize quantum computing with its Qatalyst™ software, enabling businesses to solve complex problems without extensive quantum programming expertise. This Nasdaq listing is expected to boost QCI's profile, liquidity, and shareholder value in the investment community.

title: Rebranded N-able appoints new APAC director
summary: N-able, formerly SolarWinds MSP, has appointed Matthew Drake as its new senior sales director for the Asia Pacific (APAC) region. Drake will focus on expanding N-able's presence and supporting managed service provider (MSP) partners, taking over from Jamie Deveaux. He brings extensive experience from previous roles at Malwarebytes and Symantec.

title: NetApp Wins Microsoft’s Global Customer Experience Partner of the Year Award
summary: NetApp has been recognized with Microsoft's Global Customer Experience Partner of the Year Award, an honor that reflects the company's commitment to customer satisfaction and problem-solving over sales. The award acknowledges NetApp's data-driven approach, real-time innovation, and leadership in cloud offerings, as evidenced by extensive customer surveys and interviews. This recognition underscores NetApp's enduring partnership with Microsoft and its dedication to helping customers confidently navigate digital transformation.

title: ServiceNow Transforms Hybrid Work with New Solutions to Help Offices Reopen Smoothly
summary: ServiceNow announced updates to its Workplace Service Delivery solution to support hybrid work environments, offering consumer-grade employee experiences and real estate optimization. New features include intelligent reservation capabilities for workspaces, space utilization insights for facilities teams, and enhanced wayfinding through office maps. This aims to help companies smoothly reopen offices and manage flexible work models, as exemplified by ENMAX and ServiceNow's own implementation.

title: Microsoft says Israeli group sold tools to hack Windows
summary: Microsoft and Citizen Lab reported that an Israeli company called Candiru sold software tools to hack Microsoft Windows and other widely used software platforms like Google Chrome. These tools were allegedly used to target civil society organizations, including a Saudi dissident group and an Indonesian news outlet, in countries like Iran, Lebanon, Spain, and the UK. Both Microsoft and Google have since patched the vulnerabilities exploited by Candiru's tools.

title: Los Angeles Daily News - First Trust Nasdaq Cybersecurity ETF is now Available for Sale in Mexican Pension Plans.
authors: First Trust Advisors L.P. via Business Wire
summary: First Trust, a global ETF provider, announced that its Nasdaq Cybersecurity ETF (CIBR) has been approved by the Mexican pension funds investment regulator, CONSAR, for sale to Mexican funded pensions (AFORES). This approval means that CIBR, recognized as the world's largest cybersecurity ETF, can now be purchased within Mexican pension funds, expanding thematic investment opportunities for institutional investors in the region. The article also provides detailed risk disclosures for investing in the fund, including market volatility, non-diversification, and risks associated with cybersecurity companies and international investments.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Acquires RiskIQ to Strengthen Security Business
summary: Microsoft Corporation has acquired cybersecurity firm RiskIQ for an undisclosed amount, reportedly around $500 million. This acquisition aims to boost Microsoft's security business, which generated $10 billion in revenue earlier this year, by enhancing its cloud security offerings and protecting its applications from cyber threats. RiskIQ specializes in monitoring operations and security across cloud applications, and its integration will strengthen Microsoft's Azure cloud solution and overall security portfolio.

title: Teladoc Health and Microsoft Collaborate to Create a Unified Practice Experience for Clinicians
summary: Teladoc Health and Microsoft have partnered to integrate Teladoc Health’s Solo platform with Microsoft Teams, aiming to streamline virtual healthcare operations for clinicians and health systems. This collaboration will improve communication and workflow efficiency, allowing healthcare providers to deliver high-quality virtual care without leaving the Teams environment. The initiative seeks to unify clinical and administrative tasks, leveraging both companies' expertise in data and AI to enhance patient care and system efficiency.

title: SolidFire flickering out: Dave Wright exits NetApp for fintech
summary: SolidFire founder Dave Wright has left NetApp to become CEO of the fintech company The Reserve Trust Company (TRTC), based in Denver. NetApp acquired SolidFire in 2016 for $870 million, but the SolidFire technology has been largely overshadowed by NetApp's ONTAP platform. TRTC provides payment services to financial institutions and other fintechs and is backed by investors including QED and Temerity Capital Partners.

title: Microsoft and NEC expand strategic partnership to boost business resiliency and growth
summary: Microsoft and NEC announced an expanded strategic partnership to accelerate cloud adoption and digital transformation for enterprise and public sector customers. This collaboration will leverage Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, NEC's network and IT expertise including 5G, and both companies' AI and IoT solutions. NEC will also adopt Microsoft Azure as its preferred cloud platform and migrate its internal IT environment, aiming to double the number of digital-focused engineers skilled in Microsoft technologies within the NEC Group.

title: United Airlines is buying 100 new electric planes
summary: United Airlines is investing in electric aircraft startup Heart Aerospace and plans to purchase up to 100 ES-19 electric planes. These 19-seat aircraft are intended for short flights up to 250 miles, with service expected to begin by 2026. This move is part of United's goal to reduce its greenhouse gas emissions by 100 percent by 2050.

title: REPORTS: Microsoft to spend more than $200 million on data centers in San Antonio
summary: Microsoft is expanding its presence in San Antonio with plans to spend over $200 million on new data centers. The company has multiple data center buildings under construction or scheduled to begin soon, totaling millions of square feet and expected to be completed between 2022 and 2024. These developments are located in the Texas Research Park and on Wiseman Blvd.

title: China blocks Tencent’s US$5.3b merger of gaming giants Huya and Douyu
summary: China's antitrust regulator blocked Tencent's US$5.3 billion merger of gaming streamers Huya and Douyu, citing concerns about strengthened market dominance and restricted competition. Tencent already holds significant stakes in both companies and has a large share of the online game operations market in China. This decision marks a significant move by Chinese regulators to intensify scrutiny of monopolistic behavior in the country's tech sector.

title: CIBC Announces Multi-Year Agreement to Use Microsoft’s Cloud-Based Platform
summary: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC) has entered into a multi-year strategic agreement with Microsoft Corp. to utilize Microsoft Azure as its primary cloud platform, accelerating its digital transformation. This investment aims to enhance client-facing services, foster innovation in AI and machine learning, and strengthen data protection and security. CIBC will also gain access to Microsoft's training and certification programs to develop its talent.

title: How to Translate Your Website Into Other Languages and Why It’s Important
summary: This article emphasizes the importance of translating websites for software providers expanding into new international markets, noting that nearly 66% of buyers prefer content in their primary language. It discusses how advancements in AI and neural machine translation have improved the speed and quality of website translation, shifting the translator's role more toward editing. The piece also outlines various translation services and stresses the need for thorough editorial review to ensure cultural appropriateness and accuracy before a translated website goes live.

title: Oracle CEO Safra Catz underscores Israel support in Jerusalem data center launch
summary: Oracle CEO Safra Catz emphasized Oracle's strong support for Israel during the launch of a new data center in Jerusalem, despite the company losing a major cloud project tender to AWS and Google. Catz, an Israeli-born executive, stated that Oracle's commitment to Israel is unwavering and that employees who disagree with this mission might not be a fit for the company. She also expressed confusion regarding Oracle not being selected for Israel's $1 billion "Nimbus" cloud project.

title: LG swings battle for premium TV supremacy
summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has accelerated demand for premium TVs, with OLED TV shipments increasing significantly. LG Electronics has seen its share of the premium TV market rise to 28% by Q1, while Samsung's share declined. LG Display's OLED technology is driving this shift, with confidence in OLED's image quality, eye health benefits, and environmental advantages leading to continued market growth and diversification among TV manufacturers.

title: AvePoint (Nasdaq:AVPT) - Stock Analysis
summary: This Simply Wall St analysis provides an overview of AvePoint (AVPT), a cloud-native data management software platform. It highlights that the stock is currently undervalued, with strong forecasted earnings growth but also notes risks like insider selling and past shareholder dilution. The report details AvePoint's financial health, growth prospects, and recent news, positioning it as an essential provider for enterprise data governance.

title: HPE buys Israeli cloud data co Zerto for $374m
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has announced its acquisition of Israeli cloud data management and protection company Zerto for $374 million in cash. Zerto's technology, which includes disaster recovery, backup, and data mobility, will be integrated into HPE's GreenLake cloud data services. This acquisition is expected to contribute over $130 million in run-rate revenue to HPE.

title: AT&T to run core 5G network on Microsoft's cloud
summary: AT&T announced it will run core parts of its 5G wireless network on Microsoft's cloud computing platform, marking a significant win for Microsoft in the telecommunications sector. This partnership involves Microsoft purchasing software and intellectual property from AT&T and offering jobs to several hundred AT&T engineers. The move allows AT&T to leverage a larger ecosystem of software developers and will help Microsoft build its Azure for Operators product for telecommunications companies globally.

title: A lot of laid-off and furloughed workers launched startups last year, according to Salesforce
summary: A Salesforce survey revealed that a significant number of laid-off and furloughed workers launched startups in 2020, often out of necessity due to COVID-19 related job losses. These "pandemic entrepreneurs" frequently adopted digital-first methodologies, with many businesses being direct-to-consumer and operating with minimal initial capital. The trend contributed to a 24% increase in new small businesses created in 2020 compared to 2019.

title: Wejo Partners with Microsoft, Palantir Technologies and Sompo Holdings to Transform the Future of Connected Vehicle Data
summary: Wejo, a global leader in connected vehicle data, has partnered with Microsoft, Palantir Technologies, and Sompo Holdings to advance connected vehicle data applications worldwide. These partnerships aim to establish a manufacturer-agnostic industry standard for connected vehicle data, creating applications across various sectors and leveraging Microsoft Azure for data and intelligence solutions. Furthermore, Microsoft and Sompo have committed an additional $25 million investment as part of Wejo's $125 million PIPE financing, signaling strong support for Wejo's vision and public listing plans.

title: Salesforce Sells $8 Billion of Bonds to Fund Slack Acquisition
summary: Salesforce.com Inc. has completed an $8 billion bond sale to finance its $27.7 billion acquisition of Slack Technologies Inc. The debt offering, which saw more than $32 billion in orders, aims to expand Slack's reach within the corporate employee sector.

title: How Salesforce, Amazon, Google measure climate impact
summary: This article discusses how companies like Salesforce, Amazon, and Google are measuring their climate impact and the challenges involved. It highlights the increasing pressure on companies to demonstrate sustainability efforts through trusted data and metrics, moving beyond just reporting to actively using data to drive decarbonization. The piece also emphasizes the importance of internal communication, incentives, and policymaker involvement in achieving climate goals.

title: Nvidia’s takeover of Arm gets support from Broadcom and other chip heavyweights
summary: Broadcom, MediaTek, and Marvell have publicly expressed their support for Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm, despite scrutiny from antitrust regulators and concerns from rivals like Qualcomm, Google, and Microsoft. These chip heavyweights cite assurances from Nvidia regarding increased investment in Arm's technology and continued fair access for the industry. The support comes as Nvidia and Arm CEOs argue the deal is necessary to meet growing demand and accelerate technological roadmaps in the semiconductor industry amidst a global chip shortage.

title: Angela Heise Named Microsoft Defense and Intelligence Corporate VP
summary: Angela Heise, a veteran in IT and cybersecurity, has joined Microsoft's worldwide public sector organization as corporate vice president for defense and intelligence. She previously held leadership roles at Leidos and Lockheed Martin, overseeing various IT and cybersecurity initiatives for government and commercial clients. Heise also serves on the board of directors for Essent Guaranty.

title: Morgan Stanley introduces new fund in tie-up with Hearst, Microsoft and Walmart
summary: Morgan Stanley Investment Management, in collaboration with its Multicultural Strategy Group, has launched the Morgan Stanley Next Level Fund to back early-stage technology startups led by women or diverse members. Hearst, Microsoft, and Walmart are the initial investors in this fund, which aims to promote financial inclusion and access to capital for diverse founders. The initiative builds upon Morgan Stanley’s existing in-house start-up accelerator and seeks to partner with additional corporate organizations sharing similar strategic interests.

title: 10 Ways How RPA Can Boost Your Business
summary: This article details ten ways Robotic Process Automation (RPA) can boost businesses, highlighting its potential for cost reduction, improved efficiency, and accuracy. It explains how RPA automates repetitive tasks, freeing human employees for more critical work, and outlines specific benefits such as optimizing resource use, improving communication, and enhancing data security. The author emphasizes that organizations implementing RPA will gain a significant competitive advantage over those relying solely on human capital.

title: Queensland Treasury Corporation transforms finance through data and cloud overhaul
