summary: Queensland Treasury Corporation (QTC) modernized its financial management system using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance to improve data access and streamline processes. This transformation, including rapid deployment during the pandemic, led to more timely information, enhanced analytics, and increased automation, freeing up staff for more strategic work. QTC continues its Microsoft transformation journey, exploring Azure cognitive services and Azure Synapse Analytics for future efficiencies and a multi-cloud strategy.

title: How Cybersecurity Is Evolving Into a Durable, Disruptive Theme
summary: The article discusses the growing importance and durability of cybersecurity as a disruptive theme, highlighted by the strong performance of the WisdomTree Cybersecurity Fund (WCBR). Recent high-profile cyberattacks, such as on Colonial Pipeline and JBS Meats, underscore the necessity of increased cybersecurity spending. The author emphasizes that proactive investment in cybersecurity is more cost-effective than dealing with the aftermath of an attack, further solidifying the long-term thesis for the industry.

title: Unity acquires Pixyz Software
summary: Unity Technologies has acquired France-based Pixyz Software, a specialist in 3D data optimization, for an undisclosed sum. Pixyz's technology, which helps developers import and edit 3D models in real-time, will be integrated into Unity's Create segment, but will continue to charge a separate subscription. This acquisition is part of Unity's strategy to expand its business through targeted takeovers, enhancing its offerings for both gaming and industrial customers.

title: Form 6-K Infosys Ltd For: Jun 22
summary: Infosys Ltd. filed a Form 6-K with the SEC for June 22, 2021, detailing the outcome and transcript of its 40th Annual General Meeting (AGM) held on June 19, 2021. The AGM addressed strong financial performance, digital growth, capital allocation strategies including dividends and a buyback, and ESG initiatives, all discussed in the context of the challenging pandemic environment. Executives, including Chairman Nandan Nilekani and CEO Salil Parekh, provided overviews of the company's achievements, future vision, and responded to numerous shareholder questions covering a wide array of topics.

title: Mosquito Repellent Market Size & Forecast [Latest]
summary: The global mosquito repellent market was valued at USD 6.9 billion in 2021 and is projected to reach USD 9.0 billion by 2026, growing at a CAGR of 5.6%. This growth is driven by the rise in mosquito-borne diseases and increasing urbanization, particularly in developing countries. The market faces challenges related to stringent regulations on repellent products, but opportunities exist in the demand for herbal alternatives.

title: Reducing noise and bias in investing
summary: This article examines how broad-based ETFs can effectively reduce noise and bias in investing, drawing insights from the book "Noise: A Flaw in Human Judgment." It highlights that mechanical predictions are superior to human ones and that aggregating forecasts reduces noise. The author argues that diversified ETFs represent the aggregate forecasts of millions of market participants, offering a simple way to benefit from collective wisdom.

title: Sustainable equity ETFs cut Tesla, Microsoft, and Netflix
summary: Two of Australia's largest sustainable international equity ETFs, BetaShares Global Sustainability Leaders (ETHI) and VanEck Vectors MSCI International Sustainable Equity (ESGI), have divested from Tesla, Microsoft, and Netflix due to failures in ESG screens. These divestments highlight the active decisions passive sustainable funds can make based on rigorous environmental, social, and governance criteria, contrasting with Vanguard's Ethically Conscious International Shares ETF (VESG) which continues to hold these companies. The article examines the different screening methodologies used by these funds and their impact on holdings, performance, and diversification.

title: Will Intuitive Surgical Be a Trillion-Dollar Stock by 2031?
summary: This article analyzes whether Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) can achieve a trillion-dollar market capitalization by 2031. It compares Intuitive's current market cap and growth trajectory to trillion-dollar tech companies, noting its dominance in robotic surgery market but also potential challenges from rivals and revenue growth limitations. Although reaching $1 trillion is deemed unlikely, the author remains optimistic about Intuitive Surgical as a strong long-term investment for healthcare portfolios.

title: AudioCodes release Virtual Direct Routing Survivable Branch Appliance (DR-SBA)
summary: AudioCodes has released its Virtual Direct Routing Survivable Branch Appliance (DR-SBA), which can be deployed on VMware and Hyper-V platforms. This allows for virtual deployment of Microsoft Teams PSTN Voice survivability, enabling calling functionality even if the customer site loses its internet connection to Microsoft Teams services. The SBA feature supports Microsoft Teams Windows and macOS desktop clients, joining AudioCodes' existing physical SBCs and SBAs for Microsoft Teams.

title: Fargo-based Aldevron to be acquired for $9.6 billion by Danaher
summary: Aldevron, a Fargo-based biotechnology company specializing in plasmid DNA, mRNA, and proteins, is being acquired by Danaher Corp. for $9.6 billion. This acquisition will allow Aldevron to accelerate its development of genomic therapies and vaccines, while operating as a standalone company within Danaher's life sciences segment. The deal is significant for North Dakota, setting a new record for the corporate acquisition of a homegrown company.

title: Cloud ramp up weighs on Oracle's profit view, shares fall
summary: Oracle Corp's shares fell after the company forecast current-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates, heavily impacted by increased investments in its cloud computing business. The company plans to nearly double its capital spending on the cloud segment to take on rivals like Microsoft and Amazon, even as it sets up more data centers and wins high-profile customers like Zoom Video Communications. Despite beating fourth-quarter revenue and profit estimates, analysts still view Oracle as a niche player in the cloud market compared to leading infrastructure companies.

title: Renesas Extends Support for Microsoft Azure RTOS Across 32-bit MCU Families with Simple Licensing for Secure Embedded IoT Development
summary: Renesas Electronics announced extended support for Microsoft Azure Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) across its 32-bit MCU families, including RA, Synergy, and RX. This integration provides developers with access to Azure RTOS components like ThreadX and various middleware stacks, aiming to simplify secure embedded IoT development. The collaboration enhances the developer experience with pre-integrated project templates and leverages Renesas' Secure Crypto Engine for robust security.

title: New research shows social media has created a more
summary: New research from Sprout Social indicates that social media has intensified competition for brands, with 93% of marketers agreeing, but also serves as a critical tool for differentiation and staying ahead. The 2021 Sprout Social Index: Accelerate highlights that 90% of marketers rely on social data to gain a competitive edge, though few fully leverage this data for ROI measurement or business decisions. The study also reveals that while consumers expect strong customer service on social, marketers often deprioritize it, missing opportunities for engagement and bottom-line growth.

title: Understanding Ribbon Connect for Microsoft Teams Direct Routing
summary: This article examines Ribbon Connect for Microsoft Teams Direct Routing, a cloud-based service enabling hybrid telephony scenarios where users connect to both a PBX and Microsoft Teams Phone System. It details how the solution facilitates seamless call transfers and presence integration between these systems, addressing challenges for organizations that cannot fully migrate from their PBX. The article compares Ribbon Connect's architecture to traditional direct routing, highlighting its ability to preserve PBX functionalities while integrating Teams.

title: Palo Alto Networks Enhances Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM)
summary: Palo Alto Networks has updated its Prisma Cloud solution for Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) to help organizations eliminate cybersecurity blind spots and guard against alert fatigue. These enhancements include True Internet Exposure, Visibility-as-Code, Network Data Exfiltration Detection, Anomalous Compute Provisioning Detection, and Customizable Object-Level Scanning for AWS S3. The CSPM market is experiencing significant growth, with revenues projected to reach $9 billion by 2026, driven by the high susceptibility of organizations to security breaches due to cloud misconfigurations.

title: Vertical Aerospace to go public in $2.2 billion SPAC deal
summary: Vertical Aerospace, an eVTOL aircraft maker, is set to go public through a merger with a blank-check firm in a deal valued at $2.2 billion. The company has secured pre-orders for up to 1,000 aircraft from customers like American Airlines and Avolon, totaling up to $4 billion. This move reflects a growing investment in zero-emission electric aircraft amid pressure for the aviation sector to decarbonize.

title: Tableau's new CEO Mark Nelson on life inside Salesforce, and the company's future in Seattle
summary: Mark Nelson, the new CEO of Tableau Software, discusses the company's performance post-acquisition by Salesforce and its role within the larger enterprise technology landscape. He highlights Tableau's revenue growth, its collaboration with Salesforce in customer deals, and its continued commitment to Seattle as a key operational hub. Nelson also touches upon Tableau's competitive position against Microsoft and offers advice to Slack's CEO on integrating with Salesforce.

title: Sify Technologies recognized in 2020 Gartner Market Guide for Public Cloud Managed and Professional Services Providers, Asia/Pacific
summary: Sify Technologies Limited has been recognized in Gartner's 2020 Market Guide for Public Cloud Managed and Professional Services Providers in Asia/Pacific. This recognition highlights Sify's industry-leading cloud capabilities and its role as a key partner for enterprises in their cloud transformation goals across the diverse Asia Pacific region. The company emphasizes its cloud@core philosophy and integrated solutions for digital objectives and its contribution to APAC's digital evolution.

title: Zoom and Salesforce make quick $23 million profit after IPO of Israeli software vendor Monday.com
summary: Zoom and Salesforce each invested $75 million into Monday.com's IPO, quickly realizing a combined profit of $23 million as the stock jumped 15% on its debut day. This investment strategy is part of a larger trend for Salesforce Ventures, which has yielded significant gains from other IPOs like Snowflake, while Zoom is also beginning to use investments as a new business venture. Both companies are subject to a 180-day lock-up period before they can sell their shares.

title: How Microsoft is reimagining meetings for hybrid work
summary: Microsoft is transforming its internal meeting experiences for hybrid work by redesigning physical and virtual spaces and leveraging Microsoft Teams. The company identified key trends like employees evaluating their "worth it" equation for commuting and the need for leaders to make the office commute-worthy. Through prototyping in "the Hive," Microsoft developed an innovative meeting room experience that puts all participants, remote and in-person, on equal footing, enabling seamless collaboration for its employees and customers.

title: VERB Management to Discuss Company’s Application Solutions
summary: Verb Technology Company, Inc. announced that its CEO and CFO will discuss the company's application solutions for the livestream ecommerce market at an A.G.P. Tech Talk webinar on June 10, 2021. The discussion will cover the growth of livestream ecommerce, the upcoming integration of VERB's video sales technology with Microsoft Outlook, and the company's strong Q1 2021 financial performance, including 38% year-over-year SaaS recurring revenue growth. This webinar aims to highlight VERB's position to capitalize on the growing livestream ecommerce market with its interactive video sales enablement SaaS applications.

title: Dell announces new AMD-based Integrated Systems for Azure Stack HCI
summary: Dell Technologies Inc. has launched new AMD-based configurations for its Dell EMC Integrated Systems for Microsoft Azure Stack HCI, designed to handle more complex workloads and offer enhanced performance. These systems feature AMD EPYC 2nd generation CPUs and incorporate advanced security features from both AMD and Dell. Additionally, software updates aim to simplify provisioning and delivery tasks for IT engineers by pre-installing the Azure Stack HCI operating system and integrating OpenManage software with Microsoft Windows Admin Center.

title: Q2 Appoints New Chief Revenue Officer
summary: Q2 Holdings, Inc. announced the appointment of Mike Volanoski as its new Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) for North America. Volanoski brings over 25 years of experience from companies like SAP and Microsoft, and will be responsible for driving Q2's growth strategy and new customer acquisition. Matt Flake, Q2 CEO, highlighted Volanoski's expertise in building world-class sales organizations and fostering relationships.

title: Campbell Soup Company: Greater Disclosure of Material Corporate Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Data
summary: Shareholders are requesting that Campbell Soup Company report on the effectiveness of its diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts using quantitative metrics for recruitment, retention, and promotion. The resolution highlights the lack of publicly available data from Campbell's, specifically the consolidated EEO-1 form and inclusion data, which prevents investors from fully assessing the company's human capital management related to workplace diversity. The request emphasizes the investor demand for greater transparency in workplace equity data, citing previous investor statements and the practices of other S&P100 companies.

title: Force of nature: How the unstoppable Marc Benioff fueled Salesforce’s stratospheric rise
summary: Marc Benioff, cofounder and CEO of Salesforce, has driven his software company to remarkable growth, fueled by ambitious acquisitions like the $28 billion Slack deal. The article explores how Benioff utilizes his celebrity status and platforms to advocate for causes beyond business, such as homelessness and climate change, while navigating challenges like employee diversity concerns and investor skepticism regarding his acquisition strategy. Despite his unconventional approach, Benioff's relentless vision and ability to inspire continue to shape Salesforce's trajectory and influence the tech industry.

title: Microsoft’s Irish subsidiary posted £220bn profit in single year | Tax havens
summary: Microsoft's Irish subsidiary, Microsoft Round Island One, recorded a profit of $315 billion (£222 billion) in a single year, which is nearly three-quarters of Ireland's GDP, despite having no employees other than directors. The company is resident for tax purposes in Bermuda, which has no corporation tax, allowing it to pay no tax on income. This news emerged as G7 finance ministers discussed global minimum corporate tax rates to combat multinational tax avoidance.

title: Morgan Stanley and Microsoft collaborate to accelerate cloud transformation - Source
summary: Morgan Stanley and Microsoft have announced a strategic cloud partnership to accelerate Morgan Stanley's digital transformation and advance innovation in the financial services industry. This collaboration will leverage Microsoft Azure and Morgan Stanley's engineering teams to develop new application infrastructure meeting key financial services requirements, improve employee and developer experiences, and transition workloads to Microsoft Azure. The partnership aims to enhance client services, increase developer effectiveness, and ensure stringent compliance and regulatory guidelines are met in the highly regulated financial sector.

title: How Coca-Cola United Streamlined Freestyle Order Management
summary: Coca-Cola Bottling Company United partnered with Happiest Minds Technologies to streamline its Freestyle order management process using Microsoft Power Automate RPA bots. This digital transformation, built on Microsoft Azure and Power Platform, allowed the company to avoid hiring additional full-time employees and freed up existing CRM agents for other projects. The automated system orchestrates the entire order process from purchase order to reconciliation in SAP, securely accessing internal and external systems.

title: Qualcomm supplying new Snapdragon chips locally
summary: Qualcomm Inc. is expanding its presence in the computer market by supplying new Snapdragon processors for 5G-enabled laptops, partnering with local companies like Acer Inc. The company aims to challenge Intel Corp. and transfer mobile applications to laptops, targeting various tiers of notebooks. Qualcomm also revealed its acquisition of Nuvia Inc. for about US$1.4 billion, enhancing its CPU and technology design capabilities.

title: KKR, CD&R take data analytics firm Cloudera private for $4.7 bln
summary: Private equity firms Clayton Dubilier & Rice LLC (CD&R) and KKR & Co (KKR.N) are taking cloud-based data analytics company Cloudera Inc (CLDR.N) private for $4.7 billion. Cloudera's shares jumped 23.9% following the announcement, nearing the offer price of $16 per share. The move is intended to help Cloudera transition more smoothly into hybrid cloud solutions without the pressure of quarterly reporting.

title: Cloudera Enters into Definitive Agreement to be Acquired by Clayton, Dubilier & Rice and KKR for $5.3 Billion
summary: Cloudera announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to be acquired by affiliates of Clayton, Dubilier & Rice ("CD&R") and KKR in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $5.3 billion. Shareholders will receive $16.00 per share, representing a 24% premium to the closing price as of May 28, 2021. The transaction is expected to close in the second half of 2021 and will result in Cloudera becoming a private company, aiming to accelerate its hybrid cloud leadership for analytics.

title: Woodside empowers all employees to build apps, boosts safety, increase productivity
summary: Woodside Energy, Australia's leading natural gas producer, has empowered its 3,500 employees to develop apps using Microsoft's Power Platform. This initiative has improved efficiency, automated manual processes, and boosted safety through apps managing tasks from shift handovers to cyclone response planning. The company has a governance structure in place for app development, balancing innovation with security and quality control.

title: Yes, You Can Invest in a Tech-Less Nasdaq-100
summary: The article discusses the First Trust NASDAQ-100 Ex-Technology Sector Index Fund (QQXT), an ETF that allows investors to gain exposure to the Nasdaq-100 without the heavy technology sector allocation. This fund offers diversification away from tech and communication services while still providing growth potential and has historically outperformed the S&P 500 with less volatility. QQXT is presented as a compelling option for investors seeking growth outside of traditional tech-heavy portfolios.

title: Microsoft Gold Partner, Mannai Corporation launches dedicated unit to accelerate digital transformation across Qatar
summary: Mannai Corporation, a Microsoft Gold partner, has established a new division dedicated to Microsoft solutions to accelerate cloud technology adoption across Qatar, aligning with the National Vision 2030. This move anticipates the launch of Microsoft's new Qatar cloud region, with IDC projecting a significant increase in public cloud service spending in the region. The new division comprises over 90 skilled professionals aiming to assist public and private sectors in their digital transformation journeys.

title: Internet Banking Market Likely To Boost Future Growth By 2026 |
summary: A new report on the Global Internet Banking Market provides a comprehensive 360-degree view of customer activities, segment-based analytics, and future outlook to 2026. The study by HTF Market Intelligence Consulting Pvt. Ltd. identifies growth drivers, disruptive trends, and R&D efforts by key competitors, including Microsoft, Tata Consultancy Services, Oracle, and Fiserv. The market is segmented by applications like Payments and Risk Management, and types such as Retail banking and Corporate banking, with regional analysis covering North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, South America, and MEA.

title: SailPoint Appoints Wendy Wu as Chief Marketing Officer
summary: SailPoint Technologies Holdings, Inc. announced the appointment of Wendy Wu as Chief Marketing Officer to support its continued growth and SaaS transition. Wu brings over 20 years of experience in B2B enterprise marketing from companies like Box, Google, and Microsoft. She will focus on accelerating SailPoint's brand and market position, emphasizing identity security as a crucial component for digital transformation.

title: SailPoint Welcomes Wendy Wu as Chief Marketing Officer
summary: SailPoint Technologies Holdings, Inc. announced the appointment of Wendy Wu as Chief Marketing Officer to support its continued growth and accelerated pivot towards SaaS. Wu brings over 20 years of B2B enterprise marketing experience from companies like Box, Google, and Microsoft. Her role will focus on driving brand awareness and business growth for the SailPoint Identity Platform worldwide, especially as enterprises recognize identity security's importance for digital transformation.

title: Microsoft teams up with Accenture and Goldman Sachs to create energy efficient software
summary: Microsoft, Accenture, and Goldman Sachs, along with other organizations, are forming the Green Software Foundation to develop and share methods for creating software that produces fewer carbon emissions in data centers. Data centers currently account for about 1% of global electricity demand, projected to rise significantly, prompting the need for "green software engineering" skills. The foundation aims to build tools, establish standards for measuring software's climate impact, and provide training for engineers.
